content:
いれる〔容れる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=収容する)to accommodate; to admit; to take in; to hold; to seat

content.content: あの病院は五百名の患者をいれる設備がある
That hospital can accommodate 500 patients.
そこには外賓をいれる旅館があるか
Is there a hotel there that accommodates foreigners?
この劇場は五千人の観客をいれるに足る
The theater can accommodate 5,000 spectators.
一万人をいれる会堂が欲しい
We want a hall capable of holding 10,000 men―capable of seating 10,000 men.
人を社交界へいれる
to admit a person into society
港内は水深く大船をいるることを得
The harbour is deep, and admits large ships.
まだいれる場所があるか
Is there room for more?
もういれる場所が無い
There is no room for more.

content: 2. (=容認する)to admit (a fact); to grant (a request); to comply with (one's demands); to adopt (one's views); to acquiesce in (one's opinion); to listen to (counsel); to accept (an offer)

content.content: 人の言をいれる
to admit the truth of one's statement
人の説をいれる、意見をいれる
to adopt one's views―acquiesce in one's opinion
彼は意見をいれられないので辞職した
His views not being adopted, he resigned his post.
彼は頑として人の説をいれぬ
He is impervious to argument.
彼の説は世にいれられなかった
His views were not appreciated by the public.
人の忠言をいれる
to take one's advice―follow one's advice―act upon one's advice―listen to counsel
彼は人の忠言をいれぬ
He is deaf to counsel.
諫言をいれる
to listen to expostulation
彼は僕の諫言をどうしてもいれなかった
He would not listen to my expostulations―He turned a deaf ear to my expostulations.
歎願をいれる
to listen to entreaty
彼はどうしても僕の歎願をいれなかった
He would not listen to my entreaties―He turned a deaf ear to my entreaties―He was deaf to entreaty―He was inexorable.
乞いをいれる
to grant a request―comply with one's request
彼は快く僕の乞いをいれた
He readily complied with my request.
乞いをいれぬ
to refuse a request
要求をいれる
to admit a claim―comply with one's demands
要求をいれなけりゃ退会する
If they will not comply with my demands, I will withdraw from the society.
人の提供をいれる、 いれぬ
to accept an offer―decline an offer

content: 3. (=包容する)to tolerate (a man); to comprehend (a man); to entertain (a man) in one's heart

content.content: 彼は人を容れる雅量がある
He has a capacity for tolerance.
人をいれない
He is intolerant―He has no tolerance.
彼は反対派の人をいれるから感心だ
It is his credit that he can comprehend men of opposite views.
彼は清濁ともにいれる
He tolerates the pure and impure―entertains all men in his heart.
天才は世にいれられぬ
Genius is not appreciated by the world.
彼は常に社会にいれられなかった
He was always shut out from society―left out in the cold.
相いれぬ
to be contradictory to each other―antagonistic to each other―preclusive of each other
二人の説は相いれぬ
Their statements are contradictory to each other―Their views are antagonistic to each other.
君主主義と社会主義とは氷炭相いれぬ
Monarchism is antagonistic to socialism.
罪悪と幸福とは氷炭相いれぬ
Sin is preclusive of happiness.
火と水は相いれぬ
Fire and water can not come together.
彼と僕とは火と水の如く相いれぬ
He and I are fire and water.
疑いをいるる
to admit of doubt
証拠は疑いをいるる余地あり
The evidence admits of doubt―It is open to doubt.
疑いをいるる余地無し
It admits of no doubt―There is no room for doubt.
間髪をいれず
It is instantaneous―I had a hairbreadth escape―The bullet missed me by a hair's breadth.

content:
いろ〔色〕
〈名〉
1. A colour; a tint; a hue

content.content: 濃い色
a deep colour―a dark colour
淡い色
a light colour
鮮やかな色
a bright colour
目の覚めるような色
a fresh colour
派手な色
a gay colour―a loud colour
けばけばしい色
a gaudy colour―a glaring colour
渋い色
a quiet colour
色がさめる
A colour fades―A colour flies―A colour goes off.
この布は色がさめる
This cloth will lose colour.
色がさめぬ
A colour holds fast.
この色は洗ってもさめない
This colour will wash―This colour will stand washing.
さめる色
a fading colour―a fugitive colour
さめない色
an unfading colour―a fast colour
色が変わる
to change in colour
色をつける
to colour―paint
色がつく
to colour
茶に色をつける
to face tea
話に色をつける
to embellish a story
(これではあまり少ないから)何とか色をつけて下さい
I wish you would make it a little more.
色を出す
to bring out the colour
色が出る
The colour comes out.
色を暈{ぼ}かす
to shade off the colour―grade the colour―gradate the colour
色を取合わせる
to match colours
色を帯ぶ
to be tinged with a hue
色と香
hue and scent
色ガラス
coloured glass―stained glass―flashed glass
色眼鏡
tinted glasses―(偏見の意味なら)―coloured spectacles
色眼鏡で見る
to look at things through coloured spectacles
色鉛筆
a crayon
色金巾
dyed shirtings

content: 2. (=顔の色)a complexion:(喜色、憂色の色)a countenance; a look; an air

content.content: 色が白い、色が黒い
He has a fair complexion―a dark complexion.
色の浅黒い苦味走った好い男だ
He is a dark handsome man.
その女は色がクッキリ白い
She has a dazzling white complexion.
色の白いのは七難隠す
A white complexion covers a multitude of sins.
潮風に吹かれてお色が真黒で
He has a weather-beaten face.
俗説に茶を飲むと色が黒くなると言う
It is a common saying that tea darkens the complexion.
思うことを色に表わす
to betray one's emotions
喜怒哀楽を色に表わさず
He never betrays his emotions―He has a perfect self-command―He is stoical.
愕然として色を失う
He changed colour―turned pale―in alarm.
彼は色を正して主人を諫めた
He seriously expostulated with his master.
目の色を変えて怒った
He was white with anger.
彼の顔は喜びの色を帯びている
He has a glad countenance―a joyful look.
彼女の顔は憂いの色を帯びている
She has a melancholy air―a pensive air.

content: 3. (=男女間の色)love; sexual passion; carnal desire; sensual pleasure

content.content: 色を好む
to be amorous―lascivious―licentious―lecherous―lickerish―lewd―lustful―goatish
英雄色を好む
The brave are susceptible to female charms.
色にふける
to be addicted to sensual pleasures―addicted to debauchery
色に迷う
to be captivated by one's beauty―enchanted with a woman―smitten with one's charms
色を売る
to sell one's favours
とかく浮世は色と酒
Wine and woman rule the world.
色事
a love affair―an amour
色話
love talk―a love story
色文
a love-letter―a billet-doux
女が色仕掛で男をだます
A woman cheats a man under the mask of love.
色気違い
erotomania―(男のは)―satyriasis―(女のは)―nymphomania
色目を使う
(男なら)to ogle a girl―(女なら)―make eyes at a man
色町、色里
gay quarters

content: 4. (=情人)a love; a sweetheart:(男は)a lover:(女は)a mistress

content.content: あの女は色がある
She has a lover.―She walks out with a man.
あの人は色がある
He has a sweetheart.
色にゃ好いけど女房に持つな(芸者上がりの浮気者)
Have her for a sweetheart, but not for a wife.
昔色
an old flame
岡ぼれ三年色の中
Three years of unrequited love will entitle one to be loved.

content: 5. (=種類)a kind

content.content: 二色
two kinds
十人十色
So many men, so many minds―No two men are alike.
だが医者にもいろいろある
But there are doctors and doctors.

content:
いろあい〔色合〕
〈名〉A colour; a tone of colour

content.content: この色合は真似ができない
The tone of colour is inimitable.

content:
いろあげ〔色揚げ〕
〈名〉Restoration of colour:(=する) to restore the colour; to redye

content.content: 痴話げんかは恋の色揚げ
Lovers' quarrels are so many renewals of love.

content:
いろいろ〔色々〕
〈形〉Various; several; diverse; divers; sundry; all sorts of various kinds of; many varieties of:(=に) in various ways

content.content: 海にはいろいろの魚がいる
All sorts of fish are found in the sea.
動物園にはいろいろの動物がいる
There are various animals in the Zoological Gardens.
菊にはいろいろある
There are many varieties of chrysanthemum.
彼はあなたのことをいろいろ尋ねました
He asked me several questions about you.
いろいろと慰めてみたが駄目だった
I tried in various ways to comfort her, but in vain.
だが医者にもいろいろある
But there are doctors and doctors.
いろいろと手を尽してみた
I have tried every means in my power.
品物いろいろ取り揃え有之候
We have a large assortment of goods in stock.
いろいろお手数をかけました
I have caused you a lot of trouble.
僕はいろいろ心配事がある
My mind is oppressed with doubts and anxieties.

content:
いろいろさまざま〔色々様々〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: いろいろ〔色々〕

content:
いろう〔慰労〕
〈名〉Acknowledgement of service:(=する) to acknowledge one's services; to recognize one's services

content.content: 慰労会を開く
A dinner is given in recognition of one's services.
慰労休暇を与える
to grant a holiday in recognition of one's services
慰労金
a reward for one's services

content:
いろう〔遺漏〕
〈名〉Omission

content.content: 遺漏無く
without omission―exhaustively
遺漏無く研究する
to make an exhaustive study of a subject
遺漏無く論ずる
to exhaust a subject

いろえんぴつ〔色鉛筆〕
〈名〉A crayon

content:
いろおとこ〔色男〕
〈名〉
1. (=情夫)a lover; a paramour; a fancy-man; a sweetheart; a love

content.content: あの女は色男がある
She has a lover.
亭主のある女が色男をこしらえる
A wife deceives her husband.

content: 2. (=好男子)a beau; a gallant; a lady's man; a lady-killer; a favourite with the ladies; an Adonis

content.content: 色男ぶる
to set up for a beau
あれはなかなかの色男だ
He is a great favourite with the ladies.
色男金と力は無かりけり
A beau is proverbially destitute of money and strength.
色男頼むぜ
What a lady-killer you are!
(火傷などをして)色男台無し
It has spoiled his beauty―It has not improved his looks.

いろおんな〔色女〕
〈名〉A mistress; a sweetheart; a love; a lady-love

content:
いろか〔色香〕
〈名〉(A beauty's) charms, roses, attractions

content.content: 彼は女の色香に迷っている
He is smitten with her charms.
美人は色香が失せる
A beauty loses her charms―loses her roses.
年をとっても色香が失せぬ
Age can not rob her of her charms―She is well conserved.

いろかなきん〔色金巾〕
〈名〉Dyed shirtings

いろがらす〔色硝子<色ガラス>〕
〈名〉Coloured glass; stained glass; flashed glass

いろがらす〔色硝子<色ガラス>〕
〈名〉Coloured glass; stained glass; flashed glass

content:
いろきちがい〔色気違い〕
〈名〉Erotomania:(男のは)satyriasis:(女のは)nymphomania

content.content: あれは色気違いだ
He is a satyr―She is a nymphomaniac.

content:
いろけ〔色気〕
〈名〉
1. (=色合)a colour; a tone of colour

content.content: この色気はまねができぬ
The tone of colour is inimitable.

content: 2. (=色情)sexual love; sexual passion; amorousness

content.content: あの娘は色気たっぷりだ
She is quite amorous.
色気が無い
She is impassive―innocent.
女が男を色気のある目つきで見た
She cast an amorous glance on him.
色気がつく
to arrive at (the age of) puberty―begin to know the sexes
あの子はもう色気がついている
She knows the sexes already.
日本人は早く色気がつく(と西洋人言う)
Japanese are precocious―Japanese know the sexes early.
色気のついた若者
a pubescent youth
色気より食い気
Pudding rather than love-making.
色気抜きの宴会
a drinking-party free from female charms―a party without softening elements―a banquet without geisha
色気抜きに飲もうじゃないか
Let us have wine without woman!

content: 3. (=何かしたい気)inclination

content.content: 彼はこの仕事に色気たっぷりだ
He is inclined to undertake the work―disposed to undertake the work.
彼はあの地位に色気があるのだ
He has an eye to the position.

content: 4. (=風流)romance; poetry

content.content: 色気のある役
a romantic part
色気の無い役
an unromantic part―a prosaic part
それでは色気が無さ過ぎる
That would be too unromantic―too unpoetical―too prosaic.
色気が無いなー
How prosaic!
金銭の話をすると色気が無くなる
When one begins to talk of money, the romance is gone.

content:
いろけし〔色消し〕
〈名〉
1. ［物理］Anachromatism
2. (=興をさますもの)a kill-joy; a spoil-sport; a skeleton at the feast:(=の) unromantic; prosaic

content.content: 色消しをする
to spoil the sport―spoil the fun
あの人は宴会の色消しだ
He is a skeleton at the feast.
宴会の長演説は色消しだ
A long-winded speech at a dinner is a kill-joy.
色消しな話だがいくらかかるだろう
Excuse my introducing a prosaic matter, but what will it cost?
金銭の話をすると色消しだ
When one begins to talk of money, all romance is gone.

content:
いろけづく〔色気付く〕
〈自動〉To arrive at (the age of) puberty

content.content: あの子はもう色気づいている
She knows the sexes already.
日本人は早く色気づく
Japanese are precocious.
色気づいた若者
a pubescent youth

いろごと〔色事〕
〈名〉A love affair; a love intrigue; an amour; a romance

いろざし〔色差し〕
〈名〉
1. Colour; colouring
2. (=顔の色差し)a complexion

content:
いろざと〔色里〕
〈名〉A gay quarter

content.content: 色里へ通う
to frequent gay quarters

content:
いろじかけ〔色仕掛〕
〈名〉Pretence of love

content.content: 女が色仕掛で男をだます
A woman fools a man under pretence of love―under colour of love―under the mask of love.

content:
いろづく〔色付く〕
〈自動〉To colour; to become coloured; to become tinged; to put on a colour

content.content: 紅葉が色づく
The maple-leaves turn crimson.

いろつけ〔色付け〕
〈名〉Colouring:(=する) to colour ; to paint; to dye

content:
いろっぽい〔色っぽい〕
〈形〉Amorous (girl); fascinating (maiden); voluptuous (woman)

content.content: 色っぽい話だ
It is a voluptuous story.

content:
いろつや〔色艶〕
〈名〉
1. (=光沢)lustre; polish; gloss

content.content: この生糸は色つやが好い
This silk has a fine lustre.
この馬は色つやが好い
The horse has a glossy skin.
黒檀は色つやが出る
Ebony takes on a good polish.

content: 2. (=顔の色つや)a complexion

content.content: 色つやが好い、色つやが悪い
She has a good complexion―a bad complexion.
年にしては色つやが好い
She is well conserved.

content:
いろどめ〔色留め〕
〈名〉Fixing of colours:(=する) to fix colours

content.content: 色留め薬
a mordant

content:
いろどり〔色取り〕
〈名〉Colouring; colouration; painting:(=する) to colour; to paint

content.content: この絵の色どりが好い
The colouring of the picture is well done.

いろどる〔色取る〕
〈他動〉To colour; to paint

content:
いろは〔伊呂波〕
〈名〉The Japanese syllabary; the Japanese alphabet:(より)the elements, the rudiments, the A B C (of anything)

content.content: いろはのいの字も知らぬ
They are absolutely illiterate―grossly ignorant.
いろはから習う
to begin one's studies with the alphabet
恋のいろは
the A B C of love

いろばなし〔色話〕
〈名〉Love talk; a love story

いろぶみ〔色文〕
〈名〉A love-letter; a billet-doux

content:
いろまち〔色町〕
〈名〉A gay quarter

content.content: 色町へ通う
to frequent gay quarters

content:
いろめ〔色目〕
〈名〉(Amorous) oglings; amorous glances; soft glances

content.content: 色目を使う
(男なら)to ogle a girl―leer at a neighbour wife―cast sheep's eyes at a woman―(女なら)―make eyes at a man

いろめかしい〔色めかしい〕
〈形〉Coquettish (girl); voluptuous (woman)

content:
いろめがね〔色眼鏡〕
〈名〉Tinted glasses:(偏見の意見なら)coloured spectacles

content.content: 目の弱い人は色眼鏡をかける
People with weak eyes wear tinted glasses.
色眼鏡で見る
to look at things through coloured spectacles

content:
いろめく〔色めく〕
〈自動〉
1. (=色づく)to colour; to become coloured; to become tinged
2. (=なまめく)to coquet; to be coquettish; to be voluptuous
3. (=活気づく)to liven up; to be enlivened; to become active; to show signs of activity

content.content: 政界が色めいて来た
The political world begins to show signs of activity.
汽船が入港すると港が色めく
The arrival of a steamer enlivens the port.

content: 4. (=動揺する)to be agitated; to be fluttered

content.content: その結婚の噂で婦人界が色めいた
The rumour of the marriage caused a flutter among the ladies.
戦争が始まると株式界が色めきわたった
The outbreak of war agitated the stock-market.

content: 5. (=負け色を表わす)to give way; to waver

content.content: 敵が色めいてきた
The enemy begins to waver.

content:
いろよい〔色好い〕
〈形〉Favourable (answer)

content.content: 色好い返事をする
to give one a favourable answer
色好い返事を待っている
I await a favourable answer.

content:
いろり〔囲炉裏〕
〈名〉A hearth; a fireplace; the fire

content.content: 囲炉裏に鍋をかける
to put a pot over the fire
囲炉裏の火に当たる
to warm oneself at the fire
囲炉裏の廻りに車座をなす
to sit around the fire

いろわけ〔色分け〕
〈名〉Classification:(=する) to classify; to sort

いろわけちず〔色分け地図〕
〈名〉A coloured map

content:
いろん〔異論〕
〈名〉An objection; a protest; a demurrer

content.content: 異論を唱える
to object to―make objections to―raise objections to―take exception to―demur to―protest against―a measure
異論を申立てる
to make a protest against―enter a protest against―lodge a protest against―file a protest against―a measure
僕はこの処置に対して異論は無い
I have no objection to the measure.

content:
いわ〔岩〕
〈名〉(A) rock; a crag

content.content: 岩の多い山
a rocky mountain
(山から掘らない)天然の岩
a living rock
岩まで掘り下げる
to dig down to the living rock
岩角
a projecting rock―a jutting rock
忍耐は岩をも通す
“Patience wears out stones. ”

content:
いわい〔祝い〕
〈名〉
1. Congratulation; felicitation; a celebration; a f?te; a festival; festivities; rejoicings; greetings; good wishes:(=の) congratulatory; festival:(=に) in honour of (the occasion)

content.content: 新年のお祝い
the celebration of the New Year―the New Year's festivities―(述べる祝いなら)―the New Year's greetings
婚礼の祝い
marriage festivities
戦勝のお祝いがあった
There were rejoicings over the victory.
新宅祝いをする
to give a house-warming
お祝いを申し上げます
I offer you my congratulations―I wish you joy.
これはほんのお祝いのおしるしです
This is a slight token of my good wishes.
今晩はお祝いに飲み明かそうじゃないか
Let us make a night of it in honour of the occasion.
ご安着のお祝いに祝宴を開きます
We shall hold a banquet in honour of your arrival.

content: 2. (=祝い物)a congratulatory present

content.content: お祝いのつもりだから取って下さい
Please accept it, for it is intended for a congratulatory present.
結婚のお祝いを贈る
to make one a wedding gift

いわいごと〔祝い事〕
〈名〉A joyful event; a joyful occasion; an auspicious occasion

いわいび〔祝い火〕
〈名〉A bonfire

いわいび〔祝い日〕
〈名〉A f?te-day; a holiday; a festival

いわいもの〔祝い物〕
〈名〉A congratulatory present

content:
いわう〔祝う〕
〈他動〉To congratulate (one on one's success); to wish (one) joy (of the occasion); to celebrate, commemorate (an event); to solemnize, keep (a festival); to rejoice over (a victory)

content.content: 人の成功を祝う
to congratulate one on one's success―wish one joy of one's success
新年を祝う
to celebrate the New Year
貴賤の別なく新年を祝う
High and low celebrate New Year's Day―New Year's Day is kept as a festival by high and low.
クリスマスを祝う
to keep one's Christmas
戦勝を祝う
to celebrate a victory―rejoice over a victory
縁起を祝う、幸先を祝う
to rejoice over a good omen―wish one ［oneself］good luck
道中の幸先を祝う
to wish one a safe journey
彼の安着を祝って宴会を開いた
A banquet was held in honour of his arrival.
雑煮を祝う
to eat the New Year's dish

content:
いわえる〔結える〕
〈他動〉To tie; to bind; to fasten

content.content: 紐をいわえる
to tie the strings
紐でいわえる
to fasten with a string
手足をいわえる
to bind one hand and foot
縄を柱にいわえる
to fasten a rope to a post

content:
いわかど〔岩角〕
〈名〉A projecting rock; a jutting rock

content.content: 木の根岩角をよじ登る
to climb by root and rock

content:
いわく〔曰く〕
〈自動〉To say

content.content: 子曰く
Confucius says...
曰く言い難し

The beautiful is higher than the good.
甲は乙より腕前が上だ
The one is superior to the other in ability.

content: 2. (=以上)above; over; more than:(年齢なら)older than

content.content: 入費は千円の上に出る
The expenses are above 1,000 yen―over 1,000 yen―more than 1,000 yen―The expenses exceed 1,000 yen.
君は僕より年が上だ
You are older than I―You are my senior.
年が三つ上だ
You are three years older than I―my senior by three years.
彼は五十の上に出ているだろう(五十の坂を越している)
He must be above fifty―over fifty―turned of fifty―on the dark side of fifty.

content: 3. (=何々の後)after; on, upon

content.content: 熟考の上返事をした
I gave my answer after mature consideration.
いちおう取り調べた上お返事を致します
I will give you an answer after due investigation.
試験の上採用する
I shall employ him on examination.
そのことは彼の到着の上できめよう
We shall settle that matter upon his arrival.
帰宅の上ゆっくり考えてみた
On my return home, I considered the matter at my leisure.

content: 4. (=何々に加うるに)besides; in addition to; over and above; as well as

content.content: 彼はその人の命を助けた上に金まで恵んだ
Besides saving his life, he gave the man money.
彼は才子の上に金持ちだ
He is rich besides being clever―He is clever, and rich into the bargain―He is rich as well as clever.
彼は学問ができる上に授業の経験がある
Besides being a good scholar, he has experience in teaching―He is not only a good teacher, but also an experienced teacher―He has experience as well as knowledge.
彼に払うべき分を払った上に礼を出した
I gave him something over and above what was due to him.

content:
5. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 彼は藁の上から貰われた
He was adopted immediately on his birth.
酒の上で間違いがあった
Something went amiss over the wine.
酒の上でけんかをした
They quarrelled over their cups.
酒の上のけんか
a drunken brawl
彼は酒の上で冗談を言う
He is merry in his cups.
彼は酒の上が悪い
He is quarrelsome in his cups.
彼は酒の上でそんなことを言ったのだろう
He must have said so under the influence of wine.
酒の上とは言いながらあんなことをしては言い訳が立たぬ
Granting that he was drunk, that is no excuse for his behaviour.

content: 〈接続詞〉(=何々だから)since; seeing that; now that

content.content: 皆がそう言う上は本当だろう
Since everybody says so, it must be true.
事実そうである上はしかたが無い
Since such is the fact, it can not be helped.
できた上はしかたがない
Since it is done, it can not be undone.
こうなった上は言い訳をしても駄目だ
Now that things have come to this pass, it is not use trying to excuse yourself.
事がここまで進んだ上はあくまで奮闘するよりほかは無い
Now that the matter has proceeded so far, we must fight it out.

content:
うえかえ〔植え替え〕
〈名〉Transplantation:(=る) to transplant, replant (a tree)

content.content: 鉢植の木を植え替える
to plant the shrub in another pot

content:
うえかっする〔飢え渇する〕
〈自動〉To hunger and thirst

content.content: 飢え渇する如く知識を求める
to hunger and thirst after knowledge

content:
うえき〔植木〕
〈名〉A garden-shrub:(鉢植なら)a pot-plant

content.content: 庭に植木を植える
to plant shrubs in the garden―(庭を主とすれば)―plant the garden with shrubs―set the garden with shrubs
植木に水をやる
to water the garden―water the pot-plants

うえきばち〔植木鉢〕
〈名〉A flower-pot

うえきや〔植木屋〕
〈名〉(園丁なら)a gardener:(苗木屋なら)a nursery-man

うえこみ〔植込み〕
〈名〉(庭のは)a shrubbery:(植林なら)a plantation

content:
うえした〔上下〕
〈名〉Top and bottom; head and food:(副詞に用いれば)above and below; up and down; upside down

content.content: (あまり長過ぎるから)上下を少し詰めるとよい
It must be shortened a little at top and bottom.
上下にする
to turn anything upside down
本が上下だ
Your book is upside down.

うえじに〔飢死に〕
〈名〉Death by starvation:(=する) to starve to death; to die of hunger; to perish with famine

うえつがた〔上つ方〕
〈名〉High personages; noble personages

content:
うえつけ〔植付け〕
〈名〉Planting; setting out; cropping:(=る) to plant (trees); to set out (rice-plants); to crop (land)

content.content: 苗を植え付ける
to set out rice-plants
土地に植え付ける
to crop land―place land under crop
畑は植え付けてある
The fields are in crop―under crop.
何も植え付けてない
The fields are out of crop.
小麦を植え付ける
to crop land with wheat
畑には小麦が植え付けてある
The fields are cropped with wheat―under wheat.
植え付け反別
acreage under crop

content:
うえなし〔上無し〕
〈形〉Supreme;ne plus ultra

content.content: そんなことをするのはばかの上無しだ
It is the height of folly to attempt such a thing.

content:
うえぼうそう〔植疱瘡〕
〈名〉Vaccination

content.content: (医者が)植え疱瘡をする
to vaccinate a subject
君を植え疱瘡をしたか
Have you been vaccinated?
植え疱瘡が付いた
The vaccine has taken.

content:
うえる〔植える〕
〈他動〉
1. To plant (a tree); to set (a plant); to sow (seed)

content.content: 公園に木を植える
(木を主とすれば)to plant trees in the park―(公園を主とすれば)―plant the park with trees
公園には木が植えてある
The park is planted with trees.
通りに木が植えてある
The streets are planted with trees.
庭に木を植える
(木を主とすれば)to plant shrubs in the garden―(庭を主とすれば)―plant the garden with shrubs―set the garden with shrubs
庭に木が植えてある
The garden is planted with shrubs―set with shrubs.
木を鉢に植える
to pot a shrub
大麦を植える
to sow barley
この畑には大麦が植えてある
This field is sown with barley―under barley.
田を植える
to set out the rice-plants

content: 2. (=接種する)to inoculate

content.content: 疱瘡を植える
to vaccinate a subject

content: 3. (=植字する)to set up; to compose

content.content: 活字を植える
to compose type―set up type

content:
うえん〔迂遠〕
〈形〉
1. (=まわりくどい)roundabout (way); circuitous (method); circumlocutory (speech); periphrastic (expression)

content.content: 彼の話しは迂遠でわかりにくい
His talk is circumlocutory and hard to understand―What he says, is not to the point.
そのやり方は迂遠だ
You go about it in a roundabout way.

content: 2. (=疎い)ignorant (of anything)

content.content: 学者は世間には迂遠なものだ
A scholar is apt to be ignorant of the world.

content:
うお〔魚〕
〈名〉A fish(複数―fishes):(集合的に言えば)fish(は集合名詞):(膳に上れば)fish(は物質名詞)

content.content: 日本人は魚を食す
The Japanese eat fish―The Japanese are fish-eaters―ichthyophagists.
魚を捕る
to catch fish
海では魚がたくさん捕れる
Great quantities of fish are caught in the sea.
海にはいろいろな魚がいる
All sorts of fish are found in the sea.
この河には魚がたくさんいる
This river teems with fish.
清水に魚住まず
Clear water does not breed fish.
河魚
fresh-water fish
魚一籃
a basket of fish
一網の魚
a draught of fish―a haul of fish
魚のはらわたを抜く
to gut a fish
この魚は煮たのが好いか焼いたのが好いか
Do you like this fish boiled or broiled?
この魚は刺身が好い
I like this fish raw.
魚の刺身
sliced raw fish
魚を刺身に作る
to slice raw fish
魚の洗い
crimped fish
魚を洗いにする
to slice and crimp fish (in cold water)
魚と客は三日目には鼻に付く
“Fish and guests smell at three days old.”
逃がした魚は大きい
“A thing is the bigger for being lost”―Regret magnifies the loss.
木に縁て魚を求むるが如し
You might as well go to a tree for fish.
水を離れた魚のよう
He is a fish out of water.
魚の腹を肥やす
to become food for fishes―feed the fishes

うおいち〔魚市〕
〈名〉(=魚市場)A fish-market

content:
うおうさおうに〔右往左往に〕
〈副〉This way and that; hither and thither; to and fro

content.content: 右往左往に逃げ回った
They ran hither and thither―They hurried to and fro―There was hurrying to and fro.
市民は周章狼狽して右往左往に逃げまわった
The townsfolk fled hither and thither in fear and consternation.

content:
うおかぎ〔魚鉤〕
〈名〉A gaff

content.content: 魚鉤で魚を引掛ける
to gaff a fish

うおがし〔魚河岸〕
〈名〉A riverside fish-market

content:
うおごころ〔魚心〕
〈名〉

content.content: 魚心あれば水心あり
“Man is fire and woman is tow.”

うおじらみ〔魚虱〕
〈名〉The fish-louse

content:
うおつり〔魚釣り〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: つり〔釣り〕

content:
うおのめ〔魚の目〕
〈名〉A corn

content.content: 足の指に魚の目ができた
Corns have formed―I have corns―in my toes.

content:
うかい〔迂回〕
〈名〉A circuit; a compass; a roundabout way; a d?tour:(=する) to make a circuit; to fetch a compass; to take a roundabout way; to make a d?tour

content.content: (鉄道や電信の)迂回線
a loop―a loop-line
(対敵の)迂回運動
a flanking movement

content:
うかい〔鵜飼〕
〈名〉Cormorant-fishing

content.content: 鵜飼い舟
a cormorant-boat

content:
うがい〔含嗽〕
〈名〉Gargling:(=する) to gargle; to rinse one's mouth

content.content: 含嗽薬
a gargle

content:
ウカウカ
〈副〉Heedlessly; thoughtlessly; carelessly; listlessly; unguardedly:(=する) to be heedless, be thoughtless, be careless, be listless, be unguarded

content.content: ウカウカせぬ
to look sharp about one―have all one's eyes about one―have all one's wits about one
ウカウカしゃんすな
Look sharp about you!―You must have all your wits about you.
こりゃウカウカしてはおられぬと思った
I thought it time to look about me.
ウカウカしていると人に後れるぞ
You will fall behind the others if you don't look sharp.
ウカウカものを言うな
Be guarded in your speech!
ウカウカ月日を送る
to dream away one's time―idle away one's time
ウカウカ暮らす
to dream one's life away―whistle one's life away
お前にばかりこんな苦労をさせてウカウカ暮らしてなるものか
How can I dream my life away when you have such difficulties to contend with?

content:
うかがい〔伺い〕
〈名〉
1. (=訪問)a call; a visit

content.content: いつお伺いしましょうか
When shall I call on you?―wait upon you?
天機伺い
paying one's respects to the Emperor
ご機嫌伺い
paying one's respects (to a superior)
小作人がご機嫌伺いに出ました
One of your tenants has come to pay his respects to you.

content: 2. (=質問)an inquiry

content.content: 暑中伺い
an inquiry after one's health during the hot season
まずはお伺いまで
With kind inquiries.

content: 3. (=神託の伺い)consulting the oracle

content.content: 伺いを立てる
to consult the oracle

content:
うかがう〔窺う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=機会などを待つ)to watch for, look out for (an opportunity)

content.content: 機を窺う
to watch for a chance
時分を窺う
to watch for one's time
人の隙を窺う
to watch for an unguarded moment
相手の隙を窺え
Watch for a moment when your man is off his guard!

content: 2. (=観察する)to observe; to watch; to spy; to see

content.content: 様子を窺う
to observe the state of things―see how the land lies
あたりの様子を窺う
to take one's bearings
その男は窓から内の様子を窺っていた
He was looking in at the window.
形勢を窺う
to watch the signs of the times―see how the wind blows
過去を窺い将来を察する
We look into the past and glance into the future.
人の動静を窺う
to watch one's movements―spy on one's movements
敵の動静を窺う
to observe the movements of the enemy―spy out the enemy's movements
政界の動静を窺う
to watch the development of political affairs
世の動静を窺う
to observe the state of affairs
人の顔色を窺う、鼻息を窺う
to hang on one's smiles―wait on one's beck―wait on one's nod

content: 3. (=幾分を知る)to know something of (anything); to get a glance into (something); to catch a glimpse of (something); to form some idea of (anything)

content.content: 内部の消息が多少窺われる
We can know something of the internal state of things.
その生活の一端を窺い知ることができる
We can get a glance into their life―catch a glimpse of their daily life.
これを見れば事の一端を窺い知るに足る
This will give you a glace into the matter.
有史以前のことを微かに窺い知るを得べし
We can form a faint idea of the prehistoric times.
内部の消息は門外漢の窺い知るところにあらず
The internal state of things is a sealed book to the outsider.
天道は窺い知るあたわず
Inscrutable are the ways of Heaven―Heaves is a sealed letter to us.
意味深長窺い知るべからず
We can not fathom the meaning.
王位を窺う
to aspire to the Throne―have designs on the Throne

content:
うかがう〔伺う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=目上を訪問する)to call on, wait upon (a superior); to wait upon one's pleasure; to attend on one's leisure; to dance attendance upon (a noble personage)

content.content: 早速伺います
I shall call on you―wait upon you―without delay.
それではお宅の方へ伺います
Then I shall call at your residence.
今日は少々大事な用があって伺いました
I have called on particular business.
天機を伺う
to pay one's respects to the Emperor
ご機嫌を伺う
to pay one's respects to a superior―(芸人なら)―perform to an audience
罪の無いお話を一席伺います
I will tell you a story that will make you laugh.

content: 3. (=目上に問う)to ask (one about something); to inquire (of one about something); to want to know; to submit (a case to the court)

content.content: 伺ってみましょう
I will ask him.
お名前を伺っても仰有いません
I asked his name, but he would not tell me.
試験のことを伺いに出ました
I came to inquire of you about the examination.
如何御消光被遊候哉一寸御伺い申上候
This is to ask you how you are passing your time.
ご意見を伺いたい
I wish to know your opinion.
植木屋が今度はいつ参ってよいか伺ってくれと申します
The gardener wants to know when he shall come next.
ひとつその理由を伺いたいものだ
I should like to know the reason.
ちょっと伺いますが
Please, sir,...
その説は事実とは少々合わないように思われますがいかがなのもでしょうか伺います
That statement, I submit, is not in strict accord with the truth.

content: 4. (=承る)to hear; to be told

content.content: 先生から伺いました
I heard it from my teacher―My teacher told me.
あなたからそう伺いました
You told me so.
今度お止めになるように伺いましたがどういうわけですか
You are going to resign, I hear―I understand. How is that?

content:
うかされる〔浮される〕
〈被動〉To be exhilarated

content.content: 熱に浮かされる
to be delirious―in a delirium
熱に浮かされて皆しゃべってしまった
He blabbed everything in his delirium.
民主熱に浮かされている者がある
Some people have a mania for democracy.
彼は勉強熱に浮かされている
He has a fit of industry―He is in a fit of industry.
飛行熱に浮かされている
He has a craze for flying―He is a martyr to the flying craze.

content:
うかす〔浮す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=浮き上がらせる)to refloat; to raise; to bear up

content.content: 沈没船を浮かす
to refloat a sunken ship―raise a submerged vessel
水が船を浮かす
The water bears up a ship.

content: 2. (=心を浮かす)to exhilarate; to enliven

content.content: 酒は心を浮かす
Wine exhilarates.
幇間{ほうかん}は座敷を浮かす
A buffoon enlivens the company―sets the table in a roar.

content:
うかする〔雨下する〕
〈自動〉To rain; to shower

content.content: 銃弾が雨下する
There is a shower of bullets.
敵弾の雨下する下に立って兵員は冷静沈着に立ち働いた
The men behaved coolly under a shower of bullets.

content:
うかつ〔迂闊〕
〈形〉
1. Heedless; thoughtless; careless; unguarded; giddy; scatter-brained; ignorant; stupid:(=に) heedlessly; thoughtlessly; carelessly; unguardedly

content.content: そんな危険のあることを知らずにいたのは迂闊だった
It was stupid of me to be unconscious of such a danger.
君はそんな誤りを見落とすとは迂闊だった
It was stupid of you to overlook such an obvious mistake.
迂闊にものを言うな
You must be guarded in your language―control your speech―bridle your tongue―weigh your words.
彼は迂闊なことを言わぬ
He uses guarded language.
あの人はじきに怒るから迂闊にものが言えぬ
You must be careful in speaking to him, for he is quick to take offence.
彼は世間のことに迂闊だ
He is ignorant of the world.
あれは迂闊な男だ
He is a stupid fellow―a giddy fellow―a scatter-brained fellow.
こりゃ迂闊に手が出せぬわい
This is delicate business, I declare.

content:
うがつ〔穿つ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=孔を明ける)to make (a hole); to pierce (a stone); to perforate (a stone with a hole); to drill (an iron plate―a hole in an iron plate)

content.content: 石を穿つ
to pierce a stone―perforate a stone (with a hole)
壁に孔を穿つ
to make a hole in the wall―perforate the wall with a hole
隧道を穿つ
to drive a tunnel through a mountain
点滴石を穿つ
“Falling drops will wear a stone.”
両者間に深い溝が穿たれた
An impassable gulf formed between the two friends.

content: 2. (=真を写す)to be true to (nature); to hit (the mark)

content.content: その言葉は真を穿っている
You have hit the nail on the head―hit the mark―hit it.
君の言うことはいつも穿っている
You always hit the mark.
その言穿ち得て妙
It is a happy expression―a felicitous expression―an expressive word.
それは穿った評だ
It is a happy hit.
ドイツ人は専門のことをパンの学問というのは穿っている
The German significantly call professional education bread-studies.
この小説は人情を穿っている
The novel is true to human nature.
それはちと穿ち過ぎて皮肉な言だ
That's rather a cynical remark.

content: 3. (=履く)to wear (shoes)

うかつもの〔迂闊者〕
〈名〉A stupid fellow; a giddy fellow; a scatter-brained fellow; a scatterbrain

content:
うかと
〈副〉→『

content.content: ウッカリ

content:
うかぶ〔浮ぶ〕
〈自動〉
1. (=水に浮かぶ)to float; to swim; to rise to the surface; to come up to the surface

content.content: 水に浮かぶ
to floats on the water
水より軽いものは浮かぶ
Anything lighter than water floats on it.
男の土左衛門は仰向きに浮かぶ、女の土左衛門は俯向きに浮かぶ
A drowned man floats on his back; a drowned woman floats on her face.
彼は木の葉のように浮かぶ
He swims like a cork.
大魚の水面に浮かぶのを見た
I beheld the monster rise to the surface.
彼は波間に沈んで再び浮かばす
He sank beneath the waves, never to rise again.
浮かぶ瀬がある
to rise in the world
いつかは浮かぶ瀬があるだろう
I may rise in the world some time or other.
それでは永久浮かぶ瀬が無い
Then I shall never rise in the world.
身をすててこそ浮かぶ瀬もあれ
“Risk all and gain all.”

content: 3. (=胸に浮かぶ)to occur to one's mind; to suggest itself to one's mind; to present itself to one's mind; to cross one's mind; to come across one's mind; to pass through one's mind; to enter one's head; to come into one's head; to strike (one); to dawn upon one's mind; to flash upon one's mind

content.content: 一趣向胸に浮かんだ
An idea occurred to my mind―came across my mind―came into my head―I thought of a plan―I bethought myself of a plan.
名案が浮かんだ
A bright idea occurred to me―I thought of a good plan―I hit upon a good idea.
ふと一趣向が浮かんだ
An idea struck me―I was struck with an idea.
種々の考えが胸に浮かんだ
Various thoughts passed through my mind.
煙を見れば火という念が浮かぶ
When I see smoke, the idea of fire occurs to my mind―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight of smoke suggests to my mind the idea of fire―(また)―When I see smoke, I think of fire―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Smoke reminds me of fire.
事実がほのぼのと胸に浮かんだ
The truth dawned upon my mind.
事実がにわかに胸にひらめいた
The truth flashed upon my mind.
一句浮かんだ
I am inspired with a poem.
君の俤{おもかげ}がいつも目の前に浮かんでいる
Your face is always present to my senses.

content: 4. (=霊魂が浮かぶ、成仏する)to rest in peace

content.content: 君がそんなことをすると死んだお母さんが浮かばれまい

If you do such a thing, your mother's soul will not be able to rest in peace―If you allow yourself such conduct, your mother will turn in her grave―(他動詞構文にすれば)―You will make your mother turn in her grave.
浮かび兼ねて迷っている魂
a restless soul―a disconsolately wandering spirit

content:
うかべる〔浮かべる〕
〈他動〉
1. To set (a ship); afloat; to launch(a boat)

顔に喜色を浮かべた

content.content: 浮名が立つ
to give rise to scandal

Their relations gave rise to many a scandal.

Your silence will prevent scandal.

to create a scandal―lend oneself to romance
あの芸者は浮名を流したことが無い

芸道に憂き身をやつしている
He is devoted to art―enthusiastic for art.
遊芸に憂き身をやつしている

content:

〈名〉Woe; misery; distress; hardships; a trying experience; a bitter experience

content.content: 憂き目を見る
to see hardships―come to woe―have a bitter experience
若い時に働かないと年をとってから憂き目を見る
If you do not work in your youth, you will come to woe in your old age.
あの時は憂き目を見た
I had a bitter experience―had a trying experience―had a hard time of it.
この子に憂き目を見せるのは可哀そうだ
It would be cruel to make her see hardships.
憂目を忍ぶ
to suffer hardships―bear one's cross

It is man's lot to suffer.

content:
うきよ〔浮世〕
〈名〉The (transitory) world; (transient) life; the vale of tears

content.content: 浮世は夢
Life is a dream.
浮世ははかないもの
The world is mutable―Life is transient―Life is but a span.
浮世はまわり持ち
The world is a wheel.
浮世はままならぬ
Life is full of vexations.
浮世がままなにるならば世に学校の種を絶やさん
If I had my way, there should be no schools in the world.
浮世がしみじみいやになった
I am heartily sick of life.
浮世を捨てる
to renounce the world
浮世捨てての奥山住まい
I am dead to the world, and live in a sylvan retreat.
浮世離れて尊き暮らし
Remote from towns he runs his godly race.
浮世の芥臭い、浮世臭い
worldly―of the earth, earthy
浮世の塵を避ける
to seclude oneself from the world―hold aloof from the crowd―live remote from towns
浮世の塵を洗い流す
to wash oneself clean from the dust and heat of the world
とかく浮世は色と酒
Wine and woman rule the world.
浮世のことは金次第
“Money makes the mare to go.”
それが浮世の習いだ
That is the way of the world.
哀別離苦は浮世の習い
We are liable to separations in this world.
逢うて別れは浮世の習い
Those who meet, must part―“The best of friends must part.”
浮世の旅
a progress through the vale of tears
浮世の義理
the demands of custom―the shackles of convention
浮世の祥{さが}
the hopes and fears of humanity
浮世の栄華
“the pomps and vanities of this wicked world”
浮世百態
the shifting scene of life

content:

〈名〉A worldly mind; worldly-mindedness; worldliness; worldly desires

content.content: 彼は浮世心が無い

あの人はまだ浮世心が抜けない
He has not outlived his worldliness―He is not yet above the world.

He has a worldly mind―He is worldly-minded―He is full of worldly desires.
片足突っ込んでも浮世心を離れぬ
With one foot in the grave, he can not wean his mind from worldly desires.

content:
うく〔浮く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=水に浮く)to float; to swim; to rise to the surface; to come up to the surface

content.content: 水に浮く
to float on the water
水より軽い物は浮く
Anything lighter than water floats on it.
木の葉は浮く
Leaves float on the water.
木の葉のように浮く
He swims like a cork.
うっちゃっておけば浮く者は浮く沈む者は沈む
Leave a man to sink or swim!
男の土左衛門は仰向きに浮く
A drowned man will float on his back.
女の土左衛門は俯向きに浮く
A drowned woman will float on her face.
泳ぐのはさておいてただ浮いていたというばかりさ
Swimming apart, I barely kept myself above water.
歯が浮く
One's teeth are set on edge.
梅の実を見たばかりで歯が浮く
The mere sight of green plums sets my teeth on edge.
鉄と石と擦り合わせると歯の浮くような音がする
Iron grates against stone―grides on stone.
歯の浮くような音
a grating sound―a strident sound―a gride
あの人は歯の浮くような英語を使う
He speaks intolerable English―insufferable English.
気が浮く
to be gay―light-hearted―buoyant―exhilarated―enlivened―cheered―in high spirits
酒を飲むと気が浮く
Wine exhilarates.
桜が咲くと人の心が浮く
The cherry-blossoms enliven the people.
春は心が浮く
The heart is buoyant in spring.
音楽を聞くと沈んだ心も浮く
Music cheers a depressed heart.
お祭りで若い者は気が浮いている
The festival has made the young people gay.
休暇が近づいたので皆気が浮いている
The holidays being at hand, they have a light heart―they are light-hearted―they are in high spirits.
彼は浮くかと思えば沈み、沈むかと思えば浮く(変転自在だ)
He passes from gay to grave, from grave to gay.
気が浮かぬ
to be depressed in spirits―in low spirits―gloomy―melancholy
君は浮かぬ顔をしている
You have a gloomy look―a glum face―a melancholy countenance―a grave look.
浮かぬ様子だ
He has a gloomy air―a melancholy air―a sad air―a pensive air.
ういた〔浮いた〕
金が浮く
Money is left over.
そうすれば十円浮く
Thus you will save ten yen.

content:
うぐいす〔鶯〕

content.content: 鶯が啼く

鶯啼かせたこともある
I have made my conquests in my time.
梅に鶯(に相当するは)

心は春めきて
It makes of winter genial spring;
借金取りも
And e'en the bill-collecting dun

Doth to me like a robin sing.

content:
うけ〔受け〕
〈名〉
1. (=気受け)favour; popularity; reception

content.content: 彼は主人の受けはどうか
How does he get on with his master?
主人の受けが好い
He is in favour with his master―in his master's good graces―in his master's good books.
主人の受けが悪い
He is not in favour with his master―in his master's black books.
彼は上官の受けが好い
He is in good odour with his seniors.
上官の受けが悪い
He is in bad odour with his seniors.
今度の先生は生徒の受けはどうか
How does the new man get on with the students?
生徒の受けは好い方だ
He gets on quite well with them―He is popular with them.
生徒の受けが悪い
He can not get on with them―He is unpopular with them.
この事業は一般の受けはどうか
What is the general feeling towards this enterprise?
一般の受けは好い方だ
The general feeling is in its favour.
一般の受けが悪い
The general feeling is against it.
この計画は当局者の受けはどうか
How do the authorities look on the project?
当局者の受けが好い
They look upon it with favour.
当局者の受けが悪い
They look coldly upon it―look upon it with cold eyes.
この小説は世間の受けはどうか
How does the novel take?
読書界の受けが好い
It has met with a favourable reception in the reading public.
非常に受けが好い
It has met with an enthusiastic reception.

content:
うけあい〔請合い〕
〈名〉Assurance; guarantee; warranty; warrant

content.content: 大丈夫請け合いです
I can assure you―I'll be bound―I will answer for it―I give you my word for it―I will go bail for it―I will give my hand on it―You may take my word for it―You may depend upon it.
品は請け合いです
I will warrant the article―guarantee the quality.
品質請け合い
Quality warranted―Quality guaranteed.
この品は五年間は請け合いです
I will guarantee the article for five years.
丈夫なことは請け合いです
I will warrant it strong.
彼の正直なことは請け合いだ
I will answer for his honesty.
その本当なことは請け合いだ
I can vouch for its truth.
事業の成功することは請け合いだ
I will answer for―engage for―the success of the enterprise.
明日の天気は請け合いだ
I am sure the weather will be fine tomorrow―The weather is sure to be fine tomorrow.

content:
うけあう〔請合う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=保証する)to guarantee (payment); to warrant (the article); to assure (success―one of success); to answer for (one's honesty); to engage for (success); to vouch for (its truth); to give one's word for it; to give one's hand on it; to see to it

content.content: 大丈夫請け合います
I can assure you―I'll be bound―I will answer for it―I give you my word for it―I will go bail for it―I will give my hand on it―You may take my word for it―You may depend upon it.
品は請け合います
I will warrant the article―guarantee the quality.
この品は五年は請け合います
I will guarantee the article for five years.
丈夫なことは請け合います
I will warrant it strong.
彼の正直なことは請け合います
I will answer for his honesty―vouch for his honesty―go bail for his honesty.
事業の成功することは請け合う
I will answer for―engage for―the success of the enterprise.
返済は請け合います
I will see that he pays you―see that you are paid―see you paid―guarantee payment.
よし来た請け合った
I'll see to it―I'll see about it.

content: 2. (=引受ける)to undertake (some work); to take (a trust) on oneself

content.content: 請け合った仕事がある
I have undertake some work.
できないことを請け合っては困る
You must not take an impossible task on yourself.

content: 3. (=約束する)to promise (to do something); to engage (to do something)

content.content: 彼は金を出すことを受け合った

content:
うけあって〔受合って〕
〈副〉Certainly; I am sure; I'll be bound; depend upon it

content.content: 君は請け合って及第する
You will certainly passe―I am certain you will pass―You are certain to pass―You will pass, I'll be bound.
明日は請け合って天気だ
I am sure the weather will be fine tomorrow―The weather is sure to be fine tomorrow―I'll go bail for tomorrow's weather.
この品は請け合って本物です
The article is warranted genuine―I will warrant the article genuine―I will answer for its genuineness.
請け合って本当だ
I will vouch for its truth―You may depend upon its truth.

謹んで承われ
Listen to me!―Attend to my words!
それは初めて承る
That is new to me.
ご用を承りたい
I wish to know What you want.
一つその理由を承りたいものだ
I should like to know the reason.
ご意見を承りたい
I wish to hear your opinion on the subject.
承わればご昇進の由
You have been promoted, I hear―I understand.
ご芳名をかねて承っております
I have long known you by reputation.
お話を承って安心しました
You have relieved me of my anxiety―You have taken a load off my mind.
ご用を承る
to receive orders
手前どもでは宮内省の御用を承っております
We are under the patronage of the Imperial Household.

content:
うけつぐ〔受継ぐ〕
〈他動〉To inherit (property from one's father); to succeed to (the property); to be heir to (the property); to take over (duties, etc.)

content.content: 身代を受け継ぐ
to inherit a fortune―succeed to the property
この身代を受け継ぐ人は誰か
Who will succeed to the property?―Who is heir to the property?
事務を受け継ぐ
to take over charge of an office
職務を受け継ぐ
to take over the duties of an office

content:
うけつけ〔受付〕
〈名〉(場所)the inquiry office:(人)the usher; the janitor

content.content: 受付へ行ってお聞きなさい
Please inquire of the usher―I must refer you to the usher.
受付口
the usher's window

content:
うけつける〔受付ける〕
〈他動〉To accept (an application); to take up (a petition); to entertain (a proposal); to take cognizance of (a case)

content.content: もう願書を受け付けている
They are accepting the applications already.
請願書を受け付けられなかった
The petition was rejected.
彼は相談を受け付けない
He will not entertain my proposal―listen to my proposal.
この事件は所轄が違うから受け付けることはできない
We can take no cognizance of the case, for it is beyond our jurisdiction.
幾度手紙をやっても先方で受け付けない
They took no notice of my letters.
彼は人の話を受け付けない
He repudiates the idea.

content:
うけとめる〔受け止める〕
〈他動〉To catch; to stop

content.content: 打ち込む太刀を発止と受け止めた
He caught the blow with a clash.
彼の拳骨を腕で受け止めた
I caught his blow on my arm.
球を受け止める
to catch a ball―stop a ball

content:
うけとり〔受取〕
〈名〉A receipt

content.content: 受け取りを書く
to write a receipt―make out a receipt
右正に受取
Received with thanks.
金百円正に請取申候、伊藤様
Duly rec'd of Mr. Ito the sum of 100 yen.
書出しは受け取りになっています
The bill is receipted―It is a receipted bill.
受取証
a receipt―a voucher―a quittance―a release

うけとりしょう〔受取証〕
〈名〉A receipt; a voucher; a quittance; a release

うけとりにん〔受取人〕
〈名〉The receiver; the recipient

content:
うけとる〔受取る〕
〈他動〉
1. To receive; to accept

content.content: お手紙は正に受け取りました
I have duly received your letter―I am in receipt of your letter―Your letter has duly come to hand―Your letter is duly to hand.
手紙を受け取り次第すぐ帰れ
On receipt of the letter, you will return at once.
受け取ったら知らせ
Acknowledge receipt.
右正に請取り
Received with thanks.
金百円正に受取申候、田中様
Duly rec'd of Mr. Tanaka the sum of 100 yen.
金を改めて受け取ったのか
Did you count the money when you received it?
彼の言うことは本当とは受け取れない
I can not accept this statement as true―I can not credit his statement.
彼がそんなことをしようとは受け取れない
I can not persuade myself that he can have done such a thing.
受け取りにくい話だ
I can not swallow the story―The story is hard to swallow―The story must be taken with a grain of salt―The story must be taken with some grains of allowance.

content:
うけながす〔受け流す〕
〈他動〉To parry, ward off, turn aside, dodge (a blow); to put by (a question); to parry, elude (an attack, etc.)

content.content: 打ち込む太刀を受け流す
to parry a blow―ward off a blow―turn aside a blow
論鋒を受け流す
to parry an attack―dodge an attack―elude an attack
いやな質問を受け流した
I parried awkward questions―put by awkward questions.
彼は人から烈しく攻撃されても柳に風と受け流している
He softly eludes their furious attacks.
(彼女は男にしつこく口説かれても)柳に風と体好く受け流している
She deftly eludes his importunities.

content:
うけにん〔受人〕
〈名〉A guarantor; a surety; a security

content.content: 受け人になる
to stand surety―go security―(for some one)
受け人を立てる
to find surety―give security

うけび〔受日〕
〈名〉A reception-day; an at-home day

うけひく〔受け引く〕
〈他動〉To consent (to a plan)

content:
うけみ〔受け身〕
〈名〉
1. (=守勢)a defensive attitude

content.content: 受け身になる
to stand on the defensive

content: 2. ［文法］The passive voice

content.content: 受け身の動詞
a passive verb

content:
うけもち〔受持ち〕
〈名〉Charge

content.content: 受け持ち教員
the teacher in charge
受け持ちの組
the class in one's charge―the class under one's charge
此組の受け持ちの先生は誰ですか
Who is in charge of this class?
この先生の受け持ちの組は何年ですか
What is the class in the charge of―under the charge of―the man?
五年級受け持ちの先生
the teacher in charge of the Fifth Year Class
五年級はこの先生の受け持ちです
The Fifth Year Class is in the charge of―under the charge of―this man.
私の受け持ちは四年級です
My charge is the Fourth Year Class―I am in charge of the Four Year Class.
四年級は私の受け持ちです
The Fourth Year Class is in my charge―under my charge.
受け持ち時間
one's class hours
今日は受け持ち時間が三時間ある
I have three hours to teach today.
明日は受け持ち時間が無い
I have no class tomorrow.
受け持ち区域
the section under one's charge

content:
うけもつ〔受持つ〕
〈他動〉To take charge of (a class); to take (a class) under one's charge

content.content: 僕はこの組を受け持とう
I will take charge of this class―take this class under my charge.
僕は五年級を受け持っている
I have charge of the Fifth Year Class―I am in charge of the Fifth Year Class.
五年級は僕が受け持っている
The Fifth Year Class is in my charge―under my charge.
この組を受け持っている先生は誰か
Who is in charge of this class?
先生の受け持っているのは何年級か
What is the class in the charge of―under the charge of―the man?
五年級の英語は誰が受け持っているか
Who has charge of the Fifth Year English?―Who teaches English to the Fifth Year students?
誰に何年級を受け持たせる
to place a man in charge of a class―place a class in the charge of a man―place a class under the charge of a man
彼に上級を受け持たせてみよう
I will place him in charge of the higher classes―place the higher classes in his charge―place the higher classes under his charge.

うけもどす〔受戻す〕
〈他動〉To redeem (a pawn)

うけやど〔請宿〕
〈名〉A servants' agency:(米国にては)an intelligence office; a register office; an employment office

content:
うける〔享ける〕
〈他動〉To enjoy (happiness)

content.content: 彼は主人の信任を享けている
He enjoys his master's confidence.

content:
うける〔受ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=受取る)to receive (an education); to accept (an appointment); to take (anything seriously); to have (a visit from one); to be given (a welcome):(または動詞の Passive)

content.content: 教育を受ける
to receive an education―be educates
彼は外国で教育を受けた
He was educated abroad.
治療を受ける
to receive one's treatment―undergo medical treatment―be subjected to treatment―be treated
彼は佐藤博士の治療を受けている
He is under the treatment of Dr. Sato.
出発の命を受けた
I have orders to depart.
彼から訪問を受けた
I had a visit from him.
警察の保護を受ける
to place oneself under the protection of the police
我々は法律の保護を受けている
We are under the guardianship of the laws.
冗談に言ったことを真に受けたのだ
What I said in joke, was taken seriously.
君はそんなうまいことを言うと人は真に受けるぞ
I shall take you at your word.
相談を受けた
I was consulted―My advice was sought.
ある学校から口の相談を受けた
I am offered a position at a certain school.
施しを受ける
to receive alms―subsist on charity
友人の扶助を受けるのはいやだ
I don't like to subsist on the bounty of my friends.
伯(叔)父から学資の補助を受けている
My uncle helps me with my school-expenses.
彼は伯(叔)父の後見を受けている
He is under the guardianship of his uncle―He is his uncle's ward.
手厚いもてなしを受けた
I was accorded a warm hospitality.
彼は到る処で歓迎を受けた
He was welcomed wherever he went.
船は水線に弾を受けた
The ship was hit between wind and water.
後口を受ける
to accept an after-engagement

content: 2. (=蒙る)receive (a blow); to suffer (a loss); to sustain (a wound); to be subjected to (pressure):(または動詞の Passive)

content.content: 打撃を受ける
to receive a blow―sustain a blow
彼は投機で大打撃を受けた
He has been hard hit in speculation.
傷を受ける
to receive a wound―sustain a wound―be wounded
致命傷を受けた
He received a mortal wound―He was mortally wounded.
打撲傷を受ける
to sustain a contusion―be bruised
罰を受ける
to suffer punishment―be subjected to punishment―be punished
甘んじて罰を受ける
to submit to punishment―“kiss the rod.”
損害を受ける
to suffer a loss―sustain a loss
嫌疑を受ける
to fall under suspicion―incur suspicion―be suspected
彼は収賄の嫌疑を受けている
He lies under suspicion of corruption―He is suspected of corruption.
砲火を受ける
to be subjected to fire
砲撃を受ける
to be subjected to cannonade―be bombarded―be fired upon
圧制を受ける
to groan under oppression―crouch under oppression―be oppressed
圧迫を受ける
to be subjected to pressure
恩を受ける
to receive favours―receive benefits―at one's hands
仇を受ける
to suffer wrongs at one's hands
寵愛を受ける
to win one's favour―fine favour in one's eyes
彼女は主人の寵愛を受けている
She is in favour with her master―a favourite with her master.
侮辱を受ける
to receive an insult―be insulted―be subjected to indignities
反対を受ける
to meet with opposition
迫害を受ける
to be persecuted
感化を受ける
to feel one's influence
青年は感化を受けやすい
Youth is susceptible to influence.
譴責を受ける
to be reprimanded
尊敬を受ける
to inspire respect in others―be respected

content: 3. (=経る)to undergo (an examination); to go through (an examination); to take (an examination); to be subjected to (inspection); to submit oneself to (training);(または動詞の Passive)

content.content: 試験を受ける
to take an examination―sit for an examination―be examined
今度は試験を受かるつもりか
Are you going in for the examination?
試験を受けに行った
I presented myself for examination.
試験を受けて入学した
I was admitted on examination.
検査を受ける
to undergo an examination―go through an examination―be subjected to inspection―be examined
体格検査を受ける
to go through physical examination
徴兵検査を受ける
to undergo an examination for conscription―be examined for a conscript
取り調べを受ける
to be subjected to examination―be examined
手術を受ける
to undergo an operation―be operated upon
君は手術を受けなけりゃ治らない
You can not recover unless you have yourself operated upon.
診察を受ける
to take medical advice―consult a physician―see the doctor
診断を受ける
to undergo a medical examination
訓練を受ける
to be subjected to training―(自ら進んで受ければ)―submit oneself to training

content: 4. (=受け止める)to catch

content.content: 球を受ける
to catch a ball
球を受けようとする
to catch at a ball
打ち込む太刀を受ける
to catch a falling blow
彼の拳骨を腕で受けた
I caught his blow on my arm.

content: 5. (=受け出す)to redeem

content.content: 質を受ける
to redeem a pawn―take anything out of pawn

content: 6. (=支える)to support; to bear; to prop

content.content: 柱が屋根を受ける
The posts bear the roof―support the roof.
この柱が梁を受けている
These posts prop the beam.

content: 7. (=遺伝する)to inherit (anything from one's parents)

content.content: この子の学問が好きなのは親から受けた性質です
The boy has inherited his love of learning from his father.

content: 8. (=代名詞が何を指す)to refer to (an antecedent)

content.content: 代名詞が名詞を受ける
A pronoun refers to a noun.
この“it”は何を受けているか
What does this “it” refer to?

content:
うける〔承ける〕
〈他動〉To obey (one's wishes); to comply with (one's wishes)

content.content: 彼の意を承けて規則を編んだ
The rules were framed in obedience to his wishes―in compliance with his wishes.

content:
うけわたし〔受け渡し〕
〈名〉Transfer; delivery:(=する) to transfer (property); to deliver (goods)

content.content: 品物の受け渡しが済んだ
The goods have been delivered―The delivery of goods is completed.
財産の受け渡しが済んだ
The property has been transferred―The transfer of property has been effected.

content:
うげん〔右舷〕
〈名〉Starboard

content.content: 右舷に当たって船見ゆ
A sail is in sight to starboard.
右舷正横に当たって
on the starboard beam
右舷船首の方に当たって
on the starboard bow
右舷船尾の方に当たって
on the starboard quarter
船が右舷に傾ぐ
The ship lists to starboard.
船が右舷に弾を受けた
The ship was struck on the starboard side.
右舷開きに走る
to sail on the starboard tack
右舷直
starboard watch
舵を右舷に取る
to port the helm

content:
うご〔雨後〕
〈副〉After a rain

content.content: 雨後の筍の如し
to spring up like mushrooms after a rain―grow with the rapidity of a prophet's gourd

content:
うごう〔烏合〕
〈形〉(A troop) undisciplined and lacking unity

content.content: 烏合の衆
a rabble―a mob

うごうのしゅう〔烏合の衆〕
〈名〉A rabble; a mob

content:
うごかす〔動かす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=移動する)to move; to shift

content.content: 時間を動かすことはできぬ
It is impossible to move the hours―shift the hours.
彼は顔の筋一つ動かさない
He does not move a muscle of his face.
一念天を動かす
“Faith will move a mountain.”
彼は百円も動かせない
He has no credit for 100 yen―His credit is not good for 100 yen.
動かすべからざる法則
immovable laws―immutable laws
動かすべからざる判決
a final decision

content: 2. (=ぐらつかせる、動揺させる)to shake

content.content: 決心を動かす
to shake one's resolution
信仰を動かす
to shake one's faith
天下を動かす
to shake the world
国家の基礎を動かす
to shake the foundation of the Empire―shake the Empire to its foundation
彼の決心は動かすべからず
His resolution is unshaken―unshakable.
これは動かすべからざる事実である
This is an established fact.
動かすべからざる証拠がある
There is positive proof―conclusive proof.

content: 3. (=心を動かす)to move; to affect; to touch; to influence; to sway; to work

content.content: 僕の心は動かされやすい
I am easily moved―easily influenced.
女の言葉に心を動かされた
I was moved by her words―affected by her words―touched by her words.
彼の言葉に深く心を動かされた
His words shook my very soul.
なんと言っても彼の心を動かして承諾させることができない
Nothing can move him to consent.
雄弁家は人心を動かす
An orator sways the minds of men―takes his audience with him―sweeps his audience with him.
彼の弁舌は人を動かす力が有る
He speaks with effect―He is an effective speaker―He makes effective speeches―He has great powers of persuasion.
彼は刻下の急務の為にあまり心を動かされる
He is too much swayed by the needs of the moment.
輿論のために心を動かされるな
Do not suffer yourself to be swayed by public opinion!―be influenced by public opinion!
僕は洋行さしてくれるように親父の心を動かそうとした
I worked my father to send me abroad.
人の感情を動かす
to work upon one's feelings
(いくら歎願しても)彼の心は動かすべからず
He is immovable―inexorable.

content: 4. (=運転させる)to put in motion; to set going

content.content: 機械を動かす
to put the machinery in motion―set a machine going―start a machine

content: 5. (=動員する)to mobilize (troops)

content.content: 干戈を動かす
to take up arms

うごかすべからざる〔動かす可からざる〕
〈形〉Immovable (mind); immutable (laws); unshakable (faith or resolution); inexorable (heart); established (fact); positive, conclusive (proof); final (decision, etc.)

content:
うごき〔動き〕
〈名〉Motion; movement

content.content: 僕はそれでは動きがとれない
Then I shall be in a fix.
動きのとれない証拠
positive proof―conclusive proof
僕は動きのとれない証拠を握っている
I have conclusive proof in my hands.
この証拠が彼を犯人として動きのとれないものにしてしまった
This proof concluded him to be the culprit.

content:
うごく〔動く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=移動する)to move; to shift:(打消には)to stir; to budge

content.content: 地球は今現に動いているのか
Is the earth actually moving at this moment?
夜が明けると世の中が動き出す
When day breaks, the world begins to stir.
もう世間は動いている
The streets are stirring―astir.
一歩でも動かばこそ
Not a step would he stir.
そこ一歩でも動くな
You must not stir a step―stir from the spot.
一歩でも動くと命が無いぞ
Stir a step, and you are a dead man.
風はそよとも無く木の葉一つ動かぬ
Not a breath of air stirs the leaves.
(彼女は尻が重くて)梃{てこ}でも動かぬ
She won't budge an inch.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 生徒の数は三千と五千の間を動いている
The number of students ranges between 3,000 and 5,000―ranges from 3,000 to 5,000.
品が動かない
The goods do not sell.
市場が動かない
The market is stationary.
金が動く
to have credit for money
彼の信用(名前)で一万円は動く
His credit is good for 10,000 yen―His name is good for 10,000 yen.
僕の名前ではそうは動かぬ
My name is not so good.

content: 2. (=動揺する)to be shaken; to be agitated

content.content: 人心が動いている
The people are agitated.
ドイツ開戦し天下為に動く
Germany's declaration of war shook the world.
僕にそう言われると彼の決心が動いた
My words shook his resolution.
どんなことがあっても彼の信仰は動かない
Nothing can shake his faith.
動かざること泰山の如し
He is as firm as a rock.
主義の動かざること大盤石の如し
His principles are immovable as the living rock.
彼は断乎として動かぬ、固く執って動かぬ
He stands firm in his opinion.

content: 3. (=心が動く)to be moved; to be affected; to be touched; to be swayed; to be influenced

content.content: 君に説かれて彼は心が動いたろう
Your words must have moved him―He must have been moved by your words.
彼はどんなことがあっても心が動かぬ
Nothing can move him―affect him―touch him.
彼は輿論のために心が動くようなことはない
He is not to be swayed by public opinion―not to be influenced by public opinion.
どんな危険に瀕しても心が動かぬ(びくともせぬ)
He is immovable―imperturbable―in any imminent danger.
(いくら歎願しても)頑として動かぬ
He is inexorable.
あの男は金で動く
He is mercenary.
意しきりに動く
I feed like doing something―feel inclined to do something―have a great mind to do something.
勧められて意しきりに動いた
He nearly persuaded me to consent.

content: 4. (=運転する)to be in motion; to run; to go

content.content: 機械が動いている
The machinery is in motion.
昼夜動いている
It is running night and day.
時計が動いているか
Is the clock going?
振り子が動く
The pendulum swings.

content: 5. (=地位を換える)to change one's post; to shift one's position

content.content: あまり動かない方が君の為だ
It is to your interest to remain in your present position.

content:
うごめく〔蠢く〕
〈自動〉To wriggle; to squirm

content.content: 鼻を蠢かす
to be proud―triumphant―elated with success

content:
うさ〔憂さ〕
〈名〉Gloom; melancholy; tedium

content.content: 憂さを晴らす
to dispel the gloom―relieve the gloom―dissipate the melancholy―relieve the tedium―beguile the tedium
旅の憂さを晴らす
to beguile the tedium of the journey―beguile the way (with conversation)

content:
うさぎ〔兎〕
〈名〉
1. (=飼い兎)the rabbit:(子どもの言葉にては)a bunny
2. (=野兎)the hare

content.content: 兎狩り
a hare-hunt

うさぎうま〔兎馬〕
〈名〉The ass; a donkey

content:
うさん〔胡散〕
〈形〉Suspicious

content.content: あの家は胡散な人物が出入する
That house is frequented by suspicious characters.

content:
うさんくさい〔胡散臭い〕
〈形〉Suspicious-looking

content.content: 胡散臭い奴が家のまわりを徘徊している
A suspicious-looking fellow is prowling about the house.
彼がその金を取ったものとすると胡散臭い
If he took the money, his conduct looks ugly.

content:
うし〔丑〕
〈名〉The ox (one of the twelve zodiacal signs)

content.content: 丑の年
the year of the Ox
丑の時詣り
a midnight visit to a shrine (to pray for vengeance)

content:
うし〔牛〕
〈名〉
1. The neat:(牡牛)a bull:(牝牛)a cow:(去勢牛)an ox:(子牛)a calf:(集合的に言えば)cattle; neat

content.content: 牛を飼う
to keep cows―raise cattle
牛飼い
a cowherd―a neat-herd
牛の群
a herd of cattle
牛を放牧する
to put cattle to pasture
牛一頭、牛十頭
a head of cattle―ten head of cattle
牛の乳
cow's milk
牛の乳をしぼる
to milk a cow
牛の皮
an ox-hide―a cow-hide―neat's leather
牛小屋
a cattle-shed―a cow-house―a neat-house

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 剣を売って牛を買う(に相当するは)
to give up the sword for the plough
(仕事の捗り方は)牛が歩くよう
The work progresses at a snail's pace.
牛のよだれのよう
to be endless―endlessly long
角を矯めて牛を殺す
“The remedy is worse than the evil.”
牛に引かれて善光寺詣り
to make a virtue of necessity
彼には意見をしても牛に経文
Advice will slide off him as water off a duck's back.
牛を馬に乗り換える
to change for the better
牛は牛連れ馬は馬連れ
“Every Jack has his Jill”―“Let beggars mate with beggars.”

content:
うし〔憂し〕
〈叙述形容詞〉(To be) gloomy, melancholy, sad, woeful

content.content: 長らえばまだ
Time may come when these gloomy days
此頃やしのばれん
Look brighter in mine eye,
憂しと見し世ぞ
As for the times that woeful seemed
今は恋しき
I now look back and sigh.
取れば憂し
Sad is my warring trade and tale―
取らねば人の数ならず
Else I should count for nought;
捨つべきものは
I'd fain do penance for the bale
弓矢なりけり
By bow and arrow wrought.

content:
うじ〔氏〕
〈名〉
1. (=家名)a family-name; a surname
2. (=姓名に付すれば)Mister (Mr.―と略す)

content.content: 田中氏
Mr. Tanaka.

content: 3. (=家柄)family; birth

content.content: 氏より育ち
Breeding rather than birth―“Birth is much, but breeding is more.”
彼は氏も育ちも好い
He is well-born and well-bred.
女は氏無くして玉の輿
A woman of no birth may marry into the purple.
彼は氏も素性も無い人だ
He is a man of no family.
当節は氏も素性も要らぬ
Birth counts for nothing nowadays.

content:
うじ〔蛆〕
〈名〉A worm; a larva; a grub; a maggot

content.content: 蛆が涌く
Worms breed.
魚に蛆が湧いた
Worms have bred in the fish―The fish has bred worms.
腐肉に蛆が涌く
Maggots breed in carrion―Carrion breeds maggots.
蛆が涌きそうな汚い小屋だ
It is a squalid hovel.
男孀{おとこやもめ}に蛆が涌く
A widower can not keep himself clean―A widower can not take care of himself.

うしうし
〈間投詞〉(犬をけしかける声)At him!

content:
うじうじする
〈自動〉To be eager, be dying (to do something)

content.content: 近所の若い者はあの娘を欲しがってうじうじしている
The young men of the neighbourhood are dying to have her.

content:
うしお〔潮〕
〈名〉The tide

content.content: 潮の満干
the ebb and flow of the tide―the flux and reflux of the tide―the tides
潮の満干は月の引力による
The ebb and flow of the tide is due to the gravitation of the moon.
群衆は潮の如く入口に押し寄せた
The crowd surged toward the entrance―deluged the entrance.

うしおに〔潮煮〕
〈名〉Fish boiled with salt

content:
うじがみ〔氏神〕
〈名〉A tutelary god

content.content: 仲裁は時の氏神
A peace-maker is the angel of the hour.

うじこ〔氏子〕
〈名〉A prot?g?(of a tutelary god)

content:
うしなう〔失う〕
〈他動〉
1. To lose:(奪われて失う)to be deprived of, be bereft of (anything):(没収されて失う)to forfeit (one's rights, etc.)

content.content: 明を失う
to lose one's eyesight―go blind
地歩を失う
to lose ground
寵を失う
to lose one's master's favour―fall from favour―fall into disgrace
善い物はそれを失って始めてその価値を知る
A good thing is not known till it is lost.
健康はこれを失って始めてそのありがた味を知る
We do not know the blessing of health till we have lost it.
彼死して本校は良教師を失えり
The school has lost a good teacher in him.
機会を失う
to lose a chance―miss an opportunity
彼はノロマでいつも機会を失う
He always loses his chance through slowness―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His slowness always loses him his chance.
彼は職務怠慢のために地位を失った
He lost his place through neglect of duty―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Neglect of duty lost him his place―cost him his place.
この発明をするのに発明者が生命を失った
The inventor lost his life in making this invention―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The invention cost the inventor his life.
御一新に大名が政権を失った
The daimyo's lost their political power at the Restoration―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The Restoration deprived the daimyo's of their political power.
糊口の道を失う
to be deprived of one's daily bread
工場が瓦解すると職工が糊口の道を失う
The collapse of a factory will deprive the operatives of their daily bread.
理性を失う(発狂する)
to be bereft of reason―lose one's wits
この法を犯す者は生命財産を失う
One who violates this law forfeits his life and property.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 職を失う
to be thrown out of employment
彼は職を失って困っている
He is out of employment―out of work.
だまされて好い地位を失った
I have been fooled out of a good position.
度を失う
to be disconcerted
(愕然として)色を失った
He turned pale―changed colour―in alarm.
気を失う
to faint―swoon
面目を失う
to be put out of countenance
得やすきものは失いやすし
“Light come, light go.”

content: 3. (=殺す)to kill

content.content: 人を失う
to kill a man―make away with a man
何々たるを失わぬ
to be still something
彼は欠点が有るにもかかわらず偉人たるを失わぬ
With all his faults, he is still a great man.
他に原因は有るものとしても武士道は日本が今日の隆盛を成せる一大要素たるを失わぬ
Though there may be other causes, Bushido is still one of the great factors of Japan's greatness.

content:
うしみつどき〔丑満時〕
〈名〉The dead hours; the dead of night

content.content: 草木も眠る丑満つ時
It is the dead of night―the witching hour of night.

content:
うじむし〔蛆虫〕
〈名〉Worms; maggots

content.content: 彼らは蛆虫のように集るばかりで何もなすところが無い
They merely swarm like worms without doing anything.

content:
ウジャウジャ
〈副〉In swarms

content.content: あの木に毛虫がウジャウジャいる
That tree swarms with worms.
あの家に鼠がウジャウジャいる
The house swarms with rats and mice.
横町へ入ると子どもがウジャウジャしている
The alleys swarm with children.

うじょう〔有情〕
〈名〉A sentient being; a living thing

content:
うしろ〔後ろ〕
〈名〉The back; the rear; the hinder part:(=の) back; rear; hind; hinder:(=に) at the back; in the rear; behind:(=へ) back; backward

content.content: (日本の給仕人は前に坐る)西洋の給仕人は後ろに立つ
The Japanese waitress sits before you; the foreign waiter stands behind you.
後ろに誰かいるような気がする
I feel as if there were some one behind me.
皆後ろから付いて来た
They followed me―followed at my heels.
後ろに金持ちが付いているから安心しろ
Make yourself easy, for you have a rich man at your back.
後ろを向く
to look back―(ぐるりとなら)―turn on one's heels
後ろを見返る
to look back―look over one's shoulder
敵に後ろを見せる
to turn one's back to the enemy―turn tail
後ろに山を控えて幽邃閑雅{ゆうすいかんが}な庭だ
With an eminence in the background, the garden has a retired and secluded air.
そんなことをしようものなら後ろへ手がまわる
If I do such a thing, I shall have my hands behind my back―I shall be brought to justice.
彼はもう後ろへ手がまわった
He has been arrested―apprehended.

content:
うしろあし〔後ろ足〕
〈名〉A hind leg

content.content: 後ろ足で立つ
An animal stands up on his hind legs.

content:
うしろかげ〔後ろ影〕
〈名〉A retreating figure

content.content: 人の後ろ影を見送る
to gaze after one's retreating figure―gave after one―follow a man with one's eyes

content:
うしろがみ〔後ろ髪〕
〈名〉The back-hair

content.content: 彼と別れた時は後ろ髪を引かれる思いがした
When I parted from him I felt myself pulled by the hair from behind―I felt a great tug at parting.

content:
うしろぐらい〔後ろ暗い〕
〈形〉Shady, underhand, hole-and-corner (transaction, etc.)

content.content: 彼はよく後ろ暗い取引に関係する
He is often mixed up in shady transactions―concerned in hole-and-corner transactions.
後ろ暗いことをする
He engages in underhand dealings―His actions do not bear scrutiny.
彼は決して後ろ暗いことをせぬ
All his actions are above-board.

content:
うしろすがた〔後ろ姿〕
〈名〉A retreating figure; one's appearance from behind

content.content: 人の後ろ姿を見送る
to gaze after one's retreating figure―gaze after one―follow a person with one's eyes
その後ろ姿が君によく似ておった、その後ろ姿が君かと思った
His appearance from behind reminded me of you―I thought you were walking ahead of me.

content:
うしろだて〔後ろ楯〕
〈名〉(後援)support; backing:(後援者)a supporter; a backer

content.content: 彼には三井という後ろ楯がある
He has a supporter in the Mitsuis―He has the Mitsuis at his back.

content:
うしろで〔後ろ手〕
〈名〉Hands tied behind one's back

content.content: 後ろ手に縛る
to tie one's hands behind one's back―bind one's hands behind one's back
犯人は後ろ手に縛られた
The culprit had his hands tied behind his back.

うしろはちまき〔後ろ鉢巻〕
〈名〉A head-band knotted behind

content:
うしろまえ〔後ろ前〕
〈名〉Front and bock; front and rear:(=に) in front and at the back; in front and in the rear; before and behind

content.content: 御馬車の後ろ前を騎兵が護衛する
The Imperial carriage is escorted by cavalry before and behind.
後ろ前にする
to invert the order

content:
うしろむき〔後ろ向き〕
〈名〉Turning one's back toward one

content.content: 後ろ向きになる
to turn one's back toward one
彼は後ろ向きになって坐っていたから顔は見えなかった
I could not see his face, for he sat with his back toward me.

content:
うしろめたい〔後ろめたい〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: うしろぐらい〔後ろ暗い〕

content:
うしろゆびをさす〔後ろ指を指す〕
〈他動〉To point at (one); to point the finger at (one)

content.content: 人に後ろ指を指されぬようにせよ
See that people do not point at you.

content:
うす〔臼〕
〈名〉A wooden mortar

content.content: 臼で搗く
to pound anything in a mortar
杵と臼
mortar and pestle―pounders

うず〔渦〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: うずまき〔渦巻〕

〈名〉A faint light; a glimmering light; glimmer; twilight

content:
うすあばた〔薄痘痕〕
〈名〉Slight pockmarks

content.content: それは薄痘痕のある人じゃないか
Isn't he slightly pockmarked?

content:
うすい〔薄い〕
〈形〉
1. (=厚いに対して薄い)thin

content.content: あの女は唇が薄い
She has thin lips―She is thin-lipped.
唇の薄い者はおしゃべりだという
Thin-lipped people are said to be talkative.
薄い紙
thin paper
薄い着物
thin clothes―light clothes
底の薄い靴
thin-soled shoes
薄く切る
to cut thin
薄く切ったパン
thin slices of bread

content: 2. (=濃いに対して薄い)thin (soup, hair, fog, etc.); light (colour, bread, etc.); weak (tea, coffee, etc.)

content.content: 色が薄い
The colour is too light.
汁じ薄い
The soup is too thin.
コーヒーが薄い
The coffee is too weak.
インキがあまり濃いなら水をいれて薄くする
If the ink is too thick, dilute it with water.
インキが薄くなり過ぎた
The ink has become too thin.
あの女は髪が薄い
She has a thin head of hair.
彼は薄い口髯を生やしている
He wears a thin moustache―a light moustache.

content:
3. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 彼は情が薄い
He is unfeeling―heartless―cold-hearted.
人情が薄い
He has no heart―no feeling―no bowels.
彼らは人情の薄きこと紙の如し
Their hearts are as cold as charity.
この学科は興味が薄い
The subject is devoid of interest.
この商売は利が薄い
The business yields little profit.
彼は影が薄くなった
He has fallen into the shade.
彼は下に薄い
He is not generous towards his subordinates.

content:
うすうす〔薄々〕
〈副〉Dimly; slightly

content.content: そのことは薄々知っておった
I had an inkling of the fact―I had a glimmering of the fact.
事実が薄々わかってきた
The truth dawns upon my mind.
このことは彼に薄々漏らしておいた
I have hinted the matter to him―intimated the matter to him.

content:
うすがみ〔薄紙〕
〈名〉Thin paper

content.content: 薄紙をはがすように快くなる
to recover health gradually―pick up by slow degrees
薄紙を隔てて見るよう
to see through a glass, darkly―One can not get at the exact meaning

content:
うすかわ〔薄皮〕
〈名〉A thin skin; a thin layer; a film

content.content: 薄皮が張る
A film forms.
雪の表面に氷の薄皮ができる

content:
うすぎ〔薄着〕
〈名〉Thin clothing; light clothing:(=する) to be thinly clad; to be lightly clad

content.content: 伊達者の薄着
Dandies are lightly clad.

content:
うすきみわるい〔薄気味悪い〕
〈形〉Unearthly (voice); uncanny (event); weird (laughter of a ghost); eerie (feeling); ominous (silence); nervous (feeling); horrible (disease, etc.)

content.content: あまり静かで薄気味悪い
The silence is ominous.
蛇は薄気味悪いものだ
Snakes are horrible things.
西洋人は薄気味悪がって刺身を食わない
Foreigners do not eat raw fish as if it were something horrible.
こんな薄気味の悪いものは食われん
I can not eat such horrible stuff.
外国人はこの地震国へ来て薄気味悪がっている
Foreigners feel nervous in this land of earthquakes.
狼の遠吠は薄気味悪いものだ
The howling of a wolf will make your blood run cold.

うずく〔疼く〕
〈自動〉To throb with pain; to tingle; to ache

うずくまる〔蹲る〕
〈自動〉To crouch; to squat

content:
うすぐらい〔薄暗い〕
〈形〉Gloomy; sombre; dusk; dusky; dim

content.content: 六時には薄暗くなる
It grows dusk at six.
朝薄暗いうちに立った
I started in the gray of the morning.
この室は薄暗い
The room is not light enough.
今夜は電灯が薄暗い
The electric-light is dim tonight.
室内には薄暗い明かりがついている
The room is dimly lighted.

content:
うすくらがり〔薄暗がり〕
〈名〉Gloom; twilight

content.content: 薄暗がりで読書するのは目に毒だ
Reading in the twilight is bad for the eyes.

うすげしょう〔薄化粧〕
〈名〉Light toilette:(=する) to make a light toilette; to powder one's face lightly; to put on a thin coat of paint

content:
うすごおり〔薄氷〕
〈名〉Thin ice

content.content: 薄氷が張る
Thin ice forms on the water.
薄氷を踏むよう
I feel as if I were treading on eggs.

content:
うすずみ〔薄墨〕
〈名〉Thin ink

content.content: 薄墨を流したような空
a leaden sky

content:
うずたかい〔堆い〕
〈形〉Heaped-up

content.content: うずたかく積み上げる
to pile up in a heap

The bodies lay in heaps.

うすちゃ〔薄茶〕
〈名〉
1. A weak infusion of powdered tea
2. (=薄茶色)light green

〈自動〉(=日が西に入る)(the sun) sets, sinks below the horizon

うすっぺら〔薄っぺら〕
〈形〉
1. (=極めて薄い)very thin; as thin as a wafer; flimsy

content.content: 寒中薄っぺらな蒲団を一枚着て寝た
I had to sleep under a thin coverlet in winter.
こんな薄っぺらな着物じゃ寒い
Such flimsy garments can not keep you warm.

content: 2. (=浅薄)shallow (learning); superficial (knowledge); flimsy (pretext, etc.)

content.content: 学問が薄っぺらだ
His learning is shallow―He has superficial knowledge―He is a sciolist.
そんな薄っぺらな口実では断れない
I can not refuse on such flimsy pretexts.

content.content: あれは薄っぺら者だ
He is a flippant fellow.

content:
うすで〔薄手〕
〈名〉
1. (=薄い出来)thin make

content.content: 薄手の瀬戸物
porcelain of thin make
薄手焼
egg-shell china

content: 2. (=微傷)a slight wound

content.content: 薄手を負う
to be slightly wounded―sustain a slight wound

うすのろ〔薄のろ〕
〈名〉A dolt; a blockhead

うすば〔薄刃〕
〈名〉A thin-bladed kitchen-knife

うすばか〔薄馬鹿〕
〈名〉A dolt; a blockhead

うすべり〔薄縁〕

うずまき〔渦巻〕

1. (=巻く水)a whirlpool; a vortex; an eddy; a swirl

content.content: 渦巻へ巻き込まれる
to be drawn into the vortex―sucked in by a whirlpool

content: 2. (=螺旋)a spiral

うずまく〔渦巻く〕

content:
うずまる〔埋まる〕
