content.content: うまる〔埋まる〕

うずみび〔埋み火〕
〈名〉Banked fire

うすめくら〔薄盲〕
〈名〉A sand-blind person:(=の) sand-blind

うすめる〔薄める〕
〈他動〉To thin (the ranks); to lighten (the colour); to weaken (coffee); to dilute (an acid)

content:
うずめる〔埋める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=葬る)to bury; to inter; to inhume

content.content: 死人を埋める
The dead are consigned to the earth―consigned to the grave.
骨を埋める
to lay one's bones
埋骨何期
What though I may not lay my bones
墳墓地
Wherein my fathers lie?
人間到処
Where'er I stray, I still may find
有青山
Some green spot where to die.

content: 2. (=填充する)to fill (a blank); to fill up (a gap); to stop (a hole); to plug (a hole); to fill in (a moat)

content.content: 空所を埋める
to fill a blank―fill up a gap―fill up a space
穴を埋める
to stop up a hole―fill up a hole―(小さな穴なら)―plug a hole―(不足を補うの意味なら)―make up a deficit
あの事件で一面を埋めた新聞がある
Some papers have devoted a whole page to the affair.
沿道人をもって埋む
The route was crowded with people.

content:
うずもれる〔埋もれる〕
〈自動〉To be buried

content.content: あんな人が田舎に埋もれているのは惜しいものだ
It is a pity that such men should lie buried in the provinces!
世に埋もれている隠君子を掘り出す
to find out men of modest worth who live in obscurity―discover men unknown to fame

うすよう〔薄葉〕
〈名〉A kind of tissue-paper

content:
うずら〔鶉〕
〈名〉
1. A quail

content.content: 一群の鶉
a bevy of quails

content: 2. (=芝居の鶉)a lower box (in a theatre)

うすらぐ〔薄らぐ〕
〈自動〉To fade; to cool; to abate; to flag; to decline; to subside; to go down; to shade off

content.content: 色が薄らいだ
The colour has faded.
色がだんだんに薄らぐ
The colour shades off.
熱心が薄らぐ
One's ardour cools―One's zeal flags.
失敗すると熱心が薄らぐ
Failure dampens one's ardour.
愛が薄らぐ
One's love cools―One grows out of love.
二人の交情が薄らいだ
Their friendship has cooled―They have cooled towards each other―A coldness has come between the two friends.
痛みが薄らいだ
The pain has abated.
民主熱が薄らいできた
The rage for democracy begins to abate.
時がたつと記憶が薄らぐ
Memory fades with the lapse of time.
月日がたつにつれて悲しみが薄らいだ
As time went by, my grief subsided―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Time wore away my grief―Time blunted the edge of my grief.
彼に対する尊敬の念が薄らいだ
My respect for him has declined.
九月になると暑気が薄らぐ
The heat goes down in September.
この小説はしまいの方になると興味が薄らぐ
The story declines in interest towards the end―The novel drags towards the end.

うすらさむい〔薄ら寒い〕
〈形〉Chill, chilly (weather, etc.)

content:
うせもの〔失せ物〕
〈名〉A lost article; lost property; a missing thing

content.content: 失せ物が出た
The missing thing is found.

content:
うせる〔失せる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=消え失せる)to disappear; to vanish; to go out of sight

content.content: さっさと失せおれ
Vanish out of my sight!―Out of my sight, sirrah.

content: 2. (=失われる、無くなる)to be lost; to be missing; to be gone

content.content: 望みは全く失せた
All hope is gone.
彼は昔気質がまだ失せない
He has not lost the old-time spirit yet.
美人は色香が失せる
A beauty loses her roses.
彼女はまだ色香が失せない
She still retains her charms.
年を取っても色香が失せない
Age can not rob her of her charms―She is well conserved.

content:
うそ〔嘘〕
〈名〉
1. (=虚言)a lie; a falsehood; an untruth; a fib; a stretcher; an invention; a fabrication:(子どもの言葉にては)a story:(承知の上の嘘)fiction:(=の) false; untrue; fictitious

content.content: 嘘をつく
to lie―tell a lie―tell a fib―tell a story―utter a falsehood―utter an untruth―stretch―draw on imagination
彼は嘘をつくような人じゃない
He is not the man to tell a lie―He is above telling a lie.
彼の言うことは当てにならぬ嘘をつくくらいは平気だから
He is not to be depended upon, for he will make nothing of lying―make no bones of lying.
あの男は時々嘘をつく
He will stretch on occasion.
ちょいちょい嘘をつく
He will tell fibs.
嘘つき
a liar―a fibster―a story-teller―a mendacious person
彼は言うことが無くなると嘘を言う
When fact fails, he draws on imagination.
嘘が上手だ、嘘が下手だ
He has a good imagination―a poor imagination.
あの人の話に少し嘘が有る
He stretches a little.
この話は一見して嘘だ
The story is false on the face of it.
この話は嘘らしい
The story sounds untrue―sounds like fiction.
まるで嘘のような話だ
It is an incredible story.
嘘じゃない本当だ
It is not false, it is quite true.
評判が嘘だった
The report turned out to be false.
それは大嘘だ
It is a whopping lie―a whopper―a bouncer.
真赤な嘘だ
It is a downright lie―an arrant lie―a lie out of the whole cloth―a pure fabrication―a plumper.
真赤な嘘をつく
to make up a story out of the whole cloth
彼の話は始めからしまいまで嘘だ
His story is a lie out of the whole cloth.
仲人は嘘八百を並べる
A go-between will tell a pack of lies.
よくまああんな白々しい嘘がつけたものだ
I wonder how he can utter such a glaring falsehood―tell such a barefaced lie.
見え透いた嘘だ
It is a transparent lie―a thin lie.
本当らしい嘘
a specious lie
もっともらしい嘘
a plausible lie
罪の無い嘘
a white lie
方便の嘘
pious fraud
嘘も方便
A necessary lie is harmless―“The end justifies the means”―“The end sanctifies the means.”
嘘が嘘を生む
“One lie makes many.”
嘘は後からはげる
“Liars should have good memories.”
嘘は泥棒の始め
“Show me a liar, and I will show you a thief.”
嘘から出た実{まこと}
Truth comes out of falsehood―“Many a true word is spoken in jest.”
嘘で固めた徳川幕府
The Tokugawa regime was a mass of lies.
講釈師見て来た
The story-teller will tell lies
様な嘘を吐き
About an eye-witness's size.

content: 2. (=間違い)a mistake; an error:(=の) mistaken; erroneous; wrong

content.content: 友達に物を隠すのは嘘だ
It is wrong to have secrets from your friend.
君のように医者の薬を飲まないのは嘘だ
It is a mistake to despise medicine like you.
あの先生は嘘を教える
He teaches wrong―He misteaches English.
嘘を教わったのを直す
to unlearn what one has mislearned
嘘字
an erroneous character―a miswritten character

うぞうむぞう〔有象無象〕
〈名〉
1. (=宇宙間に存在する有形無形のすべてのもの)matter and mind
2. (=種々雑多の人間)all sorts of men; all sorts and conditions of men; ragtag and bobtail

content:
うそつき〔嘘吐き〕
〈名〉A liar; a fibster; a story-teller; a mendacious person

content.content: まあなんという嘘つきだろう
Oh, what a story!

content:
うそぶく〔嘯く〕
〈自動〉To whistle

content.content: 虎が嘯く
A tiger purrs.→『そらうそぶく〔空嘯く〕』

content:
うた〔歌〕
〈名〉
1. (=和歌)an ode; a poem; lines:(総称すれば)poetry; song:(短歌)a couplet

content.content: 歌を詠む
to compose a poem―write a poem―indite a couplet
花の歌を詠む
to write a poem in praise of the blossoms―write lines to the blossoms
彼は歌を詠む(歌詠み)
He is a poet.
ちょいと歌を詠む
He is something of a poet―a bit of a poet.
歌を練る
to work a poem―polish a poem―file a poem
彼は歌心が有る
He is of a poetical turn of mind.
彼の事績は歌に詠ぜらる
His deeds are celebrate in song.
歌に師無し
“A poet must be born.”

content: 2. (=唄)a song; a ballad

content.content: 唄を歌う
to sing a song
唄を歌って聞かせんか
Will you sing me a song?―favour me with a song?
彼は唄が上手だ
He is a good singer.
三味線に合わして唄を歌う
to sing to the samisen accompaniment
唄に譜を付ける
to set a song to music

content:
うたい〔謡い〕
〈名〉The classical drama of Japan (as recited)

content.content: 謡いを歌う
to recite the drama (in a peculiar tone)

content:
うだい〔宇内〕
〈名〉The whole world

content.content: 宇内の形勢を察する
to observe the situation of the world

うだいじん〔右大臣〕
〈名〉The Minister of the Right; the Junior Minister (of the old regime)

うたいめ〔歌い女〕
〈名〉(The classical name for) a singing-girl; a geisha

content:
うたう〔歌う〕
〈他動〉To sing; to carol

content.content: 唄を歌う
to sing a song
歌い給え
Won't you sing?
唄を歌って聞かせんか
Will you sing me a song?―Will you favour me with a song?
三味線に合わして歌う
to sing to the samisen accompaniment
ピアノに合わして歌う
to sing to the piano
鼻唄を歌う
to hum an air―hum a tune
飲めや歌えや一寸先は闇よ
“Eat and drink and make merry, for tomorrow you die.”
花笑い鳥歌う
The flowers smile and the birds sing.

うたうら〔歌占〕
〈名〉Divination by poetry

content:
うたかい〔歌会〕
〈名〉A poetry-party; a poem-competition

content.content: 新年御歌会
the New Year's Poetry Party (held at Court)

content:
うたがい〔疑〕
〈名〉
1. (=真偽の疑、疑念)doubt(打ち消しのほかは概して複数); distrust; question

content.content: それは疑い無い
There is no doubt about it―There is no question (but) that it is so.
もうとう疑い無し
There is not the shadow of a doubt about it.
この事実は疑い無し
The fact is beyond doubt―beyond question―beyond dispute―certain.
この事実は決して疑い無し
The fact is past all doubt―past all question―past all dispute―absolutely certain.
成功疑い無し
Success is certain―I am certain of success.
我が勝利疑い無し
Our victory is certain―We are certain of victory.
疑い無く
without doubt―no doubt―doubtless―undoubtedly
所有権に疑いあり
There is a cloud on the title.
眉宇の間に疑いの雲を浮かべた
A cloud of doubt passed across his brow.

content: 2. (=嫌疑、邪推)suspicion; distrust

content.content: 他殺の疑いあり
There is suspicion of foul play.
コレラの疑いあり
There is suspicion of cholera.
あの患者はコレラの疑いがある
He is a suspected case of cholera.
彼はコレラの疑いで避病院へ送られた
He was sent to the isolation hospital on the suspicion of cholera.
彼は収賄の疑いで拘引された
He was taken into custody on the suspicion of corruption.

content:
3. 
〈動詞付〉

content.content: 疑いを懐く、疑いを差し挟む
to entertain doubts―harbour doubts―suggest a doubt
僕はそれについて疑いを懐いている、疑いを起こしている
I have my doubts about it.
疑いが起こる
Doubts arise in my mind.
疑いを解く
to resolve one's doubts―clear one's doubts―dispel one's doubts―satisfy one's doubts
ご講義を承って疑いが全く解けました

On hearing your lecture, all my doubts have been resolved ［cleared, dispelled, satisfied］―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your lecture has resolved all my doubts―cleared all my doubts―dispelled all my doubts―satisfied all my doubts.
証拠充分疑いを容るべき余地無し
The evidence is conclusive. There is no room for doubt―It admits of no doubt.
証拠不充分疑いを容るべき余地有り
The evidence is inconclusive. There is room for doubt―It is open to doubt.
疑いを受ける
to be suspected―incur suspicion―fall under suspicion
彼は収賄の疑いを受けた
He was suspected of corruption.
収賄の疑いを受けている
He lies under suspicion of corruption.
彼は疑いを受けるような人でない
He is above suspicion―His honesty is above suspicion.
疑いが彼にかかった
Suspicion fell upon him―Suspicion rested upon him―Suspicion attached to him―He fell under suspicion.
人に疑いをかける
to suspect one (of a crime)
彼は盗みの疑いをかけられた
He was suspected of theft.
疑いを招く、疑いを起こさせる
to incur suspicion―excite suspicion―arouse suspicion
彼は急に金持ちになって疑いを招いた
He incurred suspicion by suddenly growing rich.
僕は疑いを起こした
I had my suspicion excited―had my suspicions aroused.
その人の様子を見て疑いを起こした
His appearance excited my suspicions―aroused my suspicions.
疑いを招かないように別々に行った
We went each by himself so as not to excite suspicion―to disarm suspicion.
疑いを晴らす
(疑いを受けた人から言えば)to clear oneself of suspicion―establish one's innocence―(疑いを掛けた人から言えば)―clear one's mind from suspicion―(第三者が言えば)―clear up the suspicion
この疑いをぜひ晴らさなければならぬ
I must clear up your suspicions―clear your mind from suspicion―clear myself of suspicion―establish my innocence.
疑い晴らして下しゃんせ
Clear your mind from suspicion!―Set your suspicions at rest!―Let me prove my innocence!
疑いが晴れた
(疑いを受けた人から言えば)―I am cleared of suspicion―(疑いをかけた人から言えば)―My mind is cleared from suspicion―(第三者から言えば)―The suspicion is cleared up―The mystery is cleared up.

うたがいなく〔疑無く〕
〈副〉Without doubt; no doubt; doubtless; undoubtedly

うたがいぶかい〔疑深い〕
〈形〉
1. (=邪推深い)suspicious; distrustful
2. (=信じ難い)incredulous; sceptical

content:
うたがう〔疑う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=真偽を疑う、疑念を起こす)to doubt (if or whether it is true―its truth―of one's success); to be doubtful of (its truth)

content.content: 僕はそれを疑う
I doubt it―I am doubtful of it―I have my doubts about it.
これは事実かどうか疑う
I doubt if it is true―I doubt whether it is true or not―I doubt its truth―I am doubtful of its truth―I have my doubts about its truth.
君の言を疑う者がある
Some people doubt your statement―throw doubt on your statement.
彼が成功するかどうか疑う
I doubt he will succeed―I doubt whether he will succeed or not―I doubt of his success―I am doubtful of his success―I have some doubts as to his success.
僕はこの事実を疑わぬ
I do not doubt the fact―(は古い形、現今は)―I have no doubt of the fact―I make no doubt of the fact.
君の成功することを疑わぬ
I do not doubt but that you will succeed―(は古い形、現今は)―I have no doubt that you will succeed―I make no doubt of your succees.
彼に誠意の有ることはもうとう疑わぬ
I have not the least doubt of his sincerity―I do not entertain a shadow of doubt as to his sincerity.
彼の証言に疑うべき(不審な)点がある
There are some doubtful points in his evidence.
所有権に疑うべき点がある
There is a cloud on the title.

content: 2. (=人の志を疑う、怪しむ、邪推する)to suspect (treachery―one of treachery); to be suspicious of (treachery); to distrust (a man); to be distrustful of (a man)

content.content: あの男は裏切りをしやせぬかと疑っている
I suspect him of treachery―I suspect treachery.
そう人を疑うものでない
You should not suspect people so―distrust people so.
彼はむやみに人を疑う
He suspects people without cause.
人に疑われる
to be suspected―incur suspicion―fall under suspicion
彼は盗みを疑われた
He was suspected of theft.
彼は疑われるような人でない
He is above suspicion―His honesty is above suspicion.
七度尋ねて人を疑え
“Be on sure ground before you accuse.”
彼の言うところに疑うべき(怪しい)点がある
There are some suspicions points in his statement.

content: 3. (=人を危ぶむ)to mistrust (a man); to be mistrustful of (a man)

content.content: 人を疑うなら使わぬがよい
If you mistrust a man, you ought not to employ him.
彼は人を疑いながら重要な事を託している
He is mistrustful of the man he confides in.

content:
うたかた〔泡沫〕
〈名〉A bubble

content.content: うたかたの如く消え失せる
to burst like a bubble

うたがるた〔歌歌留多〕
〈名〉Poem-cards

content:
うたがわしい〔疑わしい〕
〈形〉
1. (=不確かな)doubtful; uncertain

content.content: 成功疑わし
Success is doubtful―I am doubtful of success―Success is uncertain―I am uncertain of success―It is a question if I shall succeed.
あの人は誠意が有るかどうか疑わしい
It is doubtful whether he is sincere or not―His sincerity is doubtful―I doubt his sincerity―I suspect his insincerity.
勝敗疑わし
Victory hangs is doubt―hangs in suspense―hangs in balance―trembles in the balance.
成否疑わし
Success hangs in doubt.
生死疑わし
His life hangs in the balance―He hangs between life and death.
証言に疑わしい(不審な)点がある
There are some doubtful points in evidence.
所有権に疑わしい点がある
There is a cloud on the title.
この疑わしき点をご氷解あらんことを乞う
I beg you will enlighten me on this doubtful point.
疑わしき点は被告の利益に解す
A doubtful point should be interpreted in favour of the accused.
功の疑わしきは重くせよ
A doubtful merit should be rewarded.
罪の疑わしきは軽くせよ
A doubtful crime should not be punished.

content: 2. (=怪しい)suspicious

content.content: 奴の挙動が疑わしい
His movements are suspicious.
奴の挙動が疑わしいと思う
I suspect his movements―I am suspicious of his movements.
近頃よく物が無くなるがどうもあの男が怪しいと思われる
Things have been missing of late. I have reason to suspect that man.
彼の言うところに疑わしい点がある
There are some suspicious points in his statement.

うたぐち〔歌口〕
〈名〉The mouthpiece (of a flute)

うたぐりぶかい〔疑り深い〕
〈形〉Suspicious

content:
うたぐる〔疑る〕
〈他動〉To suspect (a man); to be suspicious of (a man)

content.content: あなたはむやみに人を疑るものじゃありません
You should not suspect people without cause.
彼は誰でも彼でも人を疑る
He is suspicious of everybody.
疑られる
to be suspected―incur suspicion―fall under suspicion

content:
うたごころ〔歌心〕
〈名〉A poetical turn of mind

content.content: あの人は歌心が有る
He is of a poetical turn of mind.

content:
うたた〔転〕
〈副〉More and more; all the more

content.content: 当時を回想すればうたた今昔の感に堪えず
I am all the more struck with the change of times that I look back on those days.

うたたね〔転寝〕
〈名〉A nap; a doze; a snooze:(=する) to nap, take a nap; to doze, fall into a doze, drop off into a doze; to snooze

content:
うだつ
〈名〉The king-post; the queen-posts

content.content: うだつが上がる
to get on in life―rise in the world
こんな処に居ては一生うだつが上がらない
I shall never get on in such a place as this―If I remain here, I shall have no chance of getting on―(他動詞構文にすれば)―My present position offers no promise of advancement.

うたまくら〔歌枕〕
〈名〉A place of poetical associations

うたよみ〔歌詠み〕
〈名〉A poet:(女なら)a poetess

content:
うたれる〔打たれる〕
〈被動〉To be struck

content.content: 雷に打たれる
to be struck by lightning
一人の女が雷に打たれて死んだ
A woman was struck dead by lightning.
雨に打たれる
to be exposed to the rain
滝に打たれる
to be dashed with a cascade―(人なら)―take the waterfall
出る杙{くい}は打たれる
Merit is envied―“Envy will merit as its shade pursue.”
感に打たれた
I was struck (with surprise).
ハテ不思議だという感に打たれた
It struck me as strange.

content:
うたわれる〔謳われる〕
〈被動〉To be reputed; to be famous

content.content: 彼はかつては才子と謳われたことがある
He was once reputed a man of talent.
彼は当時は世に謳われた学者である
He was a famous scholar of the day.
彼は涜職事件で世に醜名を謳われた
He was made notorious by the corruption scandal.
侠名を江戸市中に謳われた
He was famed in the city of Edo as a commoners' champion.
矯名を新橋で謳われている
She is a famous geisha.

content:
うち〔打ち〕
〈名〉A blow

content.content: 一打ちで
with one blow

content:
うち〔内〕
〈名〉
1. (=内部)the inside; the interior:(=の) inside; inner; inward; internal; interior:(=に) in; within; inside; indoors

content.content: 福は内、鬼は外
In with luck! Out with the demon!
今日は内でお遊びなさい
You must play indoors today.
この天気に内にいられるものか
How can I keep indoors in this glorious weather?
音は内から出る
The sound proceeds from within.
内も外も真暗だ
It is dark within and without.
この家は内も外も塗り替えなければならぬ
The house needs painting inside and out.
彼は内を外にして出歩いている
He is always gadding about―always on the gad―a stranger at home.
男は外を治め女は内を治む
Man is for the field, woman for the hearth.
内の恥を外へさらす
to wash one's dirty linen in public

content: 2. (=我が家、家)one's home; one's place; a house

content.content: 彼は内に居ます
He is at home.
内に居ません
He is away from home.
学校へ行って内に居ません
He is away at school.
町へ行って内に居ません
He is away in town.
田舎へ結って内に居ない
He is away in the country.
旅行に行って内に居ない
He is away on a journey.
僕は晩は内に居る
I am at home in the evening.
親方内か
Governor in?
内に居ない
He is out.
彼は内でわがままにしている
He has everything his own way at home.
内へ帰る
to go home―come home
遅いから内へ帰ろう
Let us go home, as it is late.
内へ帰ったのは十二時だった
It was twelve when I got home.
六時までに内へ帰らにゃならぬ
I must get home by six.
内を出る
to leave home
内を出たのは六時だ
I left home at six.
彼は内にばかり引っ込んでいる
He always stays at home―He is a stay-at-home.
内にばかりくすぶっている
He always cowers at home.
彼は内弁慶の外味噌だ
He is a lion at home and a mouse abroad.
彼は外好しの内悪しだ
He is witty abroad and dull at home―He “hangs up the fiddle when he comes home.”
内ほど好い処は無い
There is no place like home.
昨夜内へ泥棒が入った
Our house was broken into last night.
この辺に内がありませんか
Don't you know of any house in the neighbourhood?
これは好い内だ
This is a good house.
僕の今度の内を来て見給え
Come and have a look at my new place!
内の者
my people―my folk
内の人
my husband―my good man
内の嬶
my wife―missis
内の事は妻に任せきりです
I commit all household matters to my wife's care.

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. ［場所］In (the house); inside (the door or gate); within (the walls)

content.content: 座敷の内ではおとなしい
He is quiet when in the room.
門の内に庭がある
There is a garden inside the gate.
鶏を囲いの中に入れておけ
Keep the hens within the enclosure.

content: 2. ［時］In (the daytime); within(a week); in the course of (the day)

content.content: 朝の内に出かけて来よう
I will go out in the morning.
二三日の内に立つ
I leave in a few days.
一週間の内に帰れ
You must be back within a week.
今日の内に仕事を片づけてしまわなけりゃならぬ
I must get my work finished in the course of the day―before the day is out.
今月の内にその金が無けりゃならぬ
I must have the money in the course of the month―before the month is out.

content: 3. (=中)among (scholars); (some) of (them)

content.content: 東京大阪は世界の大都会の内に入っている
Tokyo and Osaka are among the great cities of the world.
海軍国の内で日本は重なる位置を占めている
Japan holds a leading position among the naval powers.
この本の内どれから読もうか
Which of these books shall I begin with?
男の内のお男
the manliest of the men
君は成功した内だ
You are quite a success.
卑下も自慢の内
Too much humility is a sort of pride.
自慢高慢ばかの内
Pride is a sort of folly.
沈黙は承諾の内
“Silence gives consent.”

content: 4. (=から)out of (the number); from among (many)

content.content: 多くの内から選ぶ
to choose from among many
細君なら多くの内から選べ
You can choose your wife from among many―You have a large choice.
この内から一人選べ
Choose one out of the number.
ここにある本の内からどれでも五冊選べ
Choose any five out of these books.

content: 〈接続詞〉While:(打ち消しに伴えば)before

content.content: 若い内に働け
Work while you are young!
年を取らない内に働け
Work before you grow old!
俺が生きている内はお前達に不自由はさせぬ
You shall not want for anything while I live―as long as I am alive.
この息の音のある内はそんなことはさせぬ
It shall not be done while I have a drop left in my veins.
日の出ない内に立とう
Let us start before the sun rises.
遅くならない内に帰ろう
Let us go home before it is late.
明るい内に(暗くならない内に)帰ろう
Let us go home while it is light―before dark.
足下の明るい内にお帰り
Beat a retreat while you can see your way out.
一年たたぬ内に彼女は再婚した
She married again before a year had elapsed―(には次の慣用語法あり)―It was not a year before she married again.
二人は結婚して一月たたぬ内に夫婦げんかを始めた
They had not been married a month before they began to quarrel.
入学して半年たたぬ内に飽きて来た
I had not been in the school six months before I got tired.

content:

He grew up in poverty.
危険の裡に目的を遂げた
He accomplished his purpose amidst dangers.
彼は一家団欒の裡に在り
He is in the bosom of his family.

content:

〈自動〉To be washed ashore; to be cast ashore

The body was washed ashore at Omori.

content:
うちあけばなし〔打明け話し〕
〈名〉A confidence; a disclosure

content.content: 彼が問わず語りに打ち明け話をしてとうとう一夜を明かした
We talked the night away in voluntary confidences on his part.

content:
うちあける〔打明ける〕
〈他動〉To confide, disclose, divulge, reveal (a secret to one); to unbosom oneself of, unburden one's heart of, disburden one's heart of (a secret); to confess, make a clean breast of (a guilt); to lay open, lay bare (a scheme to one); to open (one's heart or mind); to let (one) into (the secret); to admit (a person) into one's confidence

content.content: 彼にも秘密を打ち明けておく必要がある
We must let him into the secret―He must be let into the secret.
この秘密は君だけに打ち明けるのだ
I will confide the secret to you alone.
彼は僕だけにごく内々で秘密を打ち明けた
He revealed the secret to me alone in strict confidence.
久しくたってからようやく彼は秘密を打ち明けた
It was long before he unburdened himself of a secret.
君に打ち明けたいことがある
There is something of which I wish to unbosom myself to you.
彼は事実を打ち明けた
He revealed the truth to me.
心を打ち明ける、意中を打ち明ける、胸中を打ち明ける
to open one's mind―open one's heart―to some one
心底を打ち明ける
to reveal one's inmost thoughts to some one
君の計画を打ち明け給え
Will you lay open your scheme to me?―lay bare your scheme to me?
彼は一伍一什を打ち明けた
He confessed everything―He made a clean breast of it.
あの人には万事を打ち明けて付き合っている
I have admitted him into my confidence―He is in my confidence.
打ち明けて申せば妻は臨月です
To be frank with you, my wife is near her time.
このことは誰にも打ち明けずに置く
I keep the matter to myself.
殊に彼には打ち明けない
I especially keep him in the dark about the matter.

content.content: 彼は何事にも打ち込む質だ
He will go, heart and soul, into any scheme.
学問に打ち込んでいる

content:
うちすてる〔打捨てる〕
〈他動〉To let (one) alone; to leave (one) alone; to leave (one) in peace; to leave (one) to oneself; to let (anything) be; to let (anything) go; to let (anything) pass; to pass over (a matter); to lay aside (a book); to neglect (one's work)

content.content: 彼にかまうな、打ち捨てておけ
Do not molest him! Let him alone!―Leave him alone!―Leave him in peace!―Let him be!
打ち捨てておけば独りで帰って来る
Let him alone, and he will return of his own accord.
打ち捨てておけばひとりでに死んでしまう
If left to himself, he will die of himself.
親子の情として打ち捨てておかれぬ
My parental affection forbids my leaving him alone.
彼のわがままは打ち捨てておかれぬ
I can not leave him to have his own way.
このことはこのままに打ち捨てておかれぬ
I can not pass over the matter in silence―leave the matter as it is―let the matter rest here.
君の一身上に関することだから打ち捨てておかれぬ
The matter concerns your welfare. You must look to the matter―The matter must be looked to.
間違いは間違いだが打ち捨てておけ
It is a mistake, to be sure, but let it go―let it pass.
この仕事は一年も打ち捨ててある
The work has been neglected―laid aside―for a year.
本を打ち捨てて銃を取る
The book is laid aside for the gun.
打ち捨てておかれぬ弊害だ

content:
うちょうてん〔有頂天〕
〈名〉Ecstasy; rapture

content.content: 彼は有頂天になっている
He is in ecstasies―in raptures―in the Seventh Heaven.
嬉しがって有頂天になっている
He is in an ecstasy of joy―in a transport of joy―in the Seventh Heaven of joy―beside himself with joy.
成功して有頂天になっている
Success has turned his head.
有頂天で我が家へ帰った
I went home treading upon air.

content:

content.content: 浪が逆巻いて磯に打ち寄せる
The sea surges upon the beach.
小波が渚に打ち寄せる

1. A round fan

content.content: 団扇で扇ぐ
to fan
団扇を使う
to use a fan―fan oneself
左団扇で暮らす
to live in ease and luxury―live in clover
親達は左団扇で暮らしている
The parents batten on their daughter's shame.
行司団扇
the umpire's fan
団扇を揚げる、団扇が揚がる
to raise the fan―The fan is raised
行司は誰に団扇を揚げたか
In whose favour did the umpire raise his fan?―Whom did the umpire declare the victor?
行司が東の方に団扇を揚げた
The umpire raised his fan in favour of the East―declared the East the victor―declared for the East.
団扇が東の方に揚がった
The umpire's fan was raised in favour of the East―The East was declared the victor.
君は誰に団扇を揚げるか
To whom do you adjudge the palm?

内輪で芝居見物に来ておった
They were at the play in a family party.
内輪だ
They are members of the same family.
内輪げんか
a family quarrel―family dissensions

content: 2. (=内部)the internal part:(=の) internal

content:

content.content: あの会社には内輪もめがある
There are internal troubles in that company―The company is troubled with internal strife.
あの家は内輪もめが絶えぬ
That family is constantly troubled with internal dissensions―subject to constant internal dissensions.
敵軍には内輪もめがある
The hostile army is divided against itself.
このことから内輪もめを生じた
The matter gave rise to internal troubles.
内輪もめがやっと静まった
The internal troubles have subsided at last.

to dispel one's gloom―chase one's gloom away―dissipate one's melancholy―divert one's mind from care―distract one's mind from cares―amuse oneself

content:
うつ〔撃つ〕
〈他動〉To fire; to shoot; to discharge

content.content: 鉄砲を撃つ
to fire a gun―discharge a gun―shoot a gun
撃て(号令)
Fire!
ドンドン撃て
Fire away!
一発撃つ
to fire a shot
(猟に行って)今日は一発も撃たない
I have not had a shot today.
鳥を撃つ
to shoot a bird
雉子を三羽撃った
I have shot three pheasants.
(彼は猟に行って)誤って撃たれたのだ
He went shooting, and got shot by accident.
彼はピストルで撃たれた、撃ち殺された
He was shot with a revolver―shot dead with a revolver.
心臓を撃ち抜かれた
He was shot through the heart.
足を一本撃ち落とされた
His leg was shot off―He had a leg shot off.
乗っている馬を撃たれた
His horse was shot under him―He had his horse shot under him.
船は水際を撃たれた
The ship was hit between wind and water.

content:
うつ〔打つ〕
〈自他動〉
1. To strike (one); to beat (one's wife); to hit (one):(平手で打つ)to slap (one):(ドンドンと打つ)to knock (at the door)

content.content: この人はどうもせぬのに僕を打ちました
This man has struck me without provocation.
倒れる敵手を打つなかれ(英国の民間道徳)
“Never hit a man who is down.”
人の頭を打つ
to strike a man on the head―(強く打つ)―strike one a hard blow on the head
頭を打たれた
I was struck on the head―I received a blow on the head.
人を打とうとする、打って掛かる
to strike at a man
彼は棒を取って打って掛かって来た
He took a cudgel, and struck at me.
人を打ち倒す
to knock one down
あの人は女房を打つ
He beats his wife.
打つな叩くな
Do not beat her!
人の背中を打つ
to slap one on the back
胸を打つ
to beat one's breast
彼は膝を打って(感心した)
He slapped his thigh.
太鼓を打つ
to beat a drum
門を打つ
to knock at the door
門を打てども叩けども応ずる者のあらばこそ
I might knock and knock at the door, but never a man answered.
脈が打つ
The pulse beats.
動脈が脈を打つ
An artery pulsates.
波が岸を打つ
The sea beats against the shore.
雨が窓を打つ
The rain beats against the window.
雷に打たれる
to be struck by lightning
一人の女が雷に打たれて死んだ
A woman was struck dead by lightning.
時計が時を打つ
The clock strikes the hour.
もう十二時打ったか
Has it struck twelve?
今十二時打つ処だ
It is on the stroke of twelve.
感に打たれた
I was struck (with surprise).

2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 釘を打つ
to drive a nail
網を打つ
to cast a net
水を打つ
to sprinkle the ground with water

The whole house is hushed―Hushed silence reigns over the house―A pin might be heard to drop.
刀を打つ
to forge a sword―make a sword
鐘を打つ
to toll the bell―ring the bell
半鐘を打つ
to ring the alarm-bell―clang the alarm-bell

to whip cotton―willow cotton
麦を打つ
to thresh wheat―thresh barley

to braid a braid

to make macaroni

to be exposed to the rain
滝に打たれる
to be dashed with a cascade―(人なら)―to take the waterfall

Merit is envied―“Envy will merit as its shade pursue.”
碁を打つ
to play go
ばくちを打つ
to gamble
点を打つ
to dot―(非を打つの意味なら)―blame a fault―censure one's conduct―find fault with anything
非を打たれるようなことをするな
Do not lay yourself open to censure.
点の打ち処が無い、非の打ち処が無い

(品物なら)The article is faultless―perfect―(行いなら)―His conduct is above reproach―(支度なら)―His dress is unimpeachable―(文章なら)―The style leaves nothing to be desired―(教師としてなら)―He is everything a teacher should be―a perfect teacher―(細君としてなら)―She is everything a wife should be―an ideal wife―(万事なら)―Everything is as it should be.
銘を打つ
to cut one's name (on a sword)―sign one's work
この刀は正宗と銘が打ってある
This sword bears Masamune's signature.
電報を打つ
to send a telegram―despatch a telegram―wire to one
金が要る時はそのように電報を打て
When you want money, wire me to that effect.
人の説に不審を打つ
to throw doubt on one's statement
彼は「勿論さ」と合い槌を打った
He chimed in with “Of course!”
縄を打つ
to bind a criminal―put a criminal in bonds
田を打つ
to till the rice-fields
天幕を打つ
to pitch a tent
錨を打つ
to cast anchor―drop anchor
芝居を打つ
to give a play
芝居は三十日打ち続けた
The play ran for 30 days―The play had a run of 30 days.
不意を打つ
to take one by surprise
不意を打たれて返答に窮した
Taken by surprise, I was at a loss for an answer.
もんどり打つ
to turn a somersault
もんどり打って倒れる
to tumble over―roll over

content:
うつ〔討つ〕
〈他動〉To attack (the enemy); to strike (the enemy in the rear); to send a punitive expedition against (the rebels); to punish (the rebels) to make war on (a country):(敵を殺すの意味なら) to slay (the enemy)

content.content: 敵を討て
Attack the enemy!―Strike!
長州を討てという命が尾張に下った
Owari was ordered to send an army against Choshu.
賊を討つ
to send an expedition against the rebels―punish the rebels
天皇は尊{みこと}をして賊を討たしむ
The Emperor sent the prince against the rebels.
尊は賊を討たせ給う
The prince punished the rebels.
腹背より敵を討つ
to strike the enemy in front and rear
十郎は五郎に討てと言う
Juro bids Goro slay the enemy.
君父の仇を討つ
to avenge one's father or one's lord
四十七士は君の仇を討った
The Forty-Seven avenged their lord―avenged their lord's death.
不意を討つ
to take one by surprise
不意を討たれて返答に窮した
Taken by surprise, I was at a loss for an answer.

content:

content.content: 手を拍つ
(拍手なら)to clap one's hands―(人を呼ぶためなら)―clap hands―(約束をきめるためなら)―strike hands (on a bargain)
彼は手を拍って笑った
He clapped his hands for joy.
手を拍って女中を呼んだ
I called the servant by clapping hands.
もうここいらで手を拍とうじゃないか
Let us strike hands on the bargain!―strike a bargain!―close a bargain!

content:
うつうつ〔欝々〕
〈副〉Gloomily; moodily

content.content: 欝々として楽します
I am depressed in spirits―in low spirits―in the dumps―in the dismals―in the doldrums―in the blues―I have a fit of the blues―I have the mopes.
欝々として日を暮らす
to mope one's time away
彼は欝々とした顔をしている
He has a gloomy face―a glum look.

content:
ウッカリ
〈副〉
1. Inadvertently; heedlessly; unguardedly; in an unguarded moment

content.content: ついウッカリ秘密を漏らしてしまった
I revealed the secret in an unguarded moment―I blurted out the truth.
ウッカリものを言うな
Be guarded in your speech!
ウッカリそう言ってしまった(言質を取られた)
I forgot myself and said so―I have committed myself.
その乞食はウッカリ「生まれつきの唖です」と答えた
The beggar forgot himself and answered, “I was born dumb.”
あんな者をウッカリ信用したのが僕の失錯だ
I made a mistake in allowing myself to trust such a man.
ついウッカリばかなことをしてしまった
I allowed myself to commit a folly―I was betrayed into folly.
ついウッカリだまされた
I suffered myself to be imposed upon.
女がウッカリ男の口車に乗せられた
She suffered herself to be cajoled by the man.
彼の言うことはウッカリ信じられぬ
You can not take his statement on trust.
こりゃウッカリ手が出せぬわい
This is delicate business, I declare.
ウッカリ言ったことだ
It was a heedless remark.
ウッカリしたことだ
It was an inadvertent action.

content: 2. (=する) to forget

content.content: ついウッカリしておった

ついウッカリしているうちに汽車が目的地を通り越してしまった

content.content: 学校を郊外へ移した

content.content: すると傍聴人は被告の方へ視線を移した

Japaneses gardening is copied from nature.

content: 2. (=絵に写す)to represent (in painting)

to photograph―take a photograph of―anything

The character of the hero is well delineated.
この小説は好く実を写している

樹木うっそうたり
The trees have a luxuriant foliage.
樹木うっそうとして昼なお暗し
The sun can not penetrate the luxuriant foliage of the trees.

content:
うったえ〔訴え〕
〈名〉
1. (=訴訟)a lawsuit; a suit (-at-law); an action (at law); legal proceedings:(=る) to go law (with a person); to bring an action against (one); to institute a suit against (one); to institute legal proceedings against (one); to proceed against (one); to sue, prosecute (a person―for a debt)

content.content: 裁判所へ訴える
to complain to a law-court―sue at a court
金を返さなければ訴えます
If you will not pay me, I will bring an action against you―proceed against you.
被害者が訴えた
The injured party went to law.
そんなことをすると訴えるぞ
Then I will sue you―prosecute you.
僅かばかりの貸金請求に訴えては割りに合わぬ
It does not pay to sue for small debts―persecute for small debts.
訴えても取ってみせる
I will have the law of him.

content: 2. (=告訴)accusation; arraignment; indictment; complaint; charge:(=る) to accuse (one of fraud); to arraign, indict (one for fraud); to charge (one with fraud); to complain (to the magistrate of fraud); to lodge a complaint against, lodge an accusation against (one)

content.content: 彼は詐欺取財で訴えられた
He was accused of fraud―charged with fraud.
それでは刑事問題にして君を訴えなければならぬ
Then I shall be obliged to lodge a complaint against you.
村民が村長へ苦情を訴えた
The villagers complained to the headman of the grievance.

content: 3. (=届け)a report; a notice:(=る) to report (to the authorities); to notify (the authorities); to give notice (to the authorities)

content.content: 警察へ訴える
to report to the police―give notice to the police―communicate with the police

content: 4. (=上申)submission (of a case to a superior):(=る) to submit (a case to a superior); to lay (a case) before (a superior); to refer to (a person)

content.content: この事件は校長に訴うべきことだ
The case ought to be submitted to―laid before―the principal.
何でも争いが起こると必ず彼に訴える
He is referred to in all disputes.

content: 5. (=不平、苦情)a complaint:(=る) to complain (of some grievance―to a person of some grievance)

content.content: 彼は不公平を訴えている
He complains of injustice.
子どもが頭痛を訴えている
The child complains of a headache.
息子の不行状を父のもとに訴えた
I complained to the father of his son's conduct.
殺人の罪天に訴う
The blood of the innocents cry to Heaven for vengeance.
仰いで天に訴え伏して地に叫ぶ
I cry to heaven and earth for vengeance.

content: 6. (=手段を用いること)resort; recourse; appeal:(=る) to resort to (force); to have recourse to (violence); to appeal to (arms); to go to (war)

content.content: 干戈に訴える、兵力に訴える
to appeal to arms―go to war
腕力に訴える
to resort to force―have recourse to force
こういう場合には腕力に訴えるよりほかは無い
In such cases, recourse must be had to force.
この人は何をしたとて君はそのような暴行に訴えるのか
What has this man done that you should resort to such violence?
輿論に訴える
to appeal to public opinion
(議会を解散して)国論に訴える
to appeal to the country―go to the country

content: 7. (=同情などを促すこと)appeal:(=る) to appeal to (the heart, etc.)

content.content: 同情に訴える
to appeal to one's sympathy
そうすれば相手の感情に訴えることになる
Then you will appeal to his feelings.
人情に訴える
to appeal to human nature
親の情に訴えて頼んでみ給え
You must appeal to the father―appeal to the mother.
目に訴える芸術は演劇
The drama appeals to the eye.
耳に訴える芸術は音楽
Music appeal to the ear.
理性に訴える
to appeal to reason―consult the dictates of reason
君の理性に訴えればわかることだ
Your reason will tell you.

うったえでる〔訴え出る〕
〈他動〉To complain (to the office of some nuisance); to report (to the police of robbery, etc.)

content:
うっちゃらかす〔打遣らかす〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: うっちゃる〔打遣る〕

content:
うっちゃりっぱなし〔打遣りっぱなし〕
〈名〉Neglect; negligence

content.content: うっちゃりっぱなしにする
to neglect
子どもらはうっちゃりっぱなしだ
The children are neglected―left to take care of themselves.
彼は用事をうっちゃりっはなししておしゃべりばかりしている
He neglects his business, and does nothing but talk―He talks his time away, neglectful of his business.

content:
うっちゃる〔打遣る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=捨てる)to throw away; to cast away; to abandon

content.content: そんな物はうっちゃってしまえ
Throw it away!―Throw it to the dogs!
金を溝へうっちゃるようなものだ
The money is as good as thrown away―It is a sheer waste of money.
時と金をうっちゃっるようなものだ
It will be time and money thrown away.
女をうっちゃる
to abandon a girl―give over a girl―discard a mistress

content: 2. (=打捨てる)to neglect (anything); to leave (one) in peace; to leave (one) alone; to let (one) alone; to let (one) be; to leave (one) to oneself; to let (anything) go; to let (anything) pass; to pass over (a matter); to lay aside (one's work, etc.)

content.content: 彼にかまうな、うっちゃっておけ
Do not molest him! Leave him alone!―Let him alone!―Let him be!―Take no notice of him!
どうぞうっちゃっておいて下さい
Please let me alone!
小僧が逃亡したってうっちゃっておけば独りで帰って来る
Let him alone, and he will return of his own accord.
殺すには及ばないうっちゃっておけばひとりでに死んでしまう
If left to himself, he will die of himself.
親子の情としてうっちゃっておけない
My parental affection forbids my leaving him alone.
彼のわがままをうっちゃっておくわけにはいかぬ
I can not leave him to have his own way.
このことはこのままにうっちゃっておかれん
I can not pass over the matter in silence.
君の一身上に関する大事だからうっちゃっておかれんぞ
The matter concerns your welfare, so you must look to it―so it must be looked to.
この仕事は一年間うっちゃってある
The work has been neglected―laid aside―for a year.
本をうっちゃって鉄砲を取る
The book is laid aside for the gun.
間違いはうっちゃっておけ
It is a mistake, to be sure, but let it go―let it pass.
事のなりゆきに任してうっちゃっておけ
Let things take their course!―Let things slide!
うっちゃっておけばひとりでにどうかなる
Let things alone, and they will come round of themselves.
人をうっちゃっておけば浮く者は浮く沈む者は沈む
Leave a man to sink or swim!
うっちゃっておかれぬ弊害だ
It is a crying evil.

content:
うつつ〔現〕
〈名〉
1. (=現実)reality

content.content: 夢か現か
Is this a dream or a realty?

content: 2. (=目を覚ましていること)waking

content.content: 夢にも現にも忘れぬ
I can not forget her, waking or sleeping.

content: 3. (=夢心地)reverie; trance

content.content: 彼は現だ
He is in a reverie―in a trance.
現を抜かす
to abandon oneself to―give oneself up to―surrender oneself to―anything
彼は遊びに現を抜かしている
He is abandoned to pleasures―given over to pleasures.
あの女に現を抜かしている
He is infatuated with the woman―taken with the girl―gone on the girl.

content:
うって〔討手〕
〈名〉A punitive force

content.content: 賊軍に対して討手を向ける
to send a punitive force against the rebels

content:
うってかかる〔打って掛かる〕
〈他動〉To strike at (one)

content.content: その男は棒を取って打って掛かって来た
Taking a cudgel, he struck at me.

content:
うってかわる〔打って変る〕
〈自動〉To undergo a complete change

content.content: 前とは打って変わって善人になった
He has turned over a new leat―turned saint.
この前とは打って変わって親切な扱いぶり
He was as kind to me as he had been unkind before.

content:
うってでる〔打って出る〕
〈自動〉To enter the lists (against some one)

content.content: 彼は天下の富豪を先へまわてして競争場裡に打って出た
He entered the lists against one of the millionaires of the land.
旧主人を相手に打って出るとは大胆不敵
It is audacious of him to enter the lists against his former master.
逐鹿場裡に打って出る
to put up as a candidate―stand for Tokyo
彼は憲政擁護を標榜して打って出た
He put up on the platform of “the constitution in danger.”

content:
うっとうしい〔欝陶しい〕
〈形〉Gloomy (sky); depressing (day); dull (weather)

content.content: 天気が欝陶しい
The weather is gloomy―The weather is depressing―It is dull weather.
連日の雨天で欝陶しい
The long rain casts a gloom over everything.
家のまわりの樹木が茂って欝陶しい
The tree around make the house gloomy.

content:
ウットリ
〈副〉Absent-mindedly; abstractedly; in a trance; in stupor; with rapture:(=した) absent-minded; abstracted; entranced; enraptured; rapt

content.content: 彼は細君に死なれてウットリしていた
He was stupefied with grief.
ウットリして女の顔を眺めておった
He gazed in her face with rapture.
ウットリしてその美音を聴いておった
He listened to the melody with rapt attention.
あまり感心してウットリしていた
I was rapt in wonder―lost in admiration.

うつぶしに〔俯伏しに〕
〈副〉On one's face:(=なる) to lie on one's face:(=する) to lay (anything) face downward

うつぶす〔俯伏す〕
〈自動〉To lie on one's face

うつぶせる〔俯伏せる〕
〈他動〉To lay (anything) face downward

content:
うっぷん〔鬱憤〕
〈名〉Grudge; resentment

content.content: 彼は僕に対して鬱憤を含んでいる
He bears me a grudge―He owes me a grudge―He has a grudged against me.
鬱憤を晴らす
to wreak one's grudge (on one's enemy)
侮辱されて鬱憤を漏らす
to resent an insult

content:
うつぼつ〔欝勃〕
〈形〉Pent up

content.content: 欝勃たる精力
pent-up energy

content:
うつむきに〔俯向きに〕
〈副〉With one's face downward; face downward; on one's face; with one's eyes fixed on the ground

content.content: うつ向きに寝る
to lie on one's face
うつ向きに転ぶ
to fall on one's face
女の土左衛門はうつ向きに浮く
A drowned woman floats on her face.
死骸がうつ向きに横たわっていた
The corpse lay on its face―The corpse lay there, face downward.
女はうつ向きになって僕に付いて来た
She followed me with her eyes fixed on the ground.→『うつむく〔俯向く〕』

うつむく〔俯向く〕
〈自動〉To turn one's face downward; to turn on one's face; to look down; to fix one's eyes on the ground

content:
うつむける〔俯向ける〕
〈他動〉To turn (anything) face downward; to turn (one's face) downward

content.content: 顔をうつ向ける
to turn one's face downward―look down

content:
ウツラウツラ
〈副〉Drowsily:(=する) to drowse; to doze

content.content: 一晩ウツラウツラして明かした
I passed the whole night between waking and sleeping.

うつり〔移り〕
〈名〉A trifle sent back in acknowledgment of a present

content:
うつり〔映り〕
〈名〉
1. (=写真や印刷の映り)impression

content.content: 写真の映りが悪い
The photo is badly taken―The photo has taken badly.
心に映りのハッキリした物は記憶に残る
A clear impression is retained in the memory.

content: 2. (=色の映り、配合)match

content.content: 赤と緑は映りが好い
Red and green match well.
紺地に金は映りが好い
Gold shows well on blue.

content: 3. (=絵の映り、様子)effect

content.content: この絵は映りが好い
The painting has a good effect.

content:
うつりが〔移り香〕
〈名〉Sticking smell; lingering scent

content.content: 魚を食う時鋼のナイフを使わないのは鋼は移り香がするからだ
Fish is not eaten with a steel knife, for steel retains the smell.
袖の移り香
recollection of a meeting

content:
うつりかわり〔移り変り〕
〈名〉Change; transition

content.content: 世の移り変わり
the changes of the world―the change of times―the march of times

content:
うつりかわる〔移り変る〕
〈自動〉To change

content.content: 世は移り変わる
The world changes―The world wags―The world goes on its way―The times change.

うつりぎ〔移り気〕
〈名〉Caprice:(=な) capricious; fickle; volatile

content:
うつりゆく〔移り行く〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: うつりかわる〔移り変る〕

content:
うつる〔移る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=変る)to change

content.content: 世は移り行く
The world changes―The times change.
移れば変わる世なる哉
How the times change!
世と共に移る
to move with the times

content: 2. (=位置を換える)to change position; to move, shift (from on place to another)

content.content: 経済の中心がロンドンからニューヨークへ移りつつある
The economic centre is shifting from London to New York.
避暑客が海岸から山へ移った
The summer visitors have moved from the seaside to the mountains.
乗組員は本船を乗り捨てて端艇に移った
The ship's company left the ship to her fate, and took to the boats.

content: 3. (=転ずる)to turn; to pass

content.content: 談話が問題から問題へと移る
The talk passes from subject to subject.
話が自然世間の不景気のことに移った
The conversation naturally turned on―drifted to―the badness of the times.
この家が僕の手に移ったのはその時だ
Then it was that the house passed into my hands.

content: 4. (=転居する)to remove (to another place); to move (into the neighbourhood)

content.content: 彼は麻布の方へ移りました
He has removed to Azabu.
ご近所へ移って来ました
I have moved into your neighbourhood.
いつ御新宅へお移りになりますか
When do you move into your new house?

content: 5. (=経つ)to pass; to elapse

content.content: 時が移る
Time passes―Time elapses―Time goes by―Time goes on.
時の移るのが早い
Time flies.
面白く遊んでいると時の移るのが早い
Pleasure makes time fly.
閑話時の移るを知らず
I took no note of time while chatting.

content: 6. (=伝染する)to be infectious; to be contagious; to be catching; to be taking

content.content: この熱は移る
The fever is catching.
熱病が看護婦に移った
The nurse has caught the fever.
コレラは移る
Cholera is infectious.
コレラが家人に移った
The inmates are infected with cholera.
彼女の梅毒は夫から移ったのだ
She has caught her syphilis from her husband.
移る病
an infectious disease―a contagious disease
欠伸{あくび}は移る
Yawning is catching.

content: 7. (=延焼する)to spread to (a house); to catch (a house)

content.content: 火がたちまち隣家に移った
The fire soon spread to the neighbouring house―The fire soon caught the neighbouring house―(と言うよりも普通は)―The neighbouring house soon caught fire.

content:
うつる〔映る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=反映する)to reflect itself, be reflected; to image itself, be imaged; to mirror itself, be mirrored; to glass itself, be glassed

content.content: 顔が鏡に映る
The face is reflected in the glass.
鏡に映った顔
the face reflected in the glass―the reflection of the face in the glass―the image of the face in the glass
この鏡はおかしく映る
The glass distorts your features.
山が湖水に映る

The mountain reflects itself in―is reflected in―images itself in―is imaged in―mirrors itself in―is mirrored in―glasses itself in―is glassed in―the lake―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The lake reflects―images―mirrors―glasses―the mountain.
障子に影法師が映る
A shadow falls on the paper-screen.

content: 2. (=写真に取れる)to be impressed; to be taken; to take

content.content: 写真が好く映った
The photo is well taken―The photo has taken well.
かなりに映った
It is fairly taken.
君の顔は好く映る
Your face takes well.
幽霊が写真にボンヤリ映っている
A ghost is dimly impressed on the photograph.
心にハッキリ映った物は記憶に残る
A clear impression in retained in the memory.

content: 3. (=配合する)to match

content.content: 赤と緑は好く映る
Red and green match well.
紺地に金は好く映る
Gold shows well on blue.

content: 4. (=似合う)to become (one)

content.content: その洋服は君に好く映る
That suit becomes you very well.
情が映る
to be appealed to the heart―moved―touched―affected
そんな話しようでは情が映らぬ
That is not the way to appeal to the heart of your audience―to move your audience.
別れの場は情が映る
The parting scene is moving―touching―affecting.
夫婦の情が映る
Man and wife love each other.
情が映れば子が出来る
A child is the pledge of affection.

うつろ〔空〕
〈名〉A hollow:(=の) hollow

うつろぎ〔空木〕
〈名〉A hollow tree; a hollow trunk

うつろぶね〔独木舟〕
〈名〉A canoe; a dugout

content:
うつわ〔器〕
〈名〉
1. (=容器)a vessel; a utensil; a receptacle

content.content: 人は病の器
“Flesh is heir to many ills.”

content: 2. (=器量)talent; ability; capacity; calibre

content.content: 人に将たる器あり(器にあらず)
He has a talent for generalship―no talent for generalship.
彼は偉人の器が有る
He has in him the making of a great man.
器が大きい、器が小さい
He is a man of large calibre―a man of small calibre.
その器にあらず
He is not the man for it―unfit for the post―unequal to the task.

content:
うで〔腕〕
〈名〉
1. The arm

content.content: 前腕
the forearm
二つの腕
the upper arm
腕を組む、腕を拱く
to fold one's arms
腕を拱いて考えておった
He was thinking with his arms folded.
彼は腕を拱いて傍観している
He looks on with folded arms―remains an idle spectator.
腕を拱いて傍観するに忍びぬ
I can not remain a mere spectator―remain an unconcerned spectator.
人と腕を組む、腕を組み合わす
to link one's arm through another's―link arm in arm
夫婦が腕を組んで歩いている
Man and wife are seen walking arm in arm.
腕をまくる
to bare one's arms―turn up one's sleeves―roll up one's sleeves
腕を折る
to break one's arm―get one's arm broken
腕を吊っている
He has his arm in a sling.
彼らは腕をさすって待っている
They are straining at the leash―eager for the fray.
腕が鳴る、腕がうなる
One's fingers are itching to do it―One is eager to exhibit one's skill.
腕押し
wrestling with one's arm
腕仕事
manual labour
腕頸
the wrist
腕時計
a wrist-watch
腕飾り、腕輪
a bracelet

content: 2. (=腕力)force

content.content: 腕沙汰に及ぶ
to resort to force
腕だてをする
to come to blows
腕ずくで取ってみせる
I will take it by force.

content: 3. (=腕前) talent; ability; powers; art; skill

content.content: 彼は好い腕を持っている、腕が利く
He has ability―He is an able man.
君の腕ならどんな地位でも得られる
Your ability will secure you any position.
彼は腕も人並みになった
He has acquired a fair degree of ability.
結局は腕のある者が勝つ
Ability wins in the long run.
彼は腕に覚えがある
He is conscious of his powers.
腕を揮るう
to exercise one's talent―exhibit one's skill
腕を磨く
to improve one's skill―improve one's ability
腕を磨いて千載一遇の機会を待て
Prepare yourself for a golden opportunity!
腕を練る、腕を鍛える
to improve oneself in an art
腕を鍛え上げる
to perfect oneself in an art
彼は腕が上がった、腕が冴えた
He has improved in his skill―improved in his ability.
腕がメッキリ上がった
His ability shows a marked improvement―He shows a marked improvement in his skill.
彼は腕が冴えている
He shows masterly skill in his art.
腕の冴えた職人だ
He is a smart workman.
腕が枯れる
One's skill matures.
凄い腕
unearthly skill―shrewdness―sharpness
あの女は腕が凄い
She is a shrewd woman―a sharp woman.
主人を相手にしては腕が鈍る
One can not put forth one's skill against one's master.
腕を試す
(自分の腕なら)to try one's hand (at anything)―(人の腕なら)―put one's ability to the test
彼は腕自慢だ
He is proud of his skill.
腕を比べる
to try one's ability against another's―match oneself against another in ability
腕比べ
a trial of ability
腕を見せる
to exhibit one's skill
腕に縒{より}をかける
to do one's utmost―strive to the utmost―strain every nerve
腕に縒を掛けてそんな人を捜してみよう
I will strive to the utmost to find such a person.
腕利き
an able man―a man of ability
あの大工は腕利きだ、腕が立つ
He is a skillful carpenter.

うでかざり〔腕飾り〕
〈名〉A bracelet

content:
うでぎ〔腕木〕
〈名〉(棚などのは)a bracket:(軒や橋などのは)a truss:(電柱などのは)a cross-arm

content.content: 腕木信号機
a semaphore

content:
うできき〔腕利き〕
〈名〉An able man; a man of ability:(職人なら)a skilful workman

content.content: あの大工は腕利きだ
He is a skilful carpenter.
あの先生くらいの腕利きはめったに無い
He is a teacher of rare ability.

content:
うでぐみ〔腕組み〕
〈名〉Folding one's arms:(=する) to fold one's arms

content.content: 腕組みして考えている
He is thinking with folded arms―with his arms folded.

うでくらべ〔腕比べ〕
〈名〉A trial of ability:(=する) to try one's ability against another's; to match oneself against another in ability

content:
うでこき〔腕扱き〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: うできき〔腕利き〕

content:

〈他動〉To deprive (one of anything); to rob (a man of his money); to plunder (a town of its treasure); to divest (a man of his rank); to wrest, snatch, take (anything from one by force); to usurp (the throne); to absorb, engross (one's attention)

content.content: 人の財産を奪う

位を奪う

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 男の魂を奪う

彼は女に魂を奪われている

人の目を奪う

胆を奪う

敵の陣地を奪う

掌中の玉を奪われる

content.content: 午の年

content:
うま〔馬〕
〈名〉
1. A horse:(日本馬)a pony:(牡馬、種馬)a stallion:(牝馬)a mare:(子馬)a colt:(乗馬)a steed; a mount; a hack; a palfrey:(軍馬)a charger:(集合的に言えば)cattle

content.content: 馬に乗る
to ride (a horse)―(下からなら)―mount a horse―get on a horse
君は馬に乗るか、馬に乗れるか
Do you ride?―Can you ride?
馬乗り台と言って馬に乗る時の踏み台がある
There is a horse-block from which you mount a horse―get on a horse.
大将は栗毛馬に乗っておった
The general was mounted on a chestnut charger.
婦人は白馬に乗っておった
The lady was mounted on a white palfrey.
彼は乗っている馬を撃たれた
His horse was shot under him.
英国の騎兵は馬が好い
The English cavalry are well mounted(=mounted on good horses).
日本の騎兵は馬が悪い
The Japanese cavalry are poorly mounted (=mounted on poor horses).
この馬み乗り好い、乗りにくい
This horse rides well―This horse rides hard.
馬が人を乗せる
A horse carries a man.
馬で
on horseback
歩いて行ったか馬で行ったか
Did you go on foot or on horseback?
馬から降りる
to dismount (from a horse)―get off one's horse
馬から落ちる
to fall from one's horse―be thrown off a horse
彼は馬から落ちてけがをした
He was injured by a fall from his horse.
馬が人を落とす
A horse throws his rider.
馬を馭す
to manage a horse
彼はよく馬を馭す
He has his horse well in hand.
馬が馭し難くなる
A horse becomes unmanageable―(と言うより普通は)―A horse runs away with his rider.
馬を止める
to rein up a horse―pull up a horse―draw rein
馬を控える
to rein in (a horse)
馬を鞭つ
to whip a horse
馬に拍車を入れる
to spur one's horse―set spurs to one's horse
馬を励ます
to urge on one's horse―urge one's horse forward
馬を雇う
to take horse
旅人はこの村で村を雇って山を越す
The traveller takes horse at this village to cross the mountain.
馬の手綱を引く
to lead a horse by the bridle
馬の手綱を取る
to hold a horse by the bridle
馬に鞍を置く
to saddle a horse
馬に水飼う
to give a horse to drink―(多くの馬なら)―water cattle
馬に馬糧を当てがう
to fodder a horse―(多くの馬なら)―forage cattle
馬を繋ぐ
to hitch a horse―(草を食わすためなら)―tether a horse
馬を牧場に放す
to put a horse to pasture―turn out a horse to grass
馬が放れる
A horse gets loose.
馬が放たれてけが人ができた
A horse broke loose and injured some people.
馬が嘶{いなな}く
A horse neighs.
馬が勇む
A horse prances.
馬が尾を振る
A horse whisks his tail.
馬が駈ける
A horse gallops.
馬が鼻嵐を吹く
A horse snorts.
馬が汗をかく
A horse lathers.
馬が汗をかいている
The horse is in a lather―The horse is in a foam.
馬が暴れる
A horse turns restive.
暴れて始末にいけない馬だ
It is a restive and unruly beast.
よくはねる馬だ
It is a skittish horse.
疳の強い馬だ
It is a mettlesome horse―a fiery steed.
おとなしい馬だ
It is a gentle horse.
千里の馬
a swift horse―a fleet steed
千里の馬は有れど一人の伯楽は無し
Genius is not appreciated.
荒馬
an unbroken horse―an unbroken colt
馬を馴らす
to break in a horse―rough a horse―enter a horse
馬を乗り馴らす
to break a horse to the rein
馬が馬車を曳く
A horse draws a carriage.
馬車に馬を付ける
to harness the horse to the carriage―(を通例は)―put the horse to
馬車馬
a carriage-horse
競馬馬
a racer
人には添ってみよ馬には乗ってみよ
“The proof of the pudding is in the eating.”
将を射る者はまず馬を射よ
“If you would win the mistress, first bribe the maid.”
牛を馬に乗り換える
to change for the better
牛は牛連れ馬は馬連れ
“Every Jack has his Jill”―“Let beggars mate with beggars.”
馬の耳に念仏
to pray to deaf ears―preach to dear ears
あの人には何を言っても馬の耳に念仏だ
Advice slides off him as water off a duck's back.
人間万事塞翁が馬
“Inscrutable are the ways of Heaven.”

content: 3. (=乗馬、馬術)riding; horsemanship; equitation

content.content: 馬は好い運動だ
Riding is a good exercise.
馬が上手だ
He is a good rider―a good horseman―at home in the saddle―(女なら)―She is a good rider―a good horsewoman.
馬が下手だ
He is a poor rider―a poor horseman.
馬で行く
to go on horseback―ride (to a place)
馬で公園へ行った
I rode to the park.
彼は毎日馬で出る
He goes out for a ride―rides out―every day.
彼は馬で出ました
He has gone out for a ride―He is out for a ride.
一日馬に乗った
I rode all day―I kept in the saddle all day.
百マイル馬に乗った
I rode 100 miles.
馬で山を越す
to ride across a mountain
馬で河を渡る
to ride across a river―swim one's horse across a river
馬で橋を渡る
to ride across a bridge

content: 4. (=付馬)a brothel-man who accompanies a guest home for payment

content.content: その男は馬を付けて来た
He came accompanied by a brothel-man.

content:
うまい〔旨い〕
〈形〉
1. (=美味なる)good (things); nice (taste); sweet (water); delicious (fruit); delicate (flesh); dainty (dish); savoury (meat); tasty (food); toothsome (cake); palatable (water)

content.content: 支那料理はなかなかうまい
Chinese food is quite good.
この果物はうまい味がする
This fruit tastes nice―It has a nice taste.
この鳥はうまい
This bird eats well―It is good eating.
うまいから食べてご覧
See how well it eats!
この菓子はチョリチョリしてうまい
This cake eats crisp and short.
うまくて頬が落ちそうだ
It is delicious―goluptious.
今日のご馳走はうまかった
I have enjoyed my dinner.
君達のような貴公子は美味に飽いているから何を食ってもうまくあるまい
You, sybarites with pampered tastes, can enjoy no delicacy.
うまい物
a delicacy―a dainty―a tidbit―a choice morsel―the good things of this life
うまい汁を吸う
to squeeze the orange―suck the orange―suck the sweet―suck one dry
彼はうまい汁を吸ってしまえはすぐおさらばをきめる
When he has sucked you dry, he will say good-by.
自分ばかりうまい汁を吸おうとする
He will take the lion's share.
彼は金持ちになってうまい酒が飲める
He has made a fortune, and can afford to indulge his tastes.
そうすりゃうまい酒が飲めようという寸法さ
I expect to make a good thing out of it.

content: 3. (=上手な)good, clever, happy, ready (at anything)

content.content: 彼は英語がうまい
He speaks English well.
翻訳がうまい
He is clever at translation.
文章がうまい
He writes a good style―He is a good writer.
書がうまい
He writes a good hand―He is a good penman―He is a calligrapher.
話がうまい
He is a good hand at telling stories―He is a good story-teller.
金儲けがうまい
He is a good man of business.
投機がうまい
He is good at speculation―a good speculator.
即答がうまい
He is happy at repartee―ready at repartee.
しゃれがうまい
He is ready at punning―a good punster.
口がうまい
He is fair-spoken.
うまいことを言う
He says witty things―He is witty.
彼はうまいことを言って人をだます
He will cajole you―wheedle you.
あの女はうまいことを言って男から金を取る
She will talk a man out of his money.
両親がうまいことを言って娘に納得さした
Her parents talked her into compliance.
うまいぞ
Bravo!―Well done!

content: 4. (=出来の好い)good (plan); happy (idea or expression); felicitous (expression); bright, brilliant (idea); ingenious (contrivance, etc.)

content.content: そりゃうまい考えだ、うまい趣向だ
That's a good idea―a happy idea―a bright idea―a brilliant idea.
ふとうまい考えが胸に浮かんだ
A bright idea struck me.
うまい智慧が湧いた
A happy idea occurred to me.
いくら考えてもうまい考えが出ない
Think as hard as I might, I couldn't hit upon a good idea.
うまい言いこなしだ
It is a happy expression―a felicitous expression.
彼は言いこなしがうまい
He has felicity of expression.
うまい工夫だ
It is an ingenious contrivance.
「両雄並び立たず」とはうまいことを言ったものだ
It is well said that “a great man can brook no rival.”

content: 5. (=首尾の好い)good; lucky

content.content: こいつぁうまい
That's lucky―How lucky!―What a stroke of luck!
こんなうまいことは無い
There never was such luck.
こんなうまいことはめったに無い
Such opportunities do not occur every day.
そうなりゃうまいものだ
That would be fine, indeed.
うまいことが足下に落ちている
Chances lie at our feet.

content: 6. (=好い)good

content.content: うまい話だ
That's not bad!―That's not half bad!
うまい金儲けをする
to make a good haul
うまい金儲けにぶっつかる
to come across a good job―strike oil
何かうまい金儲けは無いか
Can't you think of some good job?
彼はうまいことをしている
He is making a good thing out of it.
株でうまいことをした
He has done a good thing in shares.
話がうま過ぎる
The news is too good to be true.

content:
うまいこと〔旨い事〕
〈名〉Good luck; good fortune; a chance; an opportunity

content.content: うまいことが足もとに落ちている
Chances lie at our feet.
こんなうまいことはめったに無い
Such opportunities do not occur every day.

content:
うまいち〔馬市〕
〈名〉A horse-fair

content.content: 毎年馬市が立つ
A horse-fair is held every year.

content:
うまいもの〔旨い物〕
〈名〉Dainty fare; a dainty; a delicacy; a titbit; a choice morsel; (the) good things (of this life); something nice

content.content: 膳の上にはうまい物が並んでいる
The table is spread with delicacies―spread with dainties.
彼は毎日うまい物を食っている
He lives on dainty fare―He dines on game―He keeps a good table―He lives like a fighting cock.
たまにはうまい物を食うが好い
You ought to treat yourself to titbits―enjoy the good things of this life―once in a while.
あの女はうまい物が好きだ
She is fond of dainty fare―She is lickerish.
君達はうまい物を食い飽きている(口が肥えている)
You have a pampered taste.
何かうまい物をこしらえて上げよう
I will get you something good―something nice.
うまい物に砂が入ったようだ
It is a hair in the soup.
名物にうまい物無し
The reality falls short of the fame―The fame outruns the reality.

content:
うまうまと〔旨々と〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: まんまと〔旨々と〕

うまかた〔馬方〕
〈名〉A pack-horse leader; a pack-horse man

content:
うまがる〔旨がる〕
〈他動〉To relish (food)

content.content: 彼は何でもうまがって食う
He relishes everything―eats everything with relish―eats everything with a gusto.

content:
うまく〔旨く〕
〈副〉
1. (=首尾好く)Well; successfully; luckily; happily

content.content: うまくゆく
to go well―go off well―do well―work well―turn out well―pan out well―hit right―succeed
万事うまくいっている
All goes well.
うまくいかない
to go wrong―go amiss―fail
うまくいったか
Has it gone well?―Is it a success?
うまくいかない
It has gone wrong―It is a failure.
計画がうまくいった
The plan has gone well.
会はたいそううまくいった
The meeting went off very well―The meeting was a big success.
この方法はうまくいかない
The method does not work well―The method is a failure.
手術がうまくいったか
Was the operation a success?
山がうまくいった
My speculation has turned out well.
商売はうまくいっている
My business is doing well.
いったいこの商売はあまりうまくいかない商売だ
This business does not go well―do well―at the best of times.
うまくいけば一万円は儲かる
If things go well,―If things pan out well,―If things hit right,―I shall make 10,000 yen.
幾度やってもどういうものかうまくいかない
I have tried every so many times, but somehow I do not succeed.
彼はうまくやっている
He is doing very well.
うまくやっていやがら
The lucky dog!―The lucky beggar!
話がうまくまとまった
The matter has been brought to a happy termination.
汽車にうまく間に合った
I was just in time for the train.
彼はうまく難関を切り抜けた
He has successfully overcome the difficulty.

content: 2. (=巧みに)well; cleverly; tactfully; dextrously; adroitly; deftly; neatly

content.content: この文章はうまくできている
This composition is well written.
仕掛けがうまくできている
The mechanism is well devised.
うまく仕組んだ詐欺だ
It is a well contrived fraud.
あの女はうまく人を操る
She is adroit in managing people―She has tact in managing people.
あの男はうまく言い抜ける
He is an artful dodger.
質問されてうまく言い抜けた
He dodged the question with tact.
彼はうまく逃げた
He got off deftly.
うまく仕こなしたものだ
It was neatly managed.
君の言葉はうまく穿っている
You have hit the mark.
うまく穿った言葉だ
It is a happy expression―a felicitous expression.
うまく穿った評だ
It is a happy hit.

うまごやし〔苜蓿〕
〈名〉The clover

content:
うまさ〔旨さ〕
〈名〉Sweetness; deliciousness

content.content: 酔い醒めの
How sweet water is to those
水の旨さを
Who wake up from a drunken doze,
下戸知らず
No teetotaller knows.

うまずめ〔石女〕
〈名〉A childless woman; a sterile woman; a barren woman

content:
うまそう〔旨そう〕
〈形〉Tempting (food); appetizing (dish); savoury (odour):(=に) with relish; with a gusto

content.content: うまそうなご馳走だ
It is tempting fare―appetizing fare.
鍋からうまそうな匂いがする
The pot gives out a savoury odour.
彼はうまそうに食う
He relishes his food―eats with relish―eats with a gusto.
君が酒を飲むのはさもうまそうだ
You drink with evident relish.
うまそうな娘だ
She is a sweet girl.

うまのあし〔馬の脚〕
〈名〉A supernumerary; a super; a utility-man; a utility

content:
うまのほね〔馬の骨〕
〈名〉(A contemptuous name for) an obscure individual

content.content: どこの馬の骨やら
He is no one knows who―God knows who―(女なら)―She is no better than she ought to be.
彼はどこの馬の骨やらわからない奴を引っ張り込んで女房にしている
He has married a woman from off the streets―a woman out of the gutter.

content:
うまのり〔馬乗り〕
〈名〉
1. (=乗馬)riding

content.content: 馬乗りズボン
riding-trousers
馬乗り台
a horse-block

content: 2. (=跨ぐこと)bestriding

content.content: 人の背中に馬乗りになる
to bestride―sit astride of―straddle―sit astraddle of―a man's back

うまひき〔馬引〕
〈名〉A pack-horse leader

content:
うまみ〔旨味〕
〈名〉Taste; flavour; savour; relish; zest; point

content.content: うま味のある米、うま味の無い米
savoury rice―unsavoury rice
外国米はうま味が無い
Foreign rice is wanting in flavour.
うま味の有る水、うま味の無い水
palatable water―unpalatable water
うま味の有る文章だ
It is a pointed style―a sapid style.
うま味の無い文章だ
It is a flat style―an insipid style―a vapid style.
うま味の有る声だ
She has a sweet voice.
うま味の無い声だ
He has a flat voice.
うま味の無い人間だ
He is an insipid character.

うまみち〔馬路〕
〈名〉A bridle-road; a bridle-path

content:
うまや〔厩〕
〈名〉A stable

content.content: 馬を厩に入れる
to stable a horse
貸厩
a livery stable

content:
うまる〔埋まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=塞がる)to fill up; to be filled up

content.content: 穴が埋まる
A hole fills up.
河底が砂で埋まる
The river-bed is filled up with sand.

content: 2. (=埋められる)to be buried

content.content: 彼は名も無き墓に埋まっている
He lies beneath a nameless grave.

content:
うまれ〔生れ〕
〈名〉Birth; origin

content.content: 彼は生まれが好い
He is well born―He is a man of good birth―He was born of good parents―He comes of a good family.
名門の生まれだ
He is high-born―He is of high birth―He comes of a good family.
卑賤の生まれだ
He is of low birth―of humble origin.
彼は生まれの卑賤なことを隠している
He conceals his humble origin.
君は何年生まれか
In what year were you born?
明治三十年生まれだ
I was born in the 30th year of Meiji.
何月生まれか
In what month were you born?
一月生まれだ
I was born in January.
どこ生まれか
Where were you born?
東京生まれだ
I was born in Tokyo―I am a native of Tokyo.
東京生まれの東京育ち
I was born and bred in Tokyo.
彼は生まれはイタリアで米国へ帰化したのだ
He was born in Italy and naturalized in America―He is an Italian by birth and a naturalized American.
生まれは平民で華族へ養子に行ったのだ
He was born a commoner and adopted by a nobleman―He is a commoner by birth and a nobleman by adoption.
人品骨柄さすがは高貴の生まれと思われた
His dignified appearance bespoke his noble birth.
生まれは争われない
Birth will tell.
生まれが生まれだから
His birth accounts for it.

content:
うまれあわせる〔生れ合わせる〕
〈他動〉To be born into (an age); to fall upon, light upon (such and such times)

content.content: 大正の聖代に生まれ合わせた君達は幸運だ
Happy are you who are born into the glorious days of Taisho!
我々は新奇な世に生まれ合わせたものだ
We have fallen upon strange times―lighted upon strange times.

content:
うまれおちる〔生れ落ちる〕
〈自動〉To be born

content.content: 彼は生まれ落ちると貰われた
He was adopted as soon as he was born―immediately on his birth.
生まれ落ちてから
From the day of my birth
生まれ落ちれば死出の旅路
Birth is, in a sense, the beginning of death.

content:
うまれかわり〔生れ変り〕
〈名〉Rebirth; regeneration; reincarnation; transmigration of the soul; metempsychosis

content.content: 彼の Newton の生まれ変わりだ
He is Newton reborn―a second Newton.

content:
うまれかわる〔生れ変る〕
〈自動〉To be born again; to be reborn; to be regenerated; to reincarnate; to transmigrate

content.content: 女はたいがい男に生まれ変わりたがる
Most women wish to be reborn a man.
お前のような奴は今度生まれ変わる時は畜生だ
Your soul will transmigrate into a beast.
彼は生まれ変わったような人間になった
He is a new man.
生まれ変わったような気がする
I feel myself another man.
それからというものは彼は生まれ変わったような人間になった
He was another man from that day.
彼は生まれ変わらなけりゃそんな卑劣なことはできぬ
It is not in him (=not in his nature) to commit such a baseness.
生まれ変わり死に変わりこの恨みを晴らさでおくべきか
Can I leave my wrongs unrevenged if I have to be reborn twenty times?

content:
うまれこきょう〔生れ故郷〕
〈名〉One's birth place; one's native place; one's home

content.content: 生まれ故郷を後にして行く
I leave my beloved home behind me.

content:
うまれぞこない〔生れ損い〕
〈形〉Misshapen

content.content: この生まれ損いめ
You misshapen creature!

content:
うまれたて〔生れ立て〕
〈形〉New-born

content.content: 生まれたての赤児
a new-born baby
僕は生まれたての赤ん坊じゃない
I was not born yesterday.

content:
うまれつき〔生れ付き〕
〈名〉Nature; natural constitution:(副詞に用いれば)by nature; naturally; constitutionally; congenitally; from birth:(=の) born (poet); natural (honesty); inborn (genius); innate (politeness); inbred (courtesy); inherent (quality); congenital (deformity); constitutional (weakness)

content.content: 彼は生まれつき正直だ
He is honest by nature.
彼は生まれつきの詩人だ
He is a born poet―He was born a poet.
詩人は養成し得るものでない、生まれつきでなけければならぬ
Poets can not be made, they must be born.
彼は虚弱な生まれつきだ
He is of a delicate constitution―constitutionally delicate.
潔癖は日本人の生まれつきだ
Cleanliness is inherent in the Japanese.
彼は生まれつき偽りの無い人だ
He has an inborn love of truth―an innate love of truth.
彼は生まれつきの不具だ
He is congenitally deformed―deformed from birth.
彼は生まれつき語学の才が有る
He has a natural aptitude for languages.
生まれつきの性分
one's nature
生まれつきだからしかたが無い
I can not help my nature.
生まれつきの性分は直らない
One can not change one's nature―“The leopard can not change his spots.”
彼の怠けるのは生まれつきの性分だからしかたがない
His idleness is bred in the bone.

content:
うまれつく〔生れ付く〕
〈他動〉To be born (something); to be designed for (something); to be made for (something)

content.content: 彼は詩人に生まれついている
He was born a poet―He is a born poet.
彼は政治家に生まれついている
He is a born politician―made for a politician―designed for a politician―destined for a politician.
教師に生まれついている
He is a born teacher―make for a teacher―cut out for a teacher.
僕はいったい何に生まれついているだろう
What am I made for?

content:
うまれながら〔生れながら〕
〈副〉Naturally; by nature:(=の) natural; born

content.content: 彼は生まれながらの詩人だ
He is a born poet―He is a natural born poet―He was born a poet.
生まれながら語学の才あり
He has a natural aptitude for languages.
生まれながら賢き者無し
No man is born wise.

content:
うまれる〔生れる〕
〈自動〉
1. To be born; to come into the world; to see the light:(人間、動物以外のものの生まれるのは)to come into being; to come into existence

content.content: 子どもが生まれる
A child is born.
生まれた子どもは男か女か
Is the child a boy or a girl?
その男に子どもが生まれた
A child was born to the man.
子どもが死んで生まれた
The child was born dead.
子どもが生まれるとすぐ死んだ
The child died at birth.
君はいつ生まれたか
When were you born?
僕の生まれた時(生年月日)
the time when I was born―the date of my birth
なんという好い日月(月日)の下に生まれた人だろう
He was born under a lucky star.
君はどこで生まれたか
Where were you born?
東京で生まれた
I was born in Tokyo―I am a native of Tokyo.
僕の生まれた所
the place where I was born―my birth place―my native place
生まれた国
the land of my birth―the land that gave me birth
芝で生まれて神田で育ち
I was born and bred in Tokyo.
船で生まれる者がある
Some people are born at sea.
彼は外国で生まれた
He saw the light abroad.
親から生まれる
to be born of one's parents
同じ親から生まれても性質は違うものだ
People born of the same parents will have different natures.
木の又からでも生まれしゃんしたか
Are you not made of flesh and blood?
彼は富貴に生まれた
He was born rich―born to wealth―born with a silver spoon in his mouth.
貧賤に生まれた
He was born poor―born to poverty.
高貴の家に生まれた
He was born to rank―He was born a nobleman―He is of noble birth.
王侯の家に生まれた
He was born in the purple.
美しく生まれる人は得だ
It is an advantage to be born beautiful.
僕は才子に生まれりゃよかった
I wish I had been born clever.
ぼくは善かれ悪しかれ日本人に生まれたのだ
I was, for better or for worse, born a Japanese.
僕は好きで生まれたのではない
I did not come into the world of own choice.
人は裸で生まれる
We bring nothing into the world.
それでは生まれた甲斐が無い
Then I was born in vain―born to no purpose.
今度成功すれば生まれた甲斐がある
It I succeed, I shall have been born to some purpose.
あんな人を見るのは生まれてから初めてだ
I never looked upon his like in my life.
こんな目に逢うのは生まれてから初めてだ
I never had such an experience in all my born days.
これは生まれてから初めての取引だ
This is the first commercial transaction of my life.
生まれてから死ぬまで
from birth till death―from the cradle to the grave
人は生まれてから死ぬまで苦労が絶えぬ
Man is never free from trouble from the cradle to the grave.
人の持って生まれた運
one's lot in life
持って生まれた運と諦めろ
You must be content with your lot.
持って生まれた性分
one's nature
持って生まれた性分だからしかたがない
I can not help my nature.
持って生まれた性分は直らぬ
One can not change one's nature―“The leopard can not change his spots.”
あの男の怠けるのは持って生まれた性分だからしかたが無い
His idleness is bred in the bone.
武士階級はどうして生まれたものか
How did the samurai class come into being?
天地はひとりでに生まれたというのは Spencer の自然発生論
According to Spencer's “Spontaneous Generation,” the universe came into existence of itself.
雑誌はよく生まれるが続くのは少ない
Many magazines come out, but few last long.
今度生まれた雑誌は続きそうだ
The new magazine which has appeared, is likely to last long.

content:
うみ〔海〕
〈名〉
1. The sea; the deep

content.content: 地球の表面の四分の三は海だ
Three-fourths of the earth's surface is water.
今日は海が穏かだ
The sea is calm―The sea is smooth―today.
鏡のような海
a glassy sea
海は青畳を敷いたよう
The sea is calm and glassy.
海が荒れる
The sea rages.
海が荒れている
The sea is troubled―The sea is rough.
風が吹くと海が荒れる
The gale lashes the sea into fury.
海が荒て猟ができぬ
There is no fishing owing to the rough weather.
海には魚がいる
Fish are found in the sea.
河が海に入る
A river falls into the sea―empties into the sea.
日本は四方海だ
Japan is a sea-girt land.
海に乗り出す
to venture on the sea―venture out to sea
海で水を浴びる
to bathe in the sea
彼は船から海へ落ちて死んだ
He fell overboard, and was drowned.
船から海へ飛び込んで子どもを助けた
He jumped overboard, and rescued the child.
この辺はもとは海だった
This was formerly a part of the sea.
海の事は漁夫に問え
Go to the fisherman for news of the sea―“Every man to his trade.”
父母の恩は海よりも深く山よりも高し
Our debt to our parents is deeper than the sea and higher than the mountains.
海のものとも河のものともつかぬ
It is neither fish nor flesh.
海のものとも山のものともわからない
It is uncertain.
海に千年山に千年という化物だ
She is an old campaigner―an old stager.

content: 2. (=硯の海)the well (of an ink-stone)

うみ〔生み〕
〈名〉Birth

content.content: 生みの親
one's true parent―true father―true mother
生みの恩より育ての恩
The one who brought me up is dearer to me than the one who brought me forth.

content:
うみ〔膿〕
〈名〉Purulent matter; pus; matter; discharge

content.content: 膿を持つ
to generate pus―generate matter―suppurate―fester―run sore―gather head―come to a head
腫れ物から膿が出る
A boil runs matter―discharges matter.
膿を絞る
to force out the matter―press the matter from a boil

content:
うみおとす〔生み落す〕
〈他動〉To be delivered of, be brought to bed of (a child)

content.content: 月満ちて生み落としたが玉の如き男の子
In the fulness of times, she was delivered of a gem of a boy.

content:
うみしる〔膿汁〕
〈名〉Purulent matter; pus; matter; discharge

content.content: 顔から膿汁が流れている
His face is running matter.

content:
うみだす〔生み出す〕
〈他動〉To bring forth; to produce; to call (anything) into being

content.content: 勉強が富を生み出す
Industry produces wealth―Wealth flows from industry.
これは時世が生み出した社会である
The times called this class of men into being.
人の運は自分の働きで生み出すのである
A man's destiny is in his own hands―“A man is the architect of his own fortune.”

content:
うみたて〔生み立て〕
〈形〉New-laid

content.content: 生み立ての卵
new-laid eggs

content:
うみづき〔産み月〕
〈名〉The month of parturition; the last month of pregnancy

content.content: もう産み月だ
She has gone her full time―She is near her time―Her time is near―Her time has come.

content:
うみべ〔海辺〕
〈名〉The seashore; the seaside; the beach

content.content: 海辺を散歩する
to ramble about the beach
海辺に遊ぶ
to play on the seashore
海辺に住む
to live by the seaside

うみぼうず〔海坊主〕
〈名〉A (fabled) sea-monster

content:
うみやま〔海山〕
〈名〉Sea and mountain

content.content: 海山越えて
over seas and mountains
海山かけて
over land and sea
海山の御志深く感謝し奉る
I cordially thank you for your kind intentions.

content:
うむ〔倦む〕
〈自他動〉To weary, grow weary (of anything); to tire, get tired (of anything)

content.content: 勉強に倦む
to get tired of―grow weary of―study
彼は公益の為に働いて倦むことを知らぬ
He never tires of―never wearies of―labouring for the public good.
将は驕り兵は倦む
The officers were elated with victory, and the men tired of fighting.
倦まずたゆまず研究に従事している
He pursues his study with untiring zeal―with indefatigable attention―with unremitting efforts―with dogged perseverance.

content:
うむ〔熟む〕
〈他動〉To mellow

content.content: 梅が熟んだ
The plums are mellow.

content:
うむ〔生む、産む〕
〈他動〉
1. (女は)to bear (children); to give birth to (a child); to bring forth (a child):(男親は)to beget (a child on a woman):(動物は)to breed (its young); to drop (a lamb):(鳥は)to lay (eggs):(魚は)to spawn

content.content: 女は子を生む
Women bear children.
女は子を生む役
It is woman's duty to bear children.
彼の細君は子どもを五人生んだ
His wife bore him five children―gave him five children.
先妻は子どもを二人生んで死んだ
His first wife died after giving birth to two children.
あの娘は近頃子を生んだ
She has had a child―become a mother.
七人の子を生むとも女に心を許すな
Do not trust a woman even if she be the mother of seven children.
あれは自分で生んだ子か
Is he a child of her own bearing?
あれは先妻の生んだ子だ
He is a child by his first wife.
彼の母は彼を生んで死んだ
His mother died at his birth―He cost his mother her life.
子を生む女
a woman of child-bearing age
子を生まない女
a childless woman―a sterile woman―a barren woman
あの女はもう子を生む年じゃない
She is past the age of bearing.
案じるより生むがやすい
It is easier than one expects―“Fear outruns the danger.”
金が金を生む
Money begets money.
牝鶏が卵を生む
A hen lays eggs.
鶏は今時分は卵を生まない
Hens do not lay at this time of the year.
この鶏はよく卵を生む、あまり卵を生まない
This hen is a good layer―a bad layer.
牛馬は飼われておって子を生む
Cattle breed in captivity.
馬が子を生む
A mare foals.
牛が子を生む
A cow calves.
羊が子を生む
A ewe yeans―A ewe lambs―A ewe drops a lamb.
犬が子を生む
A dog pups.
猫が子を生む
A cat kittens.
狐や熊が虎や獅子などが子を生む
A fox, a bear, a tiger, or a lion cubs.
鯡が群を成して北海道の海岸へ子を生みに来る
Shoals of herring visit the coast of Hokkaido to spawn.

content: 3. (=生ずる)to produce; yield; to give rise to (anything); to be the mother of (anything)

content.content: 金が利を生む
Money yields interest.
利が利を生む
Interest yields interest.
必要が発明を生む
Necessity is the mother of invention.

content:
うむ〔生む、産む〕
〈他動〉
1. (女は)to bear (children); to give birth to (a child); to bring forth (a child):(男親は)to beget (a child on a woman):(動物は)to breed (its young); to drop (a lamb):(鳥は)to lay (eggs):(魚は)to spawn

あれは先妻の生んだ子だ

It is easier than one expects―“Fear outruns the danger.”

鶏は今時分は卵を生まない

This hen is a good layer―a bad layer.
牛馬は飼われておって子を生む
Cattle breed in captivity.
馬が子を生む
A mare foals.
牛が子を生む
A cow calves.
羊が子を生む
A ewe yeans―A ewe lambs―A ewe drops a lamb.
犬が子を生む
A dog pups.
猫が子を生む
A cat kittens.
狐や熊が虎や獅子などが子を生む
