Shoals of herring visit the coast of Hokkaido to spawn.

content: 3. (=生ずる)to produce; yield; to give rise to (anything); to be the mother of (anything)

content.content: 金が利を生む
Money yields interest.
利が利を生む
Interest yields interest.
必要が発明を生む
Necessity is the mother of invention.

content:
うむ〔膿む〕
〈他動〉To suppurate; to fester; to rankle; to mature; to ripen; to generate pus; to generate matter; to gather head; to come to a head

content.content: 腫れ物が膿んだ
The boil is ripe.
膿んだともつぶれたとも言わぬ
He utters never a word.

content:
うむ〔有無〕
〈名〉
1. (=成否)existence (or non-existence)
2. (=行動、出来事の有無)whether or no

content.content: ご出席の有無をご一報下されたし
Please let me know whether or no you will attend―whether you will attend or not.

content: 3. (=諾否)yes or no

content.content: 有無を言わせず
whether one will or not―willy-nilly―without more ado―peremptorily
有無を言わせず引っ張って来い
Bring him whether he will come or not!
有無を言わさず彼を引っ張って来た
I hustled him without more ado.
有無を言わせず出入りを差し止めた
I peremptorily forbade him the house.

content:
うめ〔梅〕
〈名〉(梅の木は)the plum-tree:(梅の花は)plum-blossoms:(梅の実は)a plum

content.content: 梅は一番早く咲く、梅は百花の魁{さきがけ}
The plum-tree is the first tree to blossom.
梅が咲いている
The plum-tree is in blossom.
梅が満開だ
The plum-trees are in full blossom.
梅の一枝
a spring of plum-blossoms
日本画の梅に鶯は付き物だ
The plum-blossoms are associated with the bush-warbler in Japanese art.
梅に鶯(に相当するは)
the rose and the nightingale
わたしゃ鶯、主{ぬし}は梅
I am the nightingale, and you are the rose.
梅と桜を両手に持ったよう
to have flowers in both hands
子どもは青梅を食う
Boys devour green plums.
青梅を見たばかりで歯が浮く
The mere sight of green plums sets my teeth on edge.
梅林
a plum-grove
梅屋敷
a plum-garden
枝手折る人にも匂う梅の花(に相当するは)
“The tree does not withdraw its shade from the wood-cutter.”
枝手折る
To him who plucks thy bloom,
人にも匂う
Thou grudgest not, O Plum,
梅の花
Thy sweet perfume!
手折らじな
The plum-tree's blossoms I will spare
人の垣根の梅の花
That grace my neighbour's wall;
我にて知りぬ
By mine own heart I know how dear
人の心を
They must be his soul.

content:
うめあわせ〔埋合せ〕
〈名〉Compensation:(=る) to compensate for (a loss); to make up for (a loss); to make amends for (a loss); to make good (a loss); to offset (a fault); to set off (a merit) against (a fault)

content.content: どれほど才が有っても怠ける埋め合わせにはならぬ
No talent can compensate for idleness.
ご損をかけたら埋め合わせを致します
I will compensate you for your loss―make up for your loss―make amends for your loss―make good your loss.
この次に今度の埋め合わせを致します
I will make up for your disappointment next time.
僕は学力が無いから勉強で埋め合わせるのだ
I make up by diligence for my want of ability.
(病気で休んだから)後れの埋め合わせをしなけりゃならぬ
I must make up for lost time.
彼は短所を埋め合わすだけの長所が有る
He has enough merits to set off against his faults.
(彼には貸し金があっても取れないから)埋め合わせに品物を取る
I will take it out in goods.

content:
うめき〔埋木〕
〈名〉Inlaid wood; flushing a hole:(=する) to flush (a hole)

content.content: 穴に埋木する
to flush a hole
埋木細工
mosaic

うめき〔呻き〕
〈名〉Groaning; moaning:(一回なら)a groan; a moan

うめく〔呻く〕
〈自動〉To groan; to moan

content:
うめくさ〔埋草〕
〈名〉Something to fill up space:(新聞のは)balaam:(本や雑誌のは)padding

content.content: ここの埋め草を書いてくれ給え
Please find something to fill up the space.

content:
うめたて〔埋立て〕
〈名〉Reclamation:(=る) to reclaim (the foreshore from the sea); to fill in (a moat)

content.content: 海面を埋め立てる
to reclaim the foreshore (from the sea)
ここは埋め立てたのだ
The land has been reclaimed from the sea.
城のまわし堀を埋め立てる
to fill in the castle-moats
埋め立て工事
reclamation-works

content:
うめたてち〔埋立地〕
〈名〉Reclaimed land; reclamation ground

content.content: ここは埋め立て地だ
This land has been reclaimed from the sea.

うめびしお〔梅びしお〕
〈名〉Plum-jam

content:
うめぼし〔梅干〕
〈名〉Pickled plums

content.content: 梅干婆
a wrinkled old woman
梅干面
a shrivelled face

content:
うめみ〔梅見〕
〈名〉Plum-blossom viewing

content.content: 月ケ瀬へ梅見に行こう
Let us go to Tsukigase to see the plum-blossoms.

うめもどき〔梅擬〕
〈名〉A kind of holly

content:
うめる〔埋める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=葬る)to bury; to inter; to inhume

content.content: 死人を埋める
The dead are consigned to the earth―consigned to the grave.

content: 2. (=填充する)to fill (a blank); to fill up (a space); to fill in (a moat); to stop (a gap); to stop up (a hole); to plug (a hole)

content.content: 隙を埋める、空所を埋める
to fill a blank―fill up a space―stop a gap
穴を埋める
to stop up a hole―fill up a hole―fill in a cavity―(小さい穴なら)―plug a hole―(不足を補うの意味なら)―make up a deficit
空時間を埋める
to stop a gap
歯を埋める
to plug a tooth
塀を埋める
to fill in a moat
白地を埋める
to fill a blank
湯が熱いから水を埋めろ
The bath is too hot. Put some water in it.

content:
うもう〔羽毛〕
〈名〉Feather

content.content: 軽きこと羽毛の如し
It is as light as feather.

content:
うもれぎ〔埋木〕
〈名〉
1. Wood found buried in the earth; fossil-wood

content.content: 埋もれ木細工
fossil-wood work

content: 2. (=世に葬られた人)a person consigned to oblivion

うやうやしい〔恭しい〕
〈形〉Respectful; reverent; reverential

content.content: 恭しい態度を執る
to assume a reverential attitude

content:
うやうやしく〔恭しく〕
〈副〉Respectfully; reverentially; with deep reverence; with profound reverence; with every mark of respect; hat in hand

content.content: 長者に恭しく振る舞え
Behave respectfully towards your superiors!
主人が恭しく来訪者を迎えた
The master of the house received the visitor with every mark of respect.
皆彼の教えを恭しく傾聴している
They listen to his teachings with profound reverence.
彼らは恭しく控えている
They are waiting, hat in hand.
恭しくお辞儀をする
to make a respectful obeisance―make alow bow

うやまい〔敬い〕
〈名〉Respect; reverence; veneration; honour; esteem

content:
うやまう〔敬う〕
〈他動〉To respect (a man); to reverence (a god); to revere (one's master); to venerate (an old man); to honour (one's father and mother); to esteem (a man of erudition, etc.)

content.content: 師を敬うこと神の如し
They revere―reverence―their master.
上を敬い下を愛む{いとしむ}べし
Let people honour their superiors, and love their inferiors.

content:
うやむや〔有耶無耶〕
〈名〉Ambiguity; obscurity; mystery; hugger-mugger

content.content: 事件はうやむやの裡に葬られた
The matter was hugger-muggered up―smothered up.
裁判はうやむやの裡に済んでしまった
The trial was gone through hugger-mugger.
事実をうやむやにしてしまった
They hugger-muggered the facts.
事実はうやむやになってしまった
The facts were hugger-muggered up―smothered up.

content:
うゆう〔烏有〕
〈名〉Nothing

content.content: 全市烏有に帰す
The whole city was reduced to ashes―razed to the ground―laid level with the dust.

うゆうせんせい〔烏有先生〕
〈名〉An imaginary person

content:
ウヨウヨ
〈副〉In swarms:(=する) to swarm; to wriggle; to squirm

content.content: この木に虫がウヨウヨいる
The tree swarms with worms.

content:
うよきょくせつ〔紆余曲折〕
〈名〉Meanders; turns and twists; intricacies; complications; vicissitudes

content.content: 幾多の紆余曲折を経て談判がまとまった
The negotiations were concluded after many twists and turns.
脚色の紆余曲折
the intricacies of a plot
事件の紆余曲折
the complications of an affair
人生の紆余曲折
the vicissitudes of life―the ups and downs of life
紆余曲折の多い生涯
His life was a chequered career.

content:
うよく〔右翼〕
〈名〉The right wing, the right flank (of an army)

content.content: 敵の右翼をまわって背後に出た
We turned the right flank of the enemy.
右翼軍
the right column

content:
うよく〔羽翼〕
〈名〉
1. (=鳥の羽)wings
2. (=輔佐)aid; assistance
3. (=才能)ability; talent; genius

content.content: 羽翼を伸ばす
to bring one's genius into play
羽翼を充分に伸ばす
to give free play to one's ability―give ample scope to one's talents―give full swing to one's genius
彼の羽翼を伸ばす機会を与えよ
Let his genius have full swing!
彼は羽翼を充分に伸ばしている
His genius has full swing.

content:
うら
〈接頭詞〉Very

content.content: まだうら若い身で
while she is still very young
うら淋しい
I feel very lonely.
うら悲しい
I feel very sad.

content:
うら〔浦〕
〈名〉An inlet; a cove; a bay

content.content: 松島浦
the Bay of Matsushima

content:
うら〔裏〕
〈名〉
1. (=着物の裏)lining

content.content: 着物に裏を付ける
to line a gown
上衣に絹の裏を付ける
to line a coat with silk
上衣に絹の裏が付いている
The coat is lined with silk―The coat has a silk lining.
外套に毛の裏が付いている
The overcoat is lined with fur.
裏が切れた
The lining is worn out.

content: 2. (=裏面)the reverse; the back; the inside; the other side; the wrong side

content.content: この羅紗には裏表がある
This cloth has its right and wrong side.
賞牌の裏
the reverse of a medal
銭の裏
the revers of a coin―the verso of a coin―the tail of a coin
札の裏
the back of a bank-note
手の裏
the palm of the hand
足の裏
the sole (of the foot)
歯の裏
the inner side of the teeth
ページの裏に図がある
There is a cut on the other side of the leaf―There is a wood-cut overleaf.
事件の裏に女がいる
There is a lady in the case.
心の裏を見透す
to see through one's heart
裏を返す
(着物なら)to turn a coat inside out―(誤ってなら)―turn a coat the wrong side out―(遊里の詞にては)―make a second visit (to a prostitute)

content: 3. (=背後)the back; the rear

content.content: 裏に庭がある
There is a garden at the back of the house―(英、米は)―in the rear of the house.
竹は裏の藪に生えている
Bamboos grow in the bush at the back―in the rear.
裏口、裏門
the back entrance―the backstairs―the postern
裏から入る
to enter at the back entrance
正面から行ってはまずいから裏からまわった方が好い
It would be clumsy to make a frontal attack; it would be better to use the backstair influence.
裏町、裏通り
a back-street
裏店
a house in a back-street

content: 4. (=背面、反面、反対)the reverse; the opposite; the contrary

content.content: あの人の言うことは裏の意味がある
His words have an opposite meaning―He means the opposite to what he says―He is ironical.
あの人の言うことは裏を取らなければならぬ
We must interpret his words by contraries.
裏を言う

着物の裏返しをする

この上衣は裏返しをすればまだ着られる
The coat is still good for wearing if it is turned―turned inside out.

この事実が彼の無罪なことを裏書きしている

これだけ証拠があればこの事実を裏書きするに足る

content:
うらみ〔恨み、怨み〕
〈名〉
1. Grudge; spite; resentment; hatred; enmity; malice; anger; wrath; ire; reproach; a bitter feeling; a wrong, wrongs

content.content: 彼に恨みがある
I owe him a grudge―I have a grudge against him.
君に対して恨みは無い
I harbour no bitter feeling against you―I bear you no malice.
こればかりはお恨みに存じます
I am angry with you for this.
人に恨みが有るものか無いものか思い知らしてやる
You shall feel my wrath!―You shall feel my vengeance!

content:
2. 
〈動詞付〉

content.content: 恨みを懐く
to bear one a grudge―owe one a grudge―owe one a spite―have a spite against one―have a grudge against one
誰か君に対して恨みを懐いている者は無いか
Is there any one who bears you a grudge?―Is there no one who has a grudge against you?
恨みを含む
to bear one malice
恨みを晴らす
to wreak one's grudge―glut one's ire
恨みを報いる
to revenge one's wrongs―revenge oneself―be revenged―pay off old scores―wipe off old scores―settle accounts with one―quit scores with one―get even with one―get square with one
この恨みを晴らさでおくべきか
By Heaven! I will be revenged.
恨みを呑む
to repress one's anger
彼は恨みを呑んで死んだ
He carried his grudge to the grave.
恨みを買う、恨みを受ける
to incur one's hatred―incur one's enmity―make an enemy
人に恨みを受けた覚えは無い
I never wronged any one.
恨みを言う
to reproach one
女が浮気な男に恨みを言った
She reproached him with inconstancy.
恨みの数々を並べた
She heaped reproaches on him―loaded him with reproaches.
恨みたらだら
She was full of reproaches.
恨みを忘れる
to forget a wrong
恨みを忘れるは無上の復讐
To forget a wrong is best revenge.
この恨みは子々孫々に至るまでも忘れまじ
We shall remember our wrongs to the remotest generations.
恨み重なる敵
a bitter enemy―the object of one's long resentment

You shall feel my wrath!―You shall feel my vengeance!

This will make all even―make all square―We are even―We are quits―I cry quits.
彼は財産を子どもらに恨みこ無しに分けてくれた
He divided his property equally among his children.

content:
うらむ〔憾む、恨む〕
〈他動〉To regret

content.content: 機を失したるを恨む
I regret having missed the opportunity―I am sorry I missed my opportunity.
ただ恨む君の共に在りてその光景を見ざりしを
I only regret that you were not there with me to enjoy the sight―I with you had been there with me―You should have seen the sight.

content:

I regret having missed the opportunity―I am sorry I missed my opportunity.
ただ恨む君の共に在りてその光景を見ざりしを
I only regret that you were not there with me to enjoy the sight―I with you had been there with me―You should have seen the sight.

content:
うらむ〔恨む、怨む〕

content.content: 侮辱されて恨む
to resent an insult
誰か君を恨んでいる人は無いか
Is there any one who bears you a grudge?―Is there no one who has a grudge against you?
彼は君を恨んでいる
He is angry with you―He is bitter against you.
彼はなぜ僕を恨むのだろう
Why is he angry with me?―Why is his soul dark against me?
そんなことをなさると私恨みますよ
I shall be angry with you for doing so.
人に恨まれるようなことをした覚えは無い
I never wronged any one.
惚れられて腹が立つようなら我が身を恨め(ほど好く生まれて来ぬが好い)
If my love offends you, you must blame yourself for―thank yourself for―your sweetness.
君はこのような自由な身でありながら出世しなかったら誰も恨めないぞ
If, with all your advantages, you fail to get on, you will have to thank yourself for your failure―you will have no one but yourself to thank for your failure.
天を恨む
to quarrel with Heaven―accuse Heaven of injustice
天を恨むなかれ
Do not be angry with Heaven!
天を怨み人を
Never be worth with Providence,
咎むる事はあらじ
Nor blame thy fellow-men,
我過ちと
But well reflect on thine own fault
思い返さば
Committed'yond thy ken!
死者を恨ます
“Death pays all debts.”
恨まず記せず
“Forgive and forget.”

content.content: その国へは戦争中に売り込んで地盤が出来ている
We secured a market in the country during the war.

うりさき〔売り先〕
〈名〉The buyer

〈名〉Sale (by the government):(=る) to sell

content.content: 売り下げ人
an agent (of government manufactures)―a government agent
売り下げ所
an agency (for the sale of government manufactures)

うりざねがお〔瓜核顔〕
〈名〉An oval face; regular features; classic features

content:
うりさばき〔売捌き〕
〈名〉Sale

content.content: 売りさばき人
an agent
売り捌き所
an agency

うりさばく〔売捌く〕
〈他動〉To sell (goods supplied by another)

content:
うりしろ〔売代〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: うりあげだか〔売り上げ高〕

うりぞめ〔売り初め〕
〈名〉Opening sale (of new goods)

content:
うりだし〔売り出し〕
〈名〉Opening sale

content.content: 夏物の売り出し
the opening sale of summer goods
冬物の売り出し
the opening sale of winter goods
勧業債券の売り出し
offer of hypothec debentures

content: 〈形〉Rising (man)

content.content: 彼は売り出しの若手だ
He is a rising young man.

content:
うりだす〔売り出す〕
〈他動〉
1. To put (goods) to sale; to place (goods) on sale; to place (goods) on the market

content.content: この品はもう売り出している
These goods are on sale already.
今度の字書は九月までには売り出すようになるだろう
The new dictionary will be ready for sale by September.
新公債を売り出した
New bonds have been placed on sale―placed on the market.

content: 2. (=名を揚げる)to win a reputation; to make a name

content.content: 彼はこの本で売り出した
This book won him a reputation.
漱石は「吾輩は猫である」で売り出した
Soseki won a reputation by his “I am a cat”―(通例は他動詞構文にして)―Soseki's “I am a cat” won him a reputation.
あの男は近頃だいぶ売り出した
He has lately made a name for himself.

content:
うりだめ〔売り溜め〕
〈名〉The takings, the receipts (of a shop)

content.content: 今日の売りだめはいくらあるか
What are today's takings?

うりつくす〔売り尽す〕
〈他動〉To sell all (the goods); to sell out (the goods)

content:
うりつける〔売り付ける〕
〈他動〉To impose, foist, pass, palm off, fob off (a false article upon one)

content.content: 僕はこんな偽物を売り付けられた
I had this false article foisted upon me.
相手が日本に慣れない外国人と見るとこんなイカサマ物を売り付ける
When they have to deal with a foreigner new to Japan, they impose such trash upon him.
彼はキズ物くらいは売り付けかねない男
He is quite capable of selling you an unsound horse at a sound price.

content:
うりとばす〔売り飛ばす〕
〈他動〉To sell; to dispose of (anything)

content.content: 放蕩息子が家屋敷を二束三文に売り飛ばしてしまった
The prodigal son sold the house and land for a mere song.

うりね〔売値〕
〈名〉The selling-price; the sale-price

content:
うりば〔売場〕
〈名〉A shop; a counter

content.content: 切符売り場
a ticket-window

うりはなす〔売り放す〕
〈他動〉To part with (an article)

content:
うりはらう〔売り払う〕
〈他動〉To sell off (own's property); to clear off (the stock); to dispose of (a house, etc.)

content.content: 売れ残りを安く売り払ってしまおう
We will sell off the remainder of good.
有り荷を売り払う
to clear off the stock
彼は家屋敷を売り払って借金を返した
He disposed of his house and lot to pay his debts.
ばくちで田地田畑を売り払った
He has gambled himself out of house and home.

content:
うりひろめ〔売り弘め〕
〈名〉Advertisement (of one's wares):(=る) to advertise (one's goods); to find a market for (one's goods)

content.content: 売りひろめのために損をして売っている
We are selling at a sacrifice by way of advertisement.

content:
うりもの〔売物〕
〈名〉An article for sale; something in the market

content.content: 売り物(と札に書けば)
For sale.
売り物に出す
to offer anything for sale―put anything to sale―place anything on sale―place anything on the market
売り物に出る
to be offered for sale―to come into market
家作が売り物に出ている
A house is for sale―in the market.
売り物にキズを付ける
to injure an article for sale―(女の意味なら)―defame a woman―ruin a girl
売り物に花を飾る
“No man cries stinking fish.”
あの男は親切を売り物にする
He makes capital out of kindness.

content:
うりものかいもの〔売物買物〕
〈名〉What one buys with money; a commercial transaction

content.content: 売り物買い物は後腐れが無くて好い
A commercial transaction leaves no after-trouble―What you buy with money, leaves no claim on you―You have no trouble afterwards with a professional woman.

うりや〔売屋〕
〈名〉
1. (=売家)a house for sale
2. (=取引所の売り方)a bear

content:
うりょう〔雨量〕
〈名〉The amount of rainfall

content.content: 雨量を計る
to gauge the rainfall
雨量計
a rain-gauge

content:
うりょうべき〔憂う可き〕
〈形〉Lamentable; deplorable

content.content: 教育界の為に憂うべきことは人材の欠乏である
The dearth of talent in the educational world is to be lamented.

content:
うりょうる〔患うる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: うれえる〔患える〕

content:
うりょうる〔憂うる〕
〈自他動〉→『

content.content: うれえる〔憂える〕

content:
うりわたし〔売渡し〕
〈名〉Sale

content.content: 売り渡し証
a bill of sale

content:
うりわたす〔売渡す〕
〈他動〉To sell; to sell out

content.content: 暖簾を売り渡す
to sell out a business
会社の持ち分を売り渡す
to sell out one's shares in a company

content:
うる〔得る〕
〈他動〉(=獲得する)to get (anything); to obtain (useful things from the sea); to earn (money); to acquire (knowledge); to gain (anything by effort); to win (anything by luck); to secure (a position); to procure (help); to derive (benefit from anything); to get hold of (a good teacher); to come in for (a share); to come by (anything how?)

content.content: 安心立命を得る
to be resigned to one's fate
中庸を得る
to hit the happy medium
信任を得る
to gain one's confidence
自信を得る
to gain self-confidence
人心を得る
to win the people's hearts
好適手を得る
to meet one's match―find one's match
社会に立脚地を得る
to gain a footing in society
賛成を得る
to meet one's approval
称賛を得る
to meet one's approbation
友を得る
to gain a friend→『よろしき〔宜しき〕』
大いに得る処あり
I have gained much.
何ら得る処無し
I have gained nothing―got nothing.

content: 〈助動詞〉(=能う)can; may

content.content: これを為し得る者無し
No one can do it.
学生は仏語独語のいずれかを選ぶことを得べし
They student may choose either French or German.
為し得べくはこれを為せ
Do this, if possible!

content:
うる〔売る〕
〈他動〉
1. To sell (goods); to dispose of (one's property)

content.content: 何をいくらに売る
to self anything for so much―(と言わずして通例)―take so much for anything―get so much for anything―(と言う)
その馬をいくらに売ってくれるか
What will you take for your horse?―What do you want for your horse?―What do you ask for your horse?
千円に売りましょう
I will take 1,000 yen for him―I want 1,000 yen for him.
君は著述をいくらに売ったか
What did you get for your work?
二千円に売った
I got 2,000 yen for it.
彼は処女作を百円に売った
He sold his maiden work for 100 yen―He got 100 yen for his maiden work―His maiden work earned him 100 yen.
彼は家を一万円に売ろうと言った
He offered his house for 10,000 yen.
家を売ろうと言う
to offer a house for sale
高く売る
to sell dear―sell at a high price―sell at a high figure
安く売る
to sell cheap―sell at a low price―sell at a low figure
彼は安く買って高く売る
He buys cheap and sells dear.
それより一文も安くは売られません
I can not take a cent less.
彼は家を好い値に売った
He has sold his house at a good price.
儲けて売る
to sell at a profit
損をして売る
to sell at a loss―sell at a sacrifice
この品は損をしても売ってしまいたい
We must sell these goods even at a sacrifice.
触れて売る
to cry―hawk―one's wares
米国では卵をダースいくらで売る
In America, eggs are sold by the dozen.
日本では一ついくらで売る
In Japan, they are sold by the piece.
あちらでは魚を目方で売る
There fish is sold by the pound.
薪は束で売る
Wood is sold by the bundle.
あの店では何を売るか
What do they sell at that shop?―What sort of goods do they deal in?
この本はどこで売っているか
Where can I get this book?―Where is this book to be had?
どこの本屋でも売っている
It is to be had at any bookseller's.
田舎へ引込むについて家を売らなければならぬ
I must dispose of my house before retiring into the country.
この品物を売って金にしたい
I wish to turn these goods into money.
農夫が畑の物を売りに行く
A farmer goes to sell the produce of his farm―goes to market.
羊頭を懸けて狗肉を売る
to cry mutton and sell dog―“show one bread and give one a stone”―impose upon the public
身を売る
to sell one's chastity―prostitute oneself
節を売る
to sell one's honour―prostitute one's honour
情は売れども心は売らぬ
My body is at your service, but not my heart.
彼は奴隷に売られた
He was sold for a slave―sold into slavery.
彼女は女郎に売られた
She was sold for a prostitute.
娘を女郎に売った
They sold their daughter for a prostitute.
春を売る
A woman sells her favours.
暖簾{のれん}を売る
to sell out a business
名を売る
to win a reputation―win fame―win renown―make a name for oneself
彼はこの本で名を売った
This book won him a reputation.
彼は世界に名を売っている
He has won a world-wide fame―He enjoys a world-wide fame.
若い学者は名を売ろうとする
Young scholars thirst for fame―strive after effect.
昔の芸者は芸で売った
Old-time geisha won their reputations by art.
今時の芸者は顔で売る
Modern geisha make capital out of their beauty.
男を売る
to build up a reputation
愛嬌を売る
to court favour―do the pretty
芸人は愛嬌を売る商売だ
It is the business of the artiste to court public favour.
あの娘はしきりに愛嬌を売る
She is always doing the pretty―playing the coquette―coquetting―She is a coquette.
けんかを売る
to provoke a quarrel
土地を売って長い草鞋{わらじ}を履く身となった
He left home and led a wandering life.

content: 3. (=裏切る)to betray; to sell

content.content: 国を売る
to sell one's country―betray one's country
彼らはたとい貧しくとも国を売るような者ではない
Though poor, they are above selling their country.
友人を売る
to betray one's friend―sell one's friend

うるうづき〔閏月〕
〈名〉An intercalary month (of the lunar calendar)

うるうどし〔閏年〕
〈名〉A leap year

うるうび〔閏日〕
〈名〉An intercalary day (Feb. 29th)

content:
うるおい〔潤い〕
〈名〉
1. (=湿り)damp; moisture
2. (=利潤)gain; profit

content.content: この辺は避暑客が多く来て土地の潤いになる
Summer visitors come here in great numbers an enrich the place.

content:
3. (=恵み)favour; blessing
4. (=繁栄)prosperity
5. (=趣味)taste; charm

content.content: 潤いの有る筆
a charming pen―a charming style
潤いの有る声
a charming voice―a sweet voice

content:
うるおう〔潤う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=湿る)to become moist; to become wet

content.content: この雨で田畑が潤う
This rain is welcome to the fields.

content: 2. (=利する、富む)to be profited; to be enriched

content.content: 鯨を一匹捕ると七浜潤う
A single whale will enrich seven villages.

content:
3. (=恵みを受ける)to be blessed
4. (=栄える)to prosper

content.content: 台湾は王化に潤っている
Formosa propers under the benign rule of the Emperor.

content:
うるおす〔潤す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=湿す)to wet; to moisten

content.content: 涙で袖を潤す
to wet one's sleeves with tears
口を潤す、喉を潤す
to moisten one's lips―moisten one's clay―quench one's thirst
この雨は田畑を潤す
This rain will fertilize the fields―This rain is welcome to the fields.
この河は曠原を潤している
This river irrigates a vast plain.

content: 2. (=利する、富ます)to profit; to enrich

content.content: 英国を最も潤したるものは東インド貿易である
It is the East-Indian trade that most enriched England.

content: 3. (=恵む)to bless; to bestow favours on (one); to render (one) benevolence

content.content: 名君は民を潤す
A wise ruler is a blessing to the people―The people prosper under a wise ruler.

うるかす〔潤かす〕
〈他動〉To soak, steep (anything in water)

うるける〔潤ける〕
〈自動〉To soak, swell (in water)

content:
うるさい〔煩い〕
〈形〉Annoying (fellow); troublesome (questions); irksome (task); bothersome (affair); tiresome (talk); wearisome (details); burdensome (tax); onerous (duty); plaguy (avocations); pestilent (questions); importunate (requests for money, etc.)

content.content: うるさい(!)
Bother it!―Botheration!―What a bore!―What a nuisance!
うるさくするな
Don't annoy me!―Don't bother me!―Don't bore me!
うるさくて堪まらん
I am bored to death―bothered to death―annoyed to death.
子どもがうるさい
Children bother me.
手紙を書くのがうるさい
Letter-writing bores me―Letter-writing is a bore.
質問されるのがうるさい
Questions are troublesome to me.
うるさい質問を持って来る
They ply me with troublesome questions―pestilent questions.
彼はうるさく質問する
He troubles me with questions―plagues me with questions―pesters me with questions―plies me with questions.
日々の課業がうるさい
My daily task is irksome to me.
税を払うのがうるさい
The taxes are burdensome to me.
職務がうるさい
My duties are onerous to me.
あの人の話はうるさい
His talk is tiresome to me―wearisome to me.
浮世がうるさくなった
Life has become a burden to me.
世間がうるさくなってきた
The world is getting too hot for me.
世間の口がうるさい
People will talk―What will Mrs. Grundy say?
端の目がうるさい
People will pry.
蠅がうるさい
The flies are troublesome―The flies buzz about my ears.
うるさい奴だ
He is a troublesome fellow―an annoying fellow―a positive nuisance―a bore―a gad-fly.
うるさい奴を遠ざけなければならん
I must get rid of that troublesome fellow.
あの男はうるさく無心に来る
He troubles me with requests for money―plagues me with requests for money―pesters me with requests for money.
うるさく金をねだる
to importune one for money―tease one for money
あそこへ行くと乞食にうるさくつきまとわれる
You are bothered by beggars there.
うるさく催促する
to dun one for a debt
うるさく言う
to din in one's ears
うるさく尋ねるようだがその金をどうするのだ
What do you want the money for, if I am not too inquisitive?

content:
うるさがる〔煩がる〕
〈他動〉To be annoyed by (anything); to be bothered by (anything); to be bored by (anything); to find (anything) troublesome, irksome, tiresome, wearisome, burdensome, onerous

content.content: 彼は子どもをうるさがる
Children bother him.
彼は手紙を書くのをうるさがる
Letter-writing bores him.
彼は質問をうるさがる
Questions are troublesome to him.
彼は課業をうるさがる
His daily task is irksome to him.
人民は税をうるさがる
The taxes are burdensome to the people.
兵役をうるさがる者がある
Military service is onerous to some people.
彼は無心をされるのを非常にうるさがる
Requests for money annoy him to death―bother him to death.
彼は始終演説するので人にうるさがられる
He is constantly on his legs and boring people.

content:
うるし〔漆〕
〈名〉Lacquer; japan

content.content: 漆を塗る
to lacquer―japan―anything
器物に漆が塗ってある
The utensils are lacquered―japanned.
漆がところどころはげている
The lacquer is off in places.
漆にかせる
to be poisoned with lacquer

content:
うるみ〔潤み〕
〈名〉Dimness; dullness; a film (over one's eyes)

content.content: 目に潤みがある
The eyes are dim.

content:
うるむ〔潤む〕
〈自動〉To dim; to become dim; to become dull

content.content: 目が潤む
One's eyes dim―grow dim―mist―water―fill with tears―swim with tears―A film comes over one's eyes.
潤んだ目
dim eyes
目が潤んでいる
The eyes are dim.

うるめいわし〔潤目鰯〕
〈名〉The mackerel-sardine

content:
うるわしき〔麗しき〕
〈形〉Beautiful

content.content: 麗しき天候
beautiful weather―fair weather
殿にはご機嫌麗しく
My lord was gracious.
麗しき尊顔を拝し恐悦に存じ奉る
I am rejoiced to behold your lordship in such excellent health.
龍顔麗しく還幸あらせられたり
His Majesty returned in excellent health.

content:
うれ〔売れ〕
〈名〉Sale

content.content: この本は売れはどうか
How does the book sell?
売れが好い
It sells well.
売れが悪い
It does not sell.
安い品は売れが好い
Cheap articles are in great demand.
価が高いとどうしても売れが悪い
High-priced articles are in small demand.

content:
うれあし〔売れ足〕
〈名〉Sale; demand

content.content: この品は売れ足が早い
These goods are quick of sale―in great demand.
売れ足が遅い
They are slow of sale―in small demand.

うれい〔患い〕
〈名〉A disease; an evil

content:
うれい〔憂い〕
〈名〉
1. (=憂愁)sorrow; grief

content.content: 明治天皇の崩御ありし時は全国が憂いに沈んだ
At the demise of Meiji Tenno, the whole nation was plunged in grief.
彼は眉宇間に憂いの雲を宿している
His brow is clouded with sorrow.
憂いを払う
to dispel sorrow―dissipate grief
酒は憂いの玉箒{たまはばき}
“Wine maketh glad the heart of man.”
人生字を知るは憂いの始め
Knowledge is the beginning of sorrow―Sorrow begins with knowledge―Knowledge is sorrow.
憂い顔
a sorrowful face

content: 2. (=虞れ{おそれ})fear; danger; liability; possibility

content.content: 何々の憂いがある
There are fears of failure―One is liable to error―One is in danger of death―One is threatened with death―One runs a chance of failure.
人は誤る憂いがある
Man is liable to error.
木造の家は火災の憂いがある
A wooden house is liable to fire.
石造の家は火災の憂い無し
A stone house is free from fire―safe from fire―secure from fire.
船は難破の憂いあり
The ship is in danger of being wrecked―threatened with destruction.
彼は生命を失う憂いがある
He is in danger of losing his life―in peril of his life―threatened with loss of life.
亡国の憂いあり
The country is in peril of going to ruin.
投機は失敗の憂いがある
A speculation is liable to failure.
君はそんなことをすると失敗の憂いがあるぞ
You will run a chance of failure.
土地が低いから水害の憂いがある
The lowness of the land makes it liable to floods.
土地が高いから水害の憂いが無い
The height of the land frees it from floods.
彼は大臣になる憂いがある
There are some fears of his becoming a Minister.
抵当を取っておけば損をする憂いが無い
The security will secure me from loss.
この商売は損をする憂いが無い
This business is secure from loss―free from risks.
日本は絶対的に外敵襲来の憂い無し
Japan is absolutely secure from foreign invasion.
青天井は落ちる憂い無し(と乞食言う)
There is no fear of―no danger of―the blue sky falling.
失敗の憂い無きように万全の策をとる
We shall resort to sure means to preclude the possibility of failure―to obviate the possibility of failure.

content: 3. (=心配)anxiety; solicitude; care

content.content: 僕は憂いに悩んでいる
I am oppressed with doubts and anxieties.
内顧の憂い
family cares―household cares―domestic cares
君は内顧の憂いが無いから好い
You are free from family cares.
良妻は夫をして内顧の憂い無からしむ
A good wife will free her husband from family cares.
後顧の憂い
solicitude about one's home―family cares
僕は後顧の憂いがある
I am solicitous about my home―I have family cares.
後顧の憂いがあっては充分に働けぬ
Solicitude about one's home will hinder one's activity.
戦線に立つ将卒をして後顧の憂い無からしめよ
Let the officers and men at the front be freed from solicitude about their homes!
後顧の憂い無く思いきって遊んでみたい
I should like to have my fling free from care.
後顧の憂いを断つ
to leave one no cause for solicitude―free one from care
彼は妻を離別して後顧の憂いを断った
He divorced his wife to free himself from family cares.

content: 4. (=患憂)a calamity; a disaster; a danger; a curse

content.content: 民情軽薄は当世の憂いである
The levity of the people is the curse of the age.
遠き慮り{おもんぱかり}ある者は近き憂い無し
Prudence averts danger―“A danger foreseen is avoided.”
遠き慮り無き者は近き憂いあり
Imprudence courts danger.

うれいがお〔憂い顔〕
〈名〉A sorrowful face

content:
うれえ〔患え〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: うれい〔患い〕

content:
うれえ〔憂え〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: うれい〔憂い〕

content:
うれえる〔患える〕
〈他動〉To suffer from(a disease); to be troubled with (a disease); to be afflicted with (a disease); to be ill with (a fever)

content.content: 病を患う
to suffer from a disease
彼は病を患えている
He is suffering from a disease―troubled with a disease―afflicted with a disease.
肺病を患えている
He is suffering from consumption―afflicted with consumption―a martyr to consumption―consumptive―a consumptive.

content:
うれえる〔憂える〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=悲しむ)to grieve; to sorrow; to lament

content.content: 彼は武士道の廃頽を憂えている
He laments the decay of Bushido.
教育界の為に憂うべきことは人材の欠乏である
The dearth of talent in the educational world is to be lamented.
高山彦九郎は皇室の式微を憂えた
Takayama Hikokuro lamented the decay of the Imperial House.
彼の両親は彼の放蕩を憂えている
His parents grieve at his evil courses.
君の為に憂う
I grieve for you.
亡国を憂うる
to lament the ruin of one's country―(事前なら)―fear for the safety of one's country
心中ひそかに憂えた
I grieved inwardly―groaned in spirit.

content: 2. (=心配する)to be anxious (about anything); to be concerned (about anything); to be solicitous (about anything); to be troubled, trouble oneself (about anything); to be distressed, distress oneself (about anything); to fear (for one's safety, etc.)

content.content: 憂うるなかれ
Be not troubled!
国家の将来を憂う
I am concerned about the future of my country.
国を憂うる
to fear for the safety of the land―prophesy evil
国を憂うるはやすく国を救うは難し
It is easy to prophesy evil, but hard to avert it.
身の行く末を憂えている
I am solicitous about my future.
これは社会の風教上憂うべきことである
This is a matter of grave concern to public morals.

content:
うれくち〔売れ口〕
〈名〉A market (for one's goods); demand; sale

content.content: この品は売れ口があるか
Is there a market for these goods?
この品は売れ口が無い
There is no market for these goods―There is no demand for these goods―These goods are dead stock―These goods are a drug in the market.
英語の先生はいくらも売れ口がある
English teachers are in great demand―much sought after.
卒業生は売れ口が無くて困っている
The graduates are going a-begging.
あの娘はまだ売れ口が無い
She has not yet had an offer of marriage.
この品は売れ口が好い
These goods are marketable―salable―merchantable―in demand―in request.
これは売れ口の悪い品だ
This is an unmarketable article―an unsalable article―a dull article.
実力の有る者は売れ口には困らぬ
Real ability is sure of a market.

うれさき〔売れ先〕
〈名〉The buyer

content:
うれしい〔嬉しい〕
〈主観的自動詞〉To rejoice, be rejoiced (at the news―over the event); to be glad (of it―that it is so); to be pleased, be delighted (at something); to be happy; to congratulate oneself (on one's escape, etc.)

content.content: やれ嬉しや
Oh, how glad I am!
試験が済んで嬉しいだろう
Are you not glad that the examination is over?―glad of the examination being over?
今日は休みだ、おお嬉しい
There is no school today. I am so glad!
君が来てくれたのが嬉しい
I am pleased at your coming―delighted at your coming.
お目にかかって嬉しゅう存じます
I am glad to see you―rejoiced to see you―delighted to see you.
何がそんなに嬉しいのだ
Why are you so glad?―What makes you so glad?
危ないところを助かってまあ好かった実に嬉しい
I congratulate myself on my narrow escape.
彼の無邪気なところが嬉しいね
I am pleased at his guileless innocence.
ああ嬉しいと思ったのはほんの束の間
My joy was short-lived.
ああ嬉しいと思ったのは束の間でまた心配の種ができた
After the first flush of joy was over, I had another cause for anxiety.
嬉しくて黙っていられなかった
I could not contain myself for joy.
嬉しくてなにもかも打ち忘れた
I forgot everything for very joy.
あまり嬉しくてなにもかも打ち忘れた
I forgot everything in my joy.
嬉しくて手の舞い足の踏むところを知らなかった
I was transported with joy―in a transport of joy.
お手紙を嬉しく拝見致しました
I have read your letter with pleasure―Your letter has afforded me much pleasure.
嬉しいことには子どもが生きていた
To my joy the child was alive.
逢うて嬉しや
What a joy it is to meet!
別れの辛さ
How hard it is to part!
逢うて別れが
Would that we could ever meet,
無けりゃ好い
Never, never to part!

content: 〈客観的形容詞〉Joyful (news); glad (tidings); delightful (meeting); happy (reunion); pleasant (dream); welcome (sunshine, etc.)

content.content: 嬉しい便りを聞いた
I have heard joyful news―glad tidings.
長降りの後の照りは嬉しい
Sunshine is welcome after a long rain.
旱魃の雨は嬉しい
Rain is welcome after a drought.
寒い時は火が嬉しい
Warm fire is pleasant―welcome―in cold weather.
癪に嬉しい男の力
How welcome is a man's strength in a fit of spasm!
僕は嬉しいことがある
I have cause for joy.
君は何か嬉しいことがあるか
Have you any cause for joy?
彼は何か嬉しいことがあると見えてニコニコしている
He must have some cause for joy, for he looks happy.
二人は嬉しい仲になっている
They are lovers―in love with each other.

content:
うれしがらせ〔嬉しがらせ〕
〈名〉Flattery

content.content: 嬉しがらせを言う
to flatter one―tickle one's ear―tickle one's vanity
そう嬉しがらせを言うものじゃないことよ
You are too flattering.

うれしがらせる〔嬉しがらせる〕
〈他動〉To gladden (one); to rejoice (one); to please (one); to delight (one); to flatter (one); to tickle one's ear; to tickle one's vanity

content:
うれしがる〔嬉しがる〕
〈自動〉To be glad (of something―that something happened); to be happy; to rejoice, be rejoiced (at the news―over an event); to be pleased, be delighted (at something); to congratulate oneself (on one's escape); to hug oneself (on or for one's success, etc.)

content.content: 彼は嬉しがってにこにこしている
He looks happy.
皆試験が済んで嬉しがっている
Everybody is glad that the examination is over―glad of the examination being over.
子どもがお母さんを見て嬉しがる
The child rejoices at the sight of its mother―rejoices to see mamma.
彼は九死に一生を得て嬉しがっている
He congratulates himself on his narrow escape.
成功して嬉しがっている
He hugs himself on his success.
彼女はお世辞を言われてたいそう嬉しがっている
She feels herself highly flattered by the compliment.
独りでほくほく嬉しがる
to chuckle to oneself―hug oneself

content:
うれしげ〔嬉しげ〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: うれしそう〔嬉しそう〕

content:
うれしさ〔嬉しさ〕
〈名〉Joy; delight

content.content: 嬉しさは言わん方無し
My joy is indescribable―My joy knows no bounds.
嬉しさの余り何事も打ち忘れた
I forgot everything in the excess of my joy―in my joy.
あまりの嬉しさに胸が迫ってものが言えなかった
I could not speak in the fulness of my heart.

content:
うれしそう〔嬉しそう〕
〈形〉Joyful (face); glad (air); happy (look):(=に) gladly; joyfully; with a glad air

content.content: 君は嬉しそうにニコニコしている
You look happy.
彼は嬉しそうな顔をしている
He has a glad look―a joyful countenance.
子どもらは嬉しそうに食卓に就く
The children sit down to table with a glad air―with a joyful countenance.

content:
うれしなき〔嬉し泣き〕
〈名〉Crying for joy

content.content: 嬉し泣きに泣く
to cry for joy―weep for joy
日本海の捷報に接して全く嬉し泣きに泣いた者があった
Some people fairly wept for joy at the news of the victory of the Japan Sea.

content:
うれしなみだ〔嬉し涙〕
〈名〉Tears of joy

content.content: 嬉し涙を流す
to shed tears of joy―cry tears of joy―weep tears of joy

content:
うれだか〔売れ高〕
〈名〉The amount of sale; sales

content.content: 売れ高二割の歩合をやる
You shall have a commission of 20 percent on sales.
新聞の売れ高
the circulation of a newspaper

content:
うれっこ〔売れっ子〕
〈名〉A public favourite; a public idol; popular person; a lion; one who is much sought after

content.content: あの先生はなかなか売れっ子だ
He is much sought after.
嬢は交際界の売れっ子だ
She is much run after in society.
あの芸者はたいそう売れっ子だ
She is a universal favourite.

content:
うれのこり〔売れ残り〕
〈名〉Goods left unsold; remainder of goods

content.content: まだ売れ残りがある
There are some left unsold.
本の売れ残り
copies left unsold―remainder

content:
うれのこる〔売れ残る〕
〈自動〉To be left unsold; to remain unsold; to lie unsold

content.content: だいぶ売れ残っている
A large lot remains unsold―lies unsold.
売れ残ると困るから此品はたんと仕入れません
We do not lay in a large stock of these goods for fear of having them left (unsold) on our hands.

content:
うれゆき〔売れ行き〕
〈名〉Sale; demand

content.content: この本は売れ行きはどうか
How does the book sell?
売れ行きが好い
It sells well―It commands a good sale―It has a considerable run―It is in great demand―in great request.
この本は非常な売れ行きだ
The book is selling the wildfire―There is a rush on the book.
売れ行きが悪い
It does not sell―It is in no great demand―in small request.
売れ行きが早い、売れ行きが遅い
It is quick of sale―slow of sale.

content:
うれゆく〔売れ行く〕
〈自動〉To sell; to go off

content.content: 品物は盛んに売れ行く、ドンドン売れ行く
The goods go off like anything.

content:
うれる〔売れる〕
〈自動〉
1. To be sold; to sell; to command a sale; to be salable; to be marketable; to be merchantable; to be in demand; to be in request:(新聞は)to enjoy a (large or small) circulation

content.content: 家が売れたか
Is the house sold?―Have you sold the house?
売れました
It is sold―I have sold it.
家は好い値に売れた
The house sold at a good price.
一万円に売れた
It sold for 10,000 yen.
本が売れるか
Does the book sell?
本は好く売れる
The book sells very well―The book commands a good sale―The book is in great demand―The book has a considerable run―There is a strong run on the book.
本は飛ぶように売れる
The book is selling like wildfire―There is a rush for the book―There is a rush on the book.
この品は好く売れる
These goods sell well―command a good sale―These goods are in great demand―in good request―We find a ready for these goods.
この品はちっとも売れない
These goods do not sell―There is no demand for these goods.
思わしく売れない
They do not command a satisfactory sale.
この品は値段にしては好く売れる
The article sells well for its price.
この品は好い値に売れる
These goods sell at a good price―fetch a good price―command a good price.
いくら高くとも売れる
They sell at any price―command any price.
この品はいくらに売れるか
What does this article sell for?―go for?―fetch?
十円に売れる
It sells for 10 yen―It is going for 10 yen―It fetches 10 yen.
値打ちだけに売れるか
Does it sell for what it is worth?―go for what it is worth?
値打ちだけに売れない
It does not sell for what it is worth―It goes for less than what it is worth.
半値にしか売れない
It is selling for half its price―going for half its price.
この新聞は実業界に好く売れる
The paper enjoys a large circulation in business circles.
売れる品
salable goods―marketable goods―merchantable goods
売れない品
unsalable goods―dead stock―a drug in the market

content: 2. (=顔や名が売れる)to be known; to be popular

content.content: 彼はある社会に顔が売れている
He is well known among certain people.
小説家として読書界に名が売れている
He is well known as a novelist to the reading public―He is a popular novelist.

content:
うろ〔烏鷺〕
〈名〉Black and white; the game of go

content.content: 烏鷺を戦わす
to play go

content:
うろ〔雨露〕
〈名〉Rain (and dew)

content.content: 雨露をしのぐ
to shelter oneself from the rain―take shelter from the rain―keep out the rain
雨露だけはしのいでいる
We are under cover.
屋根にて雨露をしのぐ
The roof shelters us from the rain.
ほんのあばら屋でようやく雨露をしのぐだけだ
It is a tumble-down cottage that will barely shelter you from the rain―barely keep out the rain.
どうかこうか雨露をしのいでいる
We have a roof over us―We have something to live undeer―We are under cover.
彼らは雨露もしのげない
They have no shelter―no roof over their heads―nothing to shelter them from the rain.
雨露さえしのげりゃどうでもよい
I am ready to accept anything in the way of shelter―anything over my head―anything to sleep under.
神社で一夜の雨露をしのいだ
I took shelter in a shrine for the night―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A shrine afforded me shelter for the night.
雨露にさらす
to expose anything to the elements

content:
ウロウロ
〈副〉
1. (=うろついて)hoveringly:(=する) to hover (about or over anything)

content.content: 馬賊が旅人のまわりをウロウロして隙を狙っている
The bandits hover about travellers, watching for a chance to attack them.
烏の群が死骸の上をウロウロしている
A cloud of crows are hovering over the corpse.

content: 2. (=うろたえて)in confusion:(=する) to be in confusion; to be confused

content.content: 火事の最中に一人お婆さんが位牌を抱えてウロウロしておった
In the midst of the fire, an old woman was hobbling about in confusion with ancestral tablets in her arms.

うろうろぶね〔ウロウロ舟〕
〈名〉A bumboat

content:
うろおぼえ〔虚覚え〕
〈名〉A faint recollection; a dim recollection

content.content: その人は何でも立派な紳士であったようにうろ覚えに覚えている
I have a vague impression that he was a fine gentleman.

content:
うろこ〔鱗〕
〈名〉A scale

content.content: 魚の鱗を落とす
to scale a fish

content:
うろたえ
〈名〉Confusion; consternation; dismay; bewilderment; flurry:(=る) to be confused; to be in confusion; to be thrown into confusion; to be consternated; to be dismayed; to be dismay; to be bewildered; to be flurried; to lose one's wits; to lose one's presence of mind; to lose one's head

content.content: 敵は不意を打たれてうろたえた
The enemy, taken by surprise, were thrown into confusion.
うろたえて逃げた
They fled in confusion.
市民はうろたえて右往左往に逃げまわった
The townsfolk ran hither and thither in fear and consternation.
うろたえてどうしてよいかわからなかった
They were in such dismay that they did not know what to do―They were frightened out of their wits.
あの人はどんなことがあっても決してうろたえるということが無い
He never loses his head―He always keeps his head.

content:
うろつく
〈自動〉To hover (about a caravan); to hang (about a tavern); to prowl (about a house); to wander (about the world); to rove (about the country)

content.content: うさん臭い奴が家のまわりにうろついている
A suspicious-looking fellow is prowling about the house―on the prowl about the house.
彼は一日居酒屋の辺にうろついている
He hangs about taverns all day.
馬賊が旅人のまわりをうろついて隙を狙っている
The bandits hover about travellers, watching for a chance to attack them.
彼は世界中をうろついた末日本へ流れ込んだ
After wandering about the world,―roving about the world,―knocking about the world,―he drifted into Japan.

content:
うろぬく〔虚抜く〕
〈他動〉To thin out

content.content: 大根をうろ抜く
to thin out the radishes

content:
うろん〔胡乱〕
〈形〉Suspicious; suspicious-looking

content.content: 胡乱な人物があの家に出入する
That house is frequented by suspicious characters.
胡乱な奴がこの家のまわりを徘徊している
A suspicious-looking fellow is prowling about the house.

うーろんちゃ〔烏龍茶〕
〈名〉Oolong tea

うわあご〔上顎〕
〈名〉
1. The upper jaw
2. (=口蓋)the palate

うわあしどり〔上足取〕
〈名〉(=株式の上足取)An upward tendency

うわえ〔上絵〕
〈名〉Figures (on cloth or pottery)

うわおおい〔上覆い〕
〈名〉An outer cover; an outer covering

うわがき〔上書き〕
〈名〉The superscription, the address (of a letter):(=する) to superscribe, address (a letter)

うわがみ〔上紙〕
〈名〉A paper cover

content:
うわかわ〔上皮〕
〈名〉
1. (=表皮)the cuticle; the epidermis
2. (液体の上皮)film:(煮物などの泡でできた上皮)scum

content.content: 上皮を取る
to skim milk―scum boiling liquor

content: 3. (=上辺)outward show; outward appearance

content.content: ロシア人の文明は上皮だけだ
The Russians have a veneer of civilization―“Scratch a Russian, and you will find a Tartar.”

content:
うわき〔浮気〕
〈名〉Inconstancy; inconstant affections; fickleness; ranging fancy:(=な) inconstant; fickle; profligate:(=する) to gad after other women

content.content: 女が男の浮気を責めた
She reproached him with inconstancy.
浮気をする
(男なら)to go after other women―gad after other women―(男女共)―be false (to a man or a woman)―(宗教上なら)―go after other gods―go a-whoring after strange gods
浮気をせぬ
(男なら)to be true―(to one woman)―(男女共)―be faithful―be true―(to one man or woman)―(何事に限らず)―to stick to one person or thing
浮気をしちゃいけませんよ
Be true to me!
頭禿げても浮気は止まぬ
He is an old sinner.→『うわきもの〔浮気者〕』
浮気家業
a gay profession
浮気家業をした女が堅気になるとかえって堅いものだ
A woman who has followed a gay profession, on returning to honest life, will be found to be positively virtuous.

content:
うわぎ〔上衣〕
〈名〉A coat:(軍服の上衣)a tunic:(婦人の長い上衣)a gown:(少年の短い上衣)a jacket

content.content: 上衣を着る
to put on a coat―(常になら)―wear a coat
上衣を脱ぐ
to take on one's coat
僕は上衣を脱いで仕事をする
I work in my shirt-sleeves.
兵は上衣を脱いで働いた
The men were stript to the waist.

うわきもの〔浮気者〕
〈名〉(男なら)a licentious man; a dissolute man:(女なら)a profligate woman; a skittish woman; a light woman; a light-o'-love; a flirt

content:
うわぐすり〔上薬〕
〈名〉Glaze

content.content: 瀬戸物に上薬をかける
to glaze pottery

うわくちびる〔上唇〕
〈名〉The upper lip

うわぐつ〔上靴〕
〈名〉
1. (=上履き)slippers
2. (=雨靴)(英国にては)galoshes:(米国にては)overshoes; rubber-shoes

content:
うわこと
〈名〉
1. (=熱に浮かされて言うと取りとめも無いこと)delirium

content.content: 熱にうかされてうわことを言う
to be delirious―in a delirium

content: 2. (=たわこと)nonsense

うわごと
〈名〉→『

content.content: うわこと

content:
うわさ〔噂〕
〈名〉
1. A rumour; a report; gossip; talk:(=する) to rumour; to gossip; to talk about (any one)

content.content: 昨晩君の噂をした
We were taking about you last night―Were your ears burning last night?
誰か僕の噂をしているとみえてクシャミが出る
Somebody must be talking about me―My ears are burning.
あなたの噂がよく出ます
We often talk about you.
来た人は誰かと思えばしかも今まで噂をしておったその主人公じゃないか
Who should come but the very man we had been talking about?
また戦争が始まるという噂だ
There is a rumour―It is rumoured―Rumour says―Rumour has it―that there is going to be another war.
世間の噂ではその人はまだ生きておるそうだ
Rumour has it that the man is still alive.
噂が東京中に広まっている
The rumour has spread all over the town.
彼は世間の噂になっている
He is the talk of the town.
その事件が世間の噂になった
The affair got wind―took air.
二人の関係は町内の噂になった
Their relations became the talk of the neighbourhood.
二人の哀れな恋は村の噂に残っている
Their sad loves live in village gossip.
あの女は浮いた噂などは無い
She never lent herself to romance.
世間では寄ると触るとその噂で持ち切っている
People talk of nothing else.
世間の噂はしかたがない
People will talk.
世間の噂にかまうな
Let people talk (and curs bark)!
噂に聞く
to hear of a person or thing
その人のことは噂には聞いているが逢ったことは無い
I have heard of such a man,―I know of such a man,―but I never met him.
人の噂も七十五日
“A wonder lasts but nine days.”
人の噂も七十五日で世間ではじきに忘れてしまった
It was a nine day's wonder.
湯屋と床屋は噂の問屋
Go to a public bath or a barber's shop to hear news of the town.
坊間の噂
a current rumour―a flying rumour
根も葉も無い噂
a groundless rumour―an unfounded report

content:
2. 
〈動詞付〉

content.content: 噂を立てる
to circulate a rumour―give currency to a rumour―give rise to a rumour―set a rumour afloat
噂が立つ
A rumour gets afloat―A rumour gets abroad―A rumour runs current―A rumour circulates.
噂が立っている
A rumour is afloat―A rumour is abroad―A rumour is current―A rumour is in circulation.
その時彼が欠席したために死んだという噂が立った
His absence on the occasion gave rise to the rumour that he was dead.
二人の関係から悪い噂が立った
Their relations gave rise to scandal.
あの人は悪い噂が絶えない
He is always giving rise to come scandal or other.

うわしき〔上敷〕
〈名〉(=寝床の上敷)A sheet

content:
うわすべり〔上滑り〕
〈名〉Shallowness; superficiality

content.content: あの人は何事も上滑りだ
He has a superficial knowledge of everything―He never goes deep into any subject.

うわずみ〔上澄み〕
〈名〉Clear liquor which gathers on the top of a brewing-vat

うわぞうり〔上草履〕
〈名〉Indoor sandals; slippers

content:
うわちょうし〔上調子〕
〈形〉Flippant; frivolous

content.content: 彼の演説は上調子だ
He is a flippant speaker.
あの人のすることは女の子のように上調子だ
His conduct shows the frivolity of a girl―the levity of a girl.

うわつく〔浮つく〕
〈自動〉To be fickle; to be inconstant

うわづつみ〔上包み〕
〈名〉An outer wrapper

うわっぱり〔上っ張り〕
〈名〉An overwear; an overall

うわづみ〔上積み〕
〈名〉The upper load (in the hold of ship); an upper layer (of goods)

content:
うわつら〔上面〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: うわべ〔上辺〕

content:
うわて〔上わ手〕
〈名〉A better hand; a superior; an overmatch

content.content: 人の上手{うわて}に出る
to outdo―outshine―eclipse―beat―a person
彼は師匠の上手だ
He has outdone his master―eclipsed his master.
英語は君の方が上手だ
You beat me in English.
僕は一つ上手に出てやった
I went one better.
その話なら上手がある
I can cap that story.
上手に上手あり
“Diamond cut diamond.”

content:
うわぬり〔上塗り〕
〈名〉The last coat (of paint or plaster):(=する) to give the last coat (of paint or plaster)

content.content: 損の上塗りする
to throw good money after bad
僅かばかりの貸金を訴えては損の上塗りだ
To sue for a small debt is throwing good money after bad.
恥の上塗りする
to make oneself doubtly ridiculous
一度失敗したら止せば好いのに恥の上塗りをしてしまった
Not content with a single failure, he must go and make another mess of it.

content:
うわのそら〔上の空〕
〈名〉Absence of mind; abstraction; inattention:(形容詞に用いれば)absent-minded; abstracted; inattentive:(=で) absent-mindedly; abstractedly; inattentively

content.content: 上の空で聴いている者が多い
Many are inattentive listeners.
君は上の空で聴いているからわからないのだ
You do not understand, because you do not pay attention.
彼はいつも上の空で人がものを尋ねても返事もせぬ
He is always abstracted―absent-minded―and never answers your questions.
心は上の空
His mind is far away.
客の心も上の空
I don't care what my patron may think.

うわのり〔上乗り〕
〈名〉(=船荷の上乗り)A supercargo

うわば〔上歯〕
〈名〉The upper teeth

うわばたらき〔上働き〕
〈名〉A parlour-maid

うわばみ〔蛯蛇〕
〈名〉The boa; the boa-constrictor; the anaconda

うわばり〔上張り〕
〈名〉Facing; veneer:(=する) to face (a wall with stone); to veneer (wood with mahogany)

content:
うわひげ〔上鬚〕
〈名〉A moustache

content.content: 上鬚をひねる
to twirl one's moustache

うわびょうし〔上表紙〕
〈名〉An outer cover (of a book)

content:
うわべ〔上辺〕
〈名〉
1. (=表面、外面)the surface; the exterior; the outside:(=の) superficial; outside; outward:(=は) on the surface; on the outside; without

content.content: あの人の親切はうわべだけだ
He is kind only on the surface.
女というものはうわべは菩薩でも心は鬼だ
Woman is an angel without, a fiend within.
うわべはボロを着ても心には錦を飾っている
He is a beggar without, but a gentleman within.

content: 2. (=外見、概観)outside appearance; outside show:(=の) outside; outward; apparent; seeming; ostensible; professed:(=は) outwardly; apparently; seemingly; ostensibly; professedly

content.content: 彼の宗教はうわべばかりだ
His religion is a mere show.
彼はうわべだけの友人だ
He is a fair-weather friend.
それはうわべの理由に過ぎぬ
That is only an ostensible reason.
うわべは商用で上京したのだ
He has come to town ostensibly―professedly―on commercial business.
うわべを飾る
to dissemble―dissimulate

content:
うわまえ〔上前〕
〈名〉
1. (=着物の上前)the outer breast (of a coat) the outer fold (of a Japanese gown)
2. (=棒先、かすり)a commission; squeeze:(米国にては)graft

content.content: 上前をはねる
to take commissions―squeeze―(米国にては)―take graft
日本の将校は兵員給料の上前をはねるようなことはしない
Japanese officers do not squeeze the men―cheat the men out of their pay.
泥棒の上前をはねる
to outwit the lawyer

content:
うわむき〔上向〕
〈名〉
1. Looking up; an upward look

content.content: 上向きになる
to look up

content: 2. (=相場の上向き)an upward tendency

content.content: 物価は上向きだ
The prices are looking up―on the rise―on the advance.
市場は強気で上向きだ
The market is strong.
上向き市場
a bull market
